Content: We're a long term business client accepting payments via Stripe. The customer service is very easy to contact but the responses are often sub-par. One representative will understand your request, they'll transfer you to a colleague, you'll need to repeat everything all over again, the new person won't read the notes and they'll refer you to a support article that isn't relevant at all. It's a lot of time wasted and it feels like going in circles.

Content: It interesting to note that there is no connected phone number, email or ANY means of connecting with Stripe about their fraudulent merchant processing. Their customer (Saman) used a web redirect to get a fraudulent collector coin order (for $133). In other words, it was a different company all the way until the order placement screen and the fact that it was Saman was disguised thru a last minute redirect. Saman sends an unbelievable amount of emails, but offers no response. They have a phony tracking number for your order and their phone has been disconnected. What sort of background check does Stripe do on their merchants? So, Saman operates out of an empty 750 sq ft Condo in Brooklyn, has no store front (Straw Man operation) and does not respond to emails once they have your money. This must be why Stripe does no background check on their merchants for processing - Saman is a foreign national from England so this has to be taken up with the State Department and District Attorney's office. Evidently, a BBB complaint must be filed and this is now a federal matter concerning the FTC and the FBI (it's across state lines) and the Secretary of State. Hope Stripe enjoys all the attention. Was it worth it to Stripe to collect that $4 processing fee? Let's find out!!!
Name: Nick
Reply: Hi Nick, thanks for bringing this to our attention. Stripe does not condone nor support such activities. Please email us at heretohelp@stripe.com with more details, and we’ll investigate this from our side.

Content: As a long-term user of Stripe for processing payments, we have encountered several challenges that have led to significant dissatisfaction. Initially, contacting their customer service was straightforward, but the response times were often excessively long. Our experience took a turn for the worse when a client requested a refund shortly after a transaction. Stripe deducted fees from both the client's transaction and our account, resulting in our account going negative. The combined fees exceeded 20% of the transaction amount, which seemed unfair.
Name: InstaPayUAE
Reply: Hi there, we're incredibly sorry to hear the experience has been less than positive here. When you create a refund, the full amount of the payment is returned to your customer. However, your Stripe fees are not refunded to you for refunds. This means that you'll see both the amount for the refund pulled from your balance, as well as the Stripe fee amount: https://support.stripe.com/questions/understanding-fees-for-refunded-payments

Content: Stripe has been a nightmare for my business. After verifying my account and confirming with an agent that there were no issues with receiving high-volume payouts, Stripe deactivated my account and paused my payouts as soon as I received a significant order on my Shopify store. Their agent assured me over the phone that my account was set up correctly to handle these payments, yet when the funds actually arrived, they blocked my account without warning. To make matters worse, they even told my customer that my website wasn’t taking real orders, which is completely false and damaging to my reputation. I’ve submitted all the required documents again, but Stripe’s handling of this situation has been nothing but misleading, unprofessional, and financially harmful. Avoid Stripe if you value reliable service and honest support.

Content: We launched our online Membership Rewards platform just two nights ago, but Stripe has already suspended our account, wrongly accusing us of operating a gambling site, which we are not. Our business model is standard and widely used by other membership rewards clubs who have no issues with Stripe as their payment gateway. We’re frustrated by the lack of explanation for this decision and the poor support we've received. Running a business with such inadequate support is incredibly challenging. We have every right to be utilising this system as much as everyone else. Our system is fully compliant with all terms and conditions and is in no way associated with illegal gambling, or any gambling at all for that matter. We expect a proper explanation or a review of this.

Title: Stripe left Us Without Options Overnight

Content: I wish I could give 0 stars because It does not deserve any good reviews. I opened up an account with them after opening an account with FreshBooks. Freshbooks had recommended Stripe as a payment platform so I decided to go ahead and get set up with them. I made an account with stripe and the first few small payments of $290-$375 went fine. No problems, but then I had a customer make a payment for $1,755 and that’s when It all went terribly wrong. They stated my business was a “high risk” and stated that they were withholding the funds until I could provided further documentation that the company was a legitimate business. Which I then did so. I provided legal documentation including the certificate of formation. At first they had accepted It and within minutes they denied It. I tried to send more information including business bank statements which they also asked for but they would not allow me to prove that my business was legit anymore. This happened nearly a month ago. They still have not given the money to me nor have their refunded It to my customer like they stated that they were going to in their email. They said It would take roughly 5 business days. They also took $ 618.33 out of the payment that was made by my customer which was $1,755 for so called “fees” which they also would not explain what the fees were for. I tried calling and emailing. The email responses are a joke and do not provide very much information. Then when you call all they tell you and will tell you is It is being put under investigation to see what happened. Which by the way it’s nearly impossible to get ahold of them by phone. I still have not received a response from the last time I emailed. They really should be shut down and Google should absolutely not recommend this company. Freshbooks/Stripewas one of their top rated small business invoice platforms.

Reply: Hi there, we’re sorry to hear about your experience. If you believe you’ve been fraudulently charged, we strongly recommend contacting the concerned business first to resolve the issue. However, if the business is unresponsive or the solution unsatisfactory, the next step is to file a dispute with your bank. When you file a dispute, your bank passes all relevant details to Stripe, and we use this data in our ongoing effort to combat fraud. You can learn more about disputing a purchase made through Stripe here: https://support.stripe.com/questions/disputing-a-purchase-made-through-stripe.

Content: If I could go back in time and choose another company to avoid the horrific experience I've had with Stripe, I would in a heartbeat. They are withholding nearly $2,000 from our small fundraising event, claiming we haven't received the transfer because I allegedly listed our account number incorrectly. This could not be true at all considering we received completed transfers from Stripe both before and after the dates of the missing transactions. It has taken weeks of uploading and re-uploading documents while their support team tells me I'm missing documents although I had uploaded more than what was requested of me from them. Finally, when I mentioned to them all the terrible reviews I was reading about them withholding money from other companies they came up with the above "solution", which turned out to be a non solution since my account number was never incorrect in the first place and I STILL HAVEN'T RECEIVED THIS MONEY FROM THEM. $2,000 is taking an extreme toll on the operation of our event this year as we are now having to rearrange funds after being robbed by stripe.

You can learn more about disputing a purchase made through Stripe here: https://support.stripe.com/questions/disputing-a-purchase-made-through-stripe. Content: I got tickets for a concert through jaly concerts.  They use stripe to process payments. This event was rescheduled to a date I can not attend.  I have requested a refund and was told via email the refund has been requested. I am yet to see the money. Skiddle handled the issuing of tickets for jaly concerts the organisers,  and Stripe handled the funds. I just want my money back.
Name: Deb Liddicott
Reply: Hi Deb, we’re sorry to hear about this, and we want to provide clarity to support you. Stripe is a payments processor that works with businesses to help them accept payments through their websites, apps, and stores. As a result, we do not have the authority to issue a refund or check the status of the request, on behalf of merchants. Only the merchant can issue a refund/check refund status and therefore the best next steps would be to reach out to them directly.
Title: Where is my refund

Content: ***AFTER READING RESPONSE FROM STRIPE-I DO NOT CARE THAT THE ACCOUNT IS CLOSED, YOU HAVE CHOSEN TO NOT REFUND 16K FROM MY CUSTOMERS BUT REFUNDED OTHER TRANSACTIONS MADE ON THE SAME DAY. I AM BEING GIVEN ZERO REASON AS TO WHY THIS IS. I WILL NOT STOP UNTIL MY CUSTOMERS ARE REFUNDED!THIS COMPANY PROVIDES ZERO TRANSPARENCY AND SCRIPTED ANSWERS THAT DO NOT ADDRESS THE ISSUE.Stripe closed my account and is not refunding my customers for absolutely no reason. This is a fraudulent company and needs to be exposed. Report to the New York department of financial services and get your story in social media. We cannot continue to allow them to do this!

Title: Complete Scam

Content: Verification loop. I got my account frozen on my first pay for a service I did to a 3D studio they only use stripe and I thought nothing of it now I have over 1000 frozen and I have requested my employer wait to send me remaining funds as the verification process is a bit scary as they seem scamish. I was request no less than 4 selfies all different from one another and one holding proof of my ID. I did soo with a bit of complaint as its ridiculous. I went forward by submitting the rest of my documents through their links for manual review and still they ask me to use the dashboard which is super finicky and doesnt work as they intend. There is not even a way to push the image through when it is clearly good. Ive been at this for 2 weeks now with no result. My emails are swarmed with different representatives of the team who only send automated messaged and continue this loop. If I knew about this app before joining the 3D team that i did I would refuse stripe payments and request Paypal.

Title: Scammers,

Content: I have literally never had a worse experience with a company in all my life! They make it extremely difficult to do anything with them, you can't even pick up the phone and actually get ahold of some. No, instead you have to go online, talk with an AI generated chat, have to explain what the issue is to a COMPUTER, and then sit and wait for them to call you back. They are not transparent about the initial set-up process, they hide the important information in the back of the website with "fine print" then act like they're the victim when your upset. DO NOT USE STRIPE!!! It takes almost a month to actually get the money you earned from the time you set-up the account!!!! We spoke to them a week ago and they confirmed all of our account information and our business had been fully verified but for some reason we still had to wait another 6 days to be able to have a payout. OK, we wait, today is the day it's supposed to be available, NOT, because immediate payouts aren't available because they need to "verify" us more.

If your issues are still ongoing, please contact us using one of the support options available on https://support.stripe.com/contact/, and we’ll work to resolve your issue as quickly as possible.
Title: I have literally never had a worse experience

Content: DO NOT OPEN AN ACOCUNT. I so wished I read the reviews before I opened an account with stripe. My software business service have US based clientele and despite the heavy commission , I chose do stick with Stripe. On day 1 , I realised that it takes 7 days to clear my payout . I was prepared for that . On day 2 , several of my payments are blocked by stripe saying the transactions are too risky . Day 3 , account closed and the money in my account is reimbursed to the clients , bear in mind, I have no contract with these clients as the payments are already received and business closed . After this happened to me , I read reviews from which I understand that this is not just my experiance, but several others have gone through same process . I feel so terrible that it’s my hard earned money doing 2-3 jobs that is lost . Unacceptable
Name: Ms Sneha Kuniyil
Reply: We appreciate your feedback here, Sneha. We aim to offer our services for all, however, sometimes we aren’t able to support a business for risk, compliance, or regulatory reasons. We’re happy to take another look at the issue you’ve raised here to make sure things are working as intended—we’ll reach out to you via email if we have more information to share.
Title: DO NOT OPEN AN ACOCUNT

Content: Their fees come out to be about 5%, which is higher than most credit card fees. Some people will find the site layout difficult to navigate. They also insist on having a live website for your business, so if you're a boutique firm that does work by referral only, look for something else to process your payments. I went through their process of requesting an exception, but they never sent a decision, only kept asking for a live website. I received a notice today saying they froze my payout function, which prompted me to close the account. I guess the app simply wasn't built for someone like me, but the entire process left a bad taste in my mouth. I will be actively encouraging people to seek other payment platforms because everything about the business model felt greedy and lazy.
Name: asdfasdgaf
Reply: Hi there, thank you for taking the time to provide your feedback with us, and we understand if Stripe isn't the best fit for you right now. As a part of the “Know Your Customer” (KYC) obligations, users are required to have a website. Failure to provide this information may affect some capabilities on the account, such as charges and payouts: https://support.stripe.com/questions/business-website-for-account-activation-faq
Title: Their fees come out to be about 5%

Content: They process payments. You will not get paid. What do you tell your customers? Now your customers think you are not legitimate. You lose valuable customers. You lose money. You go out of business. This company will take your money and make you think you did something wrong. What is the goal? Who is the higher risk? It's a well thought out scheme. They made it big enough to fill pockets of the higher up and there is nothing anyone can do. Averaging 2 out of 5 stars out of 44,000 reviews. Welcome to the corporate greed of America. Oh, and to not have a phone number? Unheard of.
Name: Vincent
Reply: Hi Vincent, thank you for taking the time to provide your feedback with us. There are a number of reasons why a Stripe account may become unsupportable, and we aim to provide as much transparency as possible when things just aren’t a good fit.
Title: Someone Explain

Content: Be careful with the Adaptive Pricing setting! If you sell to customers who use a different currency than yours, the customer pays in their currency, and you're charged for the exchange rate. On top of that, they charge you for using their platform... Stripe says 3.25% + €0.25 for international cards + 2% if currency conversion is required. To be honest I found it misleading...
Name: Beatriz E
Reply: Hi Beatriz—we are sorry that you feel that our fees are misleading. For more information, visit https://stripe.com/pricing on pricing for each of our products. You can also check out https://docs.stripe.com/payments/checkout/adaptive-pricing for more details on the Adaptive Pricing feature.
Title: Be careful with the Adaptive Pricing…

Content: I have a rental in Pensacola fl. My guest booked with me for 4 months. Her first payment was 7,000 stripe put it on a 14 day hold due to making sure it wasn’t fraud. Second payment was 4,000 they sent to me in 2 business days. Third payment was 3,000 they then sent a email to me saying they was closing my account. First they need verification I sent all the paperwork back within 10 minutes had a email saying they couldn’t support my business. I have tried to talk to them about refunding my guest or sending my payments considering my first payment has been sitting there for 18 days. You can’t call them it’s only chat or email. Last email I got said it’s their final email and they can’t discuss anything further with me. I have filed a complaint with BBB and consumer financial protection bureau. It will be a civil or whatever lawsuit it takes to get my guest back her money so I can get paid. It’s been their 5 days for refund process and no refund yet! I would say don’t use this company it’s a scam. They will try to take your money. They have a total of 10,000 of mine.

Content: After a year of trouble-free use, Stripe suddenly deactivated my account, claiming that certain transactions were not authorized by my customers. Which is totally untrue! All the transactions were initiated by the customers themselves, and Stripe refuses to provide me with any evidence to justify their decision. Not only have they blocked my account, but they've also withheld my funds, putting my business in serious difficulty. This is theft pure and simple, and they show no scruples about leaving small businesses struggling without resources. I strongly advise new businesses against doing business with Stripe. Their lack of transparency, empathy, and professionalism is alarming. If you want to avoid serious problems and financial losses, choose another payment solution.

ITS A BUNCH OF THIEVES, BE WARY WHEN YOU SIGN UP FOR THIS COMPANY APPARENTLY THERE IS SOME CLAUSE THAT SAYS THAT THEY CAN KEEP YOUR MONEY FOR ANY REASON THEY DESIRE WHENEVER THEY DESIRE IT. WOW. Title: Completely terrible company

Content: After over 18 years with the same merchant account service, processing millions with almost zero chargebacks, we decided to give Stripe a try for a new online platform tailored to educational institutions, attracted by its integration capabilities. We spent months working with our development team, investing countless hours and hundreds of thousands of dollars into our platform and billing system. When we entered the beta phase with a few educational customers, including one abroad, Stripe’s system flagged a few transactions from abroad and blocked our account, claiming we could appeal.

Title: This company is a scam

Content: I am a small business. Through my Found business card account I signed up to take credit card payments by connecting to Stripe. My account was approved. I work a vendor event and process credit card payments through Stripe for 2 consecutive days. I go into my Found account, I can see the processed payments and the total but when I go to check when they will be released I received a payments paused message. I look into it and they ask for more information. I enter my tax id #, I give a representative name, SSN and photo of driver license and submit it. I now get a message that I'm a risk and payments will remained paused and after 5 days will be returned to customers. I email the company again and explain the goods were purchased and I gave all the required information why would they return my payments...I received an email saying they were sorry but it is a risk to release these payments even though I submitted the required information. So now my small business is out the products sold and the money paid. My business has been robbed by this company. You processed the payments!! If you don't want to process moving forward...that's fine, but the payments you already processed should be released to me. You defrauded and stole from my company.

Title: terrible  company

Content: Avoid Stripe at all costs. They will shut you down over trivial issues. I had a client who first used an Amex credit card on my website, but it was declined. He then used a Chase Bank credit card, which went through without any problems. Stripe contacted me, claiming the first transaction was denied because it wasn't authorized by the customer or the bank. Because of this, they refused to release the successful second transaction payment, the Chase payment, and held onto the customer's money for three weeks. Some of the customers visit our office to pick up their engineering drawings or place orders. During this visit, we instructed the customer to use one of our web-based computer terminals for payment. However, one of these transactions was unfortunately denied.

Name: ozgur guven
Reply: Hi Ozgur, We’re sorry to hear about your experience. If you believe you’ve been fraudulently charged, we strongly recommend contacting the concerned business first to resolve the issue. However, if the business is unresponsive or the solution unsatisfactory, the next step is to file a dispute with your bank. When you file a dispute, your bank passes all relevant details to Stripe, and we use this data in our ongoing effort to combat fraud. You can learn more about disputing a purchase made through Stripe here [0]. You can also check out End Customer FAQ's here [1]. If you have any additional questions, please contact us directly by visiting our support page here [2].

Title: On July 12

Content: If I could I would rate this company 1 star. I am waiting for my account to be verified so I can send money to families who are in desperate need of this financial aid, and this company has been so careless, and dishonest. I am being given the runaround, and now will have to give refunds to all of the people who donated because of the lack of response. Every time I call, or send an email, there is no response from this so called “specialized team.” I’ve spoken to numerous people, including CJ, Catherine, Jess, Andrew, John, Sheryl, and Fritz. All whom have been giving me the same lacklustre response that someone, eventually, at some point, is going to reach out to me. I was told this would take a MAXIMUM of 7 days. IT HAS BEEN ALMOST AN ENTIRE MONTH! I am questioning the ethics of this company, and the ethics of those who work here because every single person I have spoken to has been so dismissive. I am told that they understand my frustrations, that they understand how urgent this matter is, yet not one person has the decency to tell me the truth. No information is being given to me, and apparently I can’t even know who is handling my case. Most likely because no one is handling it! This makes me sick, and I hope you sleep well at night knowing that all of these families are suffering even further because of your lack of care and compassion. Do better.

Content: The electronic payment system I work with stripe.com works smoothly until July 2, 2024. As of this date, stripe.com is suspending my company account. I have customers who have made payments and received their payments, but stripe.com stops the account for no reason and refunds some payments. For example, 3 payments were made from the same account to a customer (7350€, 12250€, 245€), only the last payment, 245€, is refunded, but the others are kept pending for more than 15 days. There is a huge loss here and although we contacted stripe.com about the issue, no proper response was given and the paid amounts are not refunded. Even though I have already provided service for this transaction, trying to pay the payment back to the same customer means making me lose 2x per transaction. However, the amounts claimed to be refunded are not refunded to me or the customer. Detailed images of stripe.com account details can be shared upon request.

Content: My experience with Stripe has been extremely disappointing, echoing the sentiments of many others here. The details are too numerous to fully explain, but I feel compelled to warn potential users about the pitfalls of relying on Stripe's 'service'. They fail to meet even basic standards expected of a financial transaction portal. I decided to use Stripe for a client needing to accept credit card payments through four separate invoices. Initially, all payments were accepted without issue. However, after a sudden verification process, which I cooperated with fully and promptly, Stripe deemed my business 'high risk' without further explanation. Despite providing all required information and being a legitimate company, they abruptly closed my account, leaving me unable to appeal or clarify any details.

Title: Lesson learned. Bad experience

Content: There were no issues with Stripe for a couple of years, however once I wasn't comfortable providing what Stripe wanted, there was no recourse. The illusion Stripe offers real support is positive for their public image, however after dealing with an issue for several weeks, I have concluded the support team doesn't have the authority to make decisions, they only enforce the corporate line. I suspect after communicating with 10+ support staff, that Stripe has created standardized scripts for dealing with complaints. All email replies I received, shared a similar tone and structure, parroted company policy, and offered supporting document links for me to read, on my time.  Stripe support team suggests they care, are willing to listen, and invite me to email again if I have additional questions, but from my experience support staff don't have the authority to resolve a client's issue.
Name: Christine
Reply: Hi Christine, thank you for taking the time to provide your feedback with us. We're incredibly sorry the experience has been less than positive here.
Title: Looking behind Stripe's public persona an experiential review ...

Content: I run a small accounting firm and have been using Stripe for three years. In June, without any prior notice, my account was suspended and a new one was automatically created with new settings. At the same time, my payouts were put on hold. Since June 21, Stripe has been demanding verification, but no one has been able to carry it out. I've tried via chat, phone, and email. All my July payments from clients have been held in the Stripe account. The staff cannot resolve this issue and do not know what to do. Due to their incompetence, my firm has not received funds into our bank account, significantly affecting our ongoing operations, software payments, and licenses. I am, of course, no longer their customer and hope to recover my money. I do not recommend Stripe! Avoid them at all costs!

Content: I'm based in the UK and booked a restaurant in London through the OpenTable App and needed to give my Credit Card details to confirm the booking. There has been multiple attempts to defraud my Credit Card since with a lot of these attempts originating in the USA. My bank needed to cancel my card and issue me with a new one. I contacted the restaurant and OpenTable and both have said they don't have access to my CC details. OpenTable told me they use STRIPE to keep my CC details and it is only STRIPE that have access to my details. Therefore someone at STRIPE must have sold on my credit card details to scammers! Avoid STRIPE - it seems they don't keep credit card details safe!!
Name: Jimmy
Reply: Hi Jimmy, thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. We're sorry to hear that you've experienced this issue. To help process your order, we share a limited amount of your payment information, email address, and phone number with the business from which you made a purchase. In some cases, we may also share your email address with card issuers for the sole purpose of account verification. Please note that security and privacy are of the utmost importance to us. We do not sell personal information and share your full payment information, such as your card number or CVV code. You can review Stripe’s Privacy Policy [0] and Privacy Center [1] for more information about Stripe's privacy and security practices.

Title: Stay away from this company and don't…

Content: The worst company for your business. Especially if you have a business that might have a high number in refunds for the customers. Stripe charges you fees for every transaction. When you send refunds back to the customer they keep their original fee charged. On top of that they 1st send you an email stating they are going to hold 25% of your money coming in due to being high risk (due to the refunds). Then in 24 hours you receive an email that your account is completely cancelled and you have no access to all of your funds. When you try to call and get clarification, you are on hold for 30 mins before someone answers and is too incompetent to provide you with any answers. And all they repeatedly kept saying is that this number is for general questions and they don’t have any other phone numbers for clients to contact for help. I would need to send an email and wait 24-48 hours to get a response to when I will receive all of my money and how do I continue to take care of my customers needs with a canceled account. Where is my customers money going??!! This is so frustrating. This company is a pure scam that has no professional support for businesses.

Title: Stripe is not responding to emails

Content: I run a small marketing and technology firm that helps generate leads for the financial space.  I have been using Stripe without any issues for several years until I took on an Merchant Cash Advance company.  I spent over 200 hours to build a lead generating machine so they can get clients. We generated over 650 prospects over the course of several months.  We had met all milestones that were required by client.  After 5 and a half months, this MCA company has decided to claim a Fraudulent Chargeback even though all agreements specifically has stated there are no refunds for builds.  Without any hesitation Stripe has decided in the favor of the client and tried to take $15,500 from my bank account.  I had also given a 25 page document with screenshots of all work that was provided, yet Stripe and the merchant had sided with the MCA company. To make things worse, I had another payment made by a client that they froze and did not release to me because of an ongoing dispute.  I had tried to refund this back to my client with no luck.  Stripe simply froze my accounts and literally stole another $1545.00 payment from me and claims that I also owe this money which I never received.  They are robbing people blind with no accountability.  I plan to start a Class Action lawsuit against them, because based on all the blogs and Forums there are countless of businesses that are falling victim to Stripes abuses.  There is no customer support, and they only communicate through email with canned responses. I will be reaching out to the Attorney General as there is need to be an audit of Stripe's practices, there are many documented cases of Stripe freezing hundreds of accounts in the 6 figures range.  I wonder how much money Stripe is withholding from small businesses illegally.  PS, when speaking with the MCA's credit card company American Express, they state that it is Stripe that allowed the Chargeback and Stripe claims that they are only a Portal (this is a false claim). The dispute was in favor of the unscrupulous MCA company because they held a Black American Express card, which allows their clients to do a charge back with no limit of time. Stripe should have policies in place that has time limits for chargebacks, otherwise, beware you could get robbed years later with no recourse.  I plan to fight this in court with all parties involved. I have all my emails that proves Stripe has Zero customer support.  As soon as there are any disputes, they take away your ability to have a phone call with customer support and you can only communicate with emails.  They hide behind emails and no one will reach to you to try and help you resolve your claim.  If you are lucky, you will only be able to speak with a representative over seas, specifically the Philippines, but they have no ability to help whatsoever, waste of time. There job is to forward your complaint via email which leads nowhere.  Beware, use your own bank's merchant services if they offer it.  I have spoken to hundreds of companies that have had similar nightmare situations with Stripe and no recourse.  I would give Zero Stars if that would've been an option.

We’ll take another look at your account to make sure things are working as intended—our team will review your account, and if we have more information to share, we'll reach out to you via email.

Content: This is my second time writing review for stripe, for my first review I have written that they close my account and stripe send me a follow up email asking me to email heretohelp at stripe.com so they can take a look at my account. GUYS, I can absolutely prove that there is 0 response and no even single response from Stripe after I email them several times about what is going on. At the end, they just simply close the account and refund all whatever payment out there. So second time, since stripe did receive many good feedback around my network, I consult with a Sales / Growth from Stripe Singapore. I have done phone call, checking with him every single thing I could miss, and even asking him to check if there is  anything wrong or if I am not violating anything. And Now again, stripe close my account, I did notice that happen after one client keep on trying their credit card where the card is blocked by stripe. But, all the while, I have 0 dispute, 0 complaints, have verify weekly with Stripe sales guy if there is anything un-usual with my stripe account. Along the way, I did upload my bank statement, use stripe pre-build invoice, use stripe radar to prevent bad things happen, but, again finally, stripe send me email saying that my account get close - to be fair, guys, this is the apps I am building - imagepro.app, guys u can judge if I am violating anything, but stripe just close my account, I have server cost to pay, I have a lot of operation cost to maintain. This is simply unfair and I am now warn everyone who want to start their business with stripe, you business will not last long with stripe. This is my last time writing this review and will never again in the future for stripe

Even though it’s clear that my website sells event tickets for an adult only boat cruise and doesn’t sell or promote the sale of cannabis my money has been stolen by Stripe. After many attempts to reason with the Stripe “support” team I’ve realized legal action is required because they’re completely unreasonable. Their review process is outlandishly flawed and doesn’t take into consideration the fact that cannabis is legal in Canada and there’s many ancillary businesses that don’t sell or promote the sale of cannabis but are still discriminated against for association. Cannabis is legal in Canada and while I didn’t sell or promote the sale of cannabis my account has been closed and my money stolen. Absolutely disgusting. Thankfully I have other options such as Shopify, Square and PayPal. If you’re using WooCommerce do not get into business with Stripe.

Title: New account stripe won’t pay or refund customers

Content: LAST UPDATE: 11.06
Name: RM
Reply: Hi there, thanks for taking the time to provide your feedback with us, and we're sorry to hear that you've experienced this issue. When a Stripe user creates a refund in the dashboard or via the API, Stripe sends the funds to the cardholder's bank immediately. How long it takes after that is up to the customer's bank. A customer should see the refund on their statement approximately 5–10 business days after the refund was issued, depending on the bank. You can read more about this here: https://support.stripe.com/questions/customer-refund-processing-time.

Name: HCE
Reply: Hi there! Thanks for reaching out to us here. We'd be glad to clarify this for you. For context, Stripe is a payments processor that works with businesses to help them accept payments through their websites, apps, and stores. Unfortunately, Stripe doesn't have the authority to create refunds on behalf of our users. To get a refund, we'd recommend reaching out to the business directly, as it's the most effective way to solve any disagreements. If the merchant is unresponsive, we suggest contacting your bank to dispute the payment. Please feel free to contact us at heretohelp@stripe.com, and we would be happy to take a closer look at this for you as well.

Content: We use Stripe to pay for products on our site.
Name: Monika Young
Reply: Hi Monika, we're incredibly sorry the experience has been less than positive here and that's definitely not what we aim for. For context, Terminal is first and foremost a developer tool, and is a different product than most card readers. It is actually a portion of Stripe’s API; you would integrate our software with your existing application or website, in addition to setting up the physical card readers. Our team has designed this product with developers in mind, offering customizability rather than a fully-produced, ready to use card reader. Developer knowledge is required to successfully integrate with our Terminal SDKs. You can read more about Terminal here: https://docs.stripe.com/terminal.

Title: Makes it very difficult to be paid and…

Content: Worst payment provider. We are an honest company and provide our services to our clients honestly. We are a marketing agency and started working with Stripe to accept payments from clients. I had previously read bad reviews about stripe, but we still decided to try working with them. From the very beginning of working with Stripe, we connected a third-party company to prevent chargebacks so that Stripe would not block us. Everything was great at the beginning and we accepted about 100 payments and in one day we received 2 chargebacks for the RDR visa and these 2 payments were immediately returned to the clients' accounts, since we used a third-party provider to prevent chargebacks. It is worth noting that one chargeback was made by the client by mistake, the second chargeback was actually made by the client and these payments were immediately returned to the clients’ account via RDR. Stripe support assured us that if we use a third-party company to prevent chargebacks, our account will not be blocked. Moreover, our chargeback rate was 0%. Despite our best efforts, our account was blocked. We tried to prove that we did not break the rules and provided all the evidence that we prevent chargebacks, that our chargeback rating is 0% and that one chargeback was made by a client by mistake, but none of this helped. Now our account is blocked by mistake and support does not want to help us, moreover, now we have to wait 120 days to withdraw more than $8,000 from our Stripe account. I do not recommend using this company; there are many other reliable payment providers.
Name: support support

Title: No one in India should use stripe

Content: We had a fraudulent dispute filed due to a mix-up in our client's payment. It wasn't a big deal. We spoke with our client and got everything straightened out. It was actually our client's mistake. Out client was 100% satisfied. I went to the Stripe site to file the paperwork. I hit the "Submit Evidence" button thinking that it would take me to the page where I could submit evidence. Wrong. Although I had not submitted anything, Stripe's response explained that the process was completed and I would not be allowed to submit anything further. After speaking with Stripe twice, all they did was repeat the rule and refused to allow me to submit evidence. As I explained over and over, "I did not submit anything." One week later, without receiving any paperwork, US Bank ruled that it was a fraudulent charge. My experience with Stripe could not have been more negative. They simply don't care and only repeat rules and policies. I am changing platforms.
Name: Haydn H
Reply: Hi Haydn, we're sorry to hear that you have to deal with a dispute. While we understand you have accidentally clicked the "Submit Evidence" button without attaching any evidence, it cannot be changed, edited, or otherwise replaced. We allow our users to transmit a second evidence submission on the off chance that it will be successfully received and reviewed by the issuer who created the dispute before, however, it's become clear that this never works, and the single-evidence-submission limit is strictly enforced by all card networks. We don't want to give our users false hope, and since we are certain this doesn't work and is never an option, we are no longer accepting subsequent evidence submissions from our users going forward. Our general guidelines can be found here: https://docs.stripe.com/disputes/responding#respond

Content: (they've responded below but have not processed to help in any way. I think their messages here are just to try to save online integrity even though they have taken no action to remedy the issues) Stripe has been holding my funds for months. I only needed to update my bank account info in their site. Im computer savvy and this should be a basic function. However, when I go to edit, it wont recognize my email associated with the account, therefore Im in an eternal feedback loop. So I try to contact stripe. THEY HAVE NO CUSTMER SERVICE NUMBER. they require a call back and I spoke with FIVE REPS that didnt even listen to my issue and repeated robotically to just edit the info from the dashboard. THEY DIDNT EVEN LISTEN TO MY ISSUE. THAT IT DOESNT WORK AND GIVES AN ERROR. I waited days for a supposed supervisor to EMAIL me- and guess what? SAME ANSWER! JUST EDIT IT FROM YOUR DASHBOARD. THEY DIDNT ADDRESS THE ISSUE AT ALL. I have lost a piece of my sanity and realize there is NO WAY TO ACTUALLY GET ANYONE TO LISTEN TO WHAT THE ISSUE ACTUALLY  IS NOR HELP. they pretty much are just going to steal my money at this point. they are offering no working method for what is probably a glitch on their end. I cant believe how horrible this experience has been. AVOID THIS COMPANY AT ALL COSTS or risk losing everything.

Title: DO NOT USE STRIPE AT ANY COST

Content: Stripe has been nothing but a headache since working with them, they allowed us to set up our account with them without an issue. It wasn't until large sums of money began moving through did they need additional verification. Prior to this they transferred money without an issue, but now that more dollar signs are involved, now it's an issue? I'm seeing other people complain of the same issue, and I need to stress how useless the customer support is. Every email I send out is responded with a variation of the same exact reply, regardless of the individual. There was only ONE person who's actually helped me in this whole situation, and he ended up not being able to do anything beyond point me back to the people with the copy and paste emails.

Reply: Hi Wrangell! We're sorry about this experience. We have received your request, and our team is currently working on it. We will get in touch with the same email thread once we have an update to share.
Title: How is this legal?

Content: When I started using Stripe for my e-commerce business two years ago, I was initially optimistic. However, my experience has revealed several challenges that might caution others looking for a reliable payment processing solution.
Name: Oleg P.
Reply: Hey Oleg, we're sorry about your negative experience using our services. We'd like to help in any way we can and it looks like you have an ongoing conversation with us via email. We'll follow up to assist with any questions or concerns you may have regarding your concerns for security reasons. As per the instant payout fee, if it helps to know more about how we came to our default pricing, we regularly research the pricing of other online processors for card-not-present transactions, and our fees are competitive with some of the larger companies. Please visit https://stripe.com/pricing for more information on pricing for each of our products. Otherwise, you can also check: https://docs.stripe.com/payouts/instant-payouts for instant payouts.
Title: Consider Alternatives for Your Payment Processing Needs

Content: my customer mistakenly paid the same invoice twice  and if i refund her i am charged £28  for the second payment that will be refunded.This seems WRONG  and is a big reason to use alternatives to stripe imo. I only just srarted using stripe again, not a good start
Name: Katherine Griffiths
Reply: Hi Katherine, when you create a refund, the full amount of the payment is returned to your customer. However, your Stripe fees are not refunded to you for refunds. This means that you'll see both the amount for the refund pulled from your balance, as well as the Stripe fee amount [0]. We do wish we could return our fees to our users; however, we ourselves incur underlying costs from our banking and card partners when we process refunds. That means that returning fees from refunded charges to our users would be unsustainable for us. While I understand that's not what you want to hear, we believe we can best serve you and all of our users by being as transparent as we can about our refund policy and focusing our attention on making Stripe as useful as we can for your business. If there's anything we can do to assist you going forward, please don't hesitate to get in touch with our support team or via email at heretohelp@stripe.com.

Content: Do not sign up to any service with recurring payment, monthly or similar via Stripe. The merchant can block the cancellation and charge you as long as your card is valid. There is no support from Stripe or a way to block the automatic payment via Stripe. In Paypal you van manage you subscriptions so that is way more secure for the customer
Name: Customer from Helsinki
Reply: Hi there, we’re sorry to hear about your experience. If you believe you’ve been fraudulently charged, we strongly recommend contacting the concerned business first to resolve the issue. However, if the business is unresponsive or the solution unsatisfactory, the next step is to file a dispute with your bank. When you file a dispute, your bank passes all relevant details to Stripe, and we use this data in our ongoing effort to combat fraud. You can learn more about disputing a purchase made through Stripe here: https://support.stripe.com/questions/disputing-a-purchase-made-through-stripe.

Title: Account closed overnight with no reason :(

Content: I had an issue were stripe locked me out of my account for 11 days. They said I was at high risk for not refunding my customers. Which was not true at all. I came to trustpilot in search of an answer after I was only getting automated responses. Found this email "heretohelp at stripe.com" sent an email there. Got in contact with someone named "Jason". It took a while for the team to look into my issue. But I went from losing everything for no reason to getting in contact with Jason and getting the issue resolved. My account is restored and everything seems to be normal again. This was a scary experience because my whole business revolves around stripes API. Being locked out for no reason was a punch in the gut. Anyway I'm happy to report that Jason helped me to resolve the issue and my account has been restored. If you are having problems like I did email "heretohelp at stripe.com" explain as much as you can about what your experiencing and let the team look into the issue. I pray this doesn't happen to anyone else but I'm sure it will unless their automated flagging system gets updated. I haven't found out what caused the issue yet. But I think it had something to do with a wordpress plugin I was using called WP Simple Pay. Probably stay away from that. I think that when a purchase gets executed it doesn't supply enough customer information to stripe to support refunds. It could have just been user error (my fault) not knowing how to set it up properly. But I learned my lesson and don't think I'll be using that plugin again. Thanks Jason for getting this worked out.

Reply: Hi there, we're incredibly sorry the experience has been less than positive here. We're already looking into your account, and we'll follow up with you in the active email exchange as soon as we have an update.

That's why we got 7 disputes out of 130 orders. Still, Stripe decided that we are high risk. All I want to say is that Stripe is not small business-friendly, and they are bullying us without even giving us a chance.

Content: I tried opening a Stripe account while I was visiting my daughter in France because I could not use my bank-issued credit card system there. I did not pass the verification process because I was not willing to turn over an extensive amount of financial documents  to them. I processed through them five credit card payments from my patients.  When my account was closed they refunded four of the five payments to the original cards but did not refund one which totaled $1100.  I check everyday and the payout date keeps getting pushed out. According to them they are delaying this “due to high likelihood of fraudulent dispute”. But after a month there has been no dispute whatsoever and they are just holding onto the money.  In fact,when I ran that card on 4/5/2024 the risk assessment was “normal”.  I cannot believe they can legally  keep payments for indefinite periods of time when the payment has gone through and is sitting in their account.  If that charge was fraudulent it would have been disputed by now.   I am still in France but when I get back to California I am going to contact the California Attorney General’s Office and get some clarification about this.

Reply: Hi Pilar, we understand the situation with your remaining transaction is far from ideal. Please email us at heretohelp@stripe.com and we’ll take another look from our end.

Content: Why do i have to wait at least a week for the privilege of withdrawing MY OWN money that you've already taken a percentage of? And then it takes another week for the money to go into my bank account. This completely destroys small businesses, i cannot wait 2 weeks for my funds to go into my bank account. I can withdraw instantly from Paypal so why not Stripe? I don't care if i can access instant withdrawals once i've hit $5000 sales, i won't ever reach that number unless i can withdraw instantly NOW. Is there any way i can access instant withdrawals now? If not, i will be unable to use Stripe. Regards.
Name: Rob
Reply: Hi Rob, thanks for your feedback. We understand you want to switch to instant payouts. Please note that instant payouts are available subject to eligibility, and as such, new Stripe accounts aren’t immediately eligible. We’d recommend taking a look at our documentation here: https://stripe.com/docs/payouts/instant-payouts. If you have any further questions, please don’t hesitate to contact us at heretohelp@stripe.com.

Title: Good supporting and process

Content: Extremely disappointed with Stripe as our credit card processing company. As a small business using Webflow for our e-commerce platform, we were essentially forced into using Stripe. However, it's been a nightmare. We've encountered numerous fake orders that Stripe initially approves but later get disputed, leaving us out of pocket and without our products. Despite reaching out to them multiple times, their customer service has been unhelpful. If you're a small business like us, save yourself the hassle and explore other credit card processing options. Not only does Stripe fail to protect against fraudulent orders, but they also withhold funds because of them, leaving us unable to access all of our money. This adds insult to injury for small businesses like ours. It's a frustrating situation that compounds the already poor experience with their service.
Name: J S
Reply: Hi J, we’re very sorry to hear about this. Kindly note that you are immediately responsible to Stripe for debits against your account balance, including disputed charges. This is described in greater depth in Stripe’s Services Agreement:

Content: stay away at all costs use quickbooks I an not comparing your fees to swipe in person. Your fees are half a percent higher at least.
Name: Cameron Sprenger
Reply: Hi Cameron, we’re sorry you feel that our fees are high. If it helps to know more about how we came to our default pricing, we regularly research the pricing of other online processors for card-not-present transactions, and our fees are competitive with some of the larger companies. If you're comparing our fees to a card-present service, we (and other card-not-present transaction providers) will always have higher fees due to the risk involved with processing cards online. Please visit https://stripe.com/pricing for more information on pricing for each of our products. You can also email us at heretohelp@stripe.com so we can check why your Stripe fees increased.

Content: Tyler helped me.  I thought my question regarding two-factor authentication and transfer of ownership from me to another person was complex.  I was startled by how well Tyler could help me.  He could walk me through certain screens and pop-up windows.  It was as if he was visualizing my screen and telling me very clearly what to do at each juncture.  I could only think, How is it possible we can have this good a communication about a complex topic, separated as we were by probably thousands of miles and my not-always hearing things (and having to ask Tyler to repeat things).  Tyler was so perfect in the help he gave me.  Never showed impatience; frequently gave me a gentle reassurance.    Was remarkable.

Title: Yes stripe made a good experience and…

Content: Why are most of the good review of Stripe "invited?" Stripe has illegally withheld monies from my small business for several months now. They change their reason why and keep delaying the release thereof. I have no chargebacks, no refunds, no complaints. You can't call them, and countless emails to them either go unanswered, or they respond with a generic reply that "they are investigating" or "they will get back to you" by a certain date, only to extend the date they will get back to you. I suspect they do this, to use their small business merchant's capital for free (think of it, using millions of dollars interest fee-especially during inflation). They will inform you, the merchant is in breach, but actually I feel it is Stripe in breach. I'm investigating further, by compiling complaints on the web, contacting government regulatory agencies, web searching court cases, and contacting industry journalists. See Better Business Bureau for over 1,000 complaints with Stripe. Hopefully a class action suit can evolve from all these complainants.

Reply: Hi JM, we're sorry about your negative experience using our service. There are a number of reasons why a Stripe account may become unsupportable. We are still actively looking into your case and we will let you know as soon as we have an update to share. If you have any follow up questions feel free to reach out to us directly at heretohelp@stripe.com.

Title: they allowed hundreds of fraudulent payments to be porcessed and never told us

Content: As a company trading for 5 years with Stripe
Name: Kieron
Reply: Hi Kieron, thanks for reaching out and we're incredibly sorry the experience has been less than positive here! For context, the “Know Your Customer” (KYC) obligations for payments require Stripe to collect and maintain information on all Stripe account holders. These requirements come from our regulators and are intended to prevent abuse of the financial system [0]. If, at any time, we are unable to confirm that your business meets these checks or requirements, we may ask you to send us more information to fix the problem. Depending on the severity of the issue, your account may not be able to process payments or receive transfers/payouts until the issue is resolved. Please email us at heretohelp@stripe.com, and we’ll be happy to take another look.
Title: Waste of time!!

Content: I can't even begin to tell you guys how much stress Stripe has caused me and other friends that I know. We all run completely legit businesses and we were running smoothly until stripe decided that my business was risky and completely held my money. ($35k +). It has now been over 5 months and they simply don't respond to emails, messages, or anything. They simply don't care. They have never ever given an explanation as to why they are holding on to my money and simply send emails saying its in their terms and conditions to hold on to your money forever if they wish to. My business had extremely low chargeback rates and we won almost ALL of those that were there. This is absurd and extremely unethical. They will respond to reviews saying email us and we will look into it but they are simply doing that so that people who are reading the reviews can think that they will do something. Look for yourselves at how low the ratings are here on Trustpilot. DO NOT USE STRIPE. There are many other payment processors out there and none of them will EVER do these type of unethical things. Shame on you Stripe! Shame on you!

I would advise exploring alternative payment methods such as Skrill and Square, which may offer more responsive customer service and support for new users.

Content: After waiting for a refund from the cycle shop for a week I emailed them and they screenshot the reply from Stripe which read that stripe tried to send the money to my bank account and getting in touch with the bank there had been no activity of anyone trying to refund money to my account. Lies comes to mind because if they can hold onto people's money they will be making the interest. The bike shop said it is now going through which is a bit strange because why didn't the bank refuse it again??!!. I'm not expecting my money in the near future and when I do eventually get it will the interest be with it. I wouldn't trust stripe again after this experience. I THINK STRIPE ARE HOLDING MY MONEY TO GET THE INTEREST. BE AWARE BEFORE USING THEM. Just been told I will get my refund in 1-5 days which I don't believe... I can transfer money instantly why can't Stripe??... Because they hold onto your money as long as they can and it comes to a point will you get your money back. They told me to put a dispute in with my bank!!!... They are only receiving my money not messing about with it like Stripe... Stripe are the culprits here making interest off my money... Avoid at all costs.
Name: Kevin Clsrridge
Reply: Hi Kevin! Thanks for reaching out to us here. We understand that you’re concerned about a refund that you’ve requested from a merchant that is using Stripe. Refunds typically take 5–10 business days to process; your funds may be on their way to you currently. If you haven't received your refund after 10 business days, please check with the business to get a proof of refund and reach out to your bank. It's likely you will need to speak to the Treasury Department of your bank to understand where your refund is. If the merchant is experiencing errors in processing the refund, please let them contact us. Otherwise, the best and quickest way for you to receive your funds back is to get in touch with your bank and file a dispute against them. Please note that the outcome of a dispute is decided entirely by your bank. To inquire about the status or outcome of a dispute, you will need to contact your bank. The following document might offer you some insightful information about the dispute process: https://support.stripe.com/questions/disputing-a-purchase-made-through-stripe
Title: Lying about refund

I  am cancelling service and still having trouble collecting my money as I write this. It feels like a scam to use our money for their own purposes. Content: Stripe has decided to block pay out my regular customer money to my account. I provided them all required documents they asked for to unfreeze my account. I decided that if I cant pay out these money, because I will refund it back to my customer and we will use different payment method, but it is not possible from my account as well, even though I meet all requirements and there is enough money on my stripe account. Stripe see me as potential fraudulent threat, while I am operating in business for 30 years already and never scammed a signle person. Anyway, its fine, I can use other payments tools, but the problem is Customer Service. It is answering my emails with generic responses only, not relating to my problem at all. Of course, they make phone number unavailable for the customer - their intention is to make contact as hard as possible, just like cheap airlines. They have relatively low fee, so that is a plus, but if you have any issues with the platform, you are screwed basically. I am moving my business to other platforms, but I still have 4000 USD to send back to my customer, which I cant proceed with and I have to find a solution how to release money from Stripe account - one way or another. I want to snd money back to the customer and its not possible...

Content: I was using stripe from 2022. while this period of time they were fine with me but as soon as my business boosts and i am getting good sales they closed my account without any valid reason. i was unable to deliver products to many of my customers. there were money in my account which i refunded my customers and after closure of my i was unable to refund so i request my customers to open a dispute to get their money back for the orders they have not received yet. But for the products i have shipped there is still an amount which stripe has to pay me out. This money belongs to me. its been months i was trying to contact support but every timer they did not understand my situation and i received an automatic reply. there is still 800+ USD available in my account. and i want my money back, i don't want to work with stripe anymore. I request to the readers of this review please be careful if you are using stripe.

Content: I have a legitimate business providing health care services. I switched to Stripe because I needed a way to process credit card payments without huge charges associated with it (buy a machine, fees for the account). It all went ok, until last week I received an email, mentioning unauthorized charges. I only have 3-5 clients, so I would be able to easily clear this up, but Stripe was not even willing to give me the name, amount or date of the transaction in question. They just said my business is too much of a risk (how?!?) and there is "nothing else they can do" (after 1 email inquiry?!?). They referred to a policy, letting me know my money will "not be made available to me, in accordance with Section 5.6". I've spent most of my day trying to contact Stripe, find a phone number and finally researched my issue, which led me to a large number of people having this exact issue! My next step will be the BBB. They need to be held accountable for these scam-like business practices.
Name: Nicole Blankenship
Reply: Hi Nicole, We're incredibly sorry the experience has been less than positive here. We'd like to take a second look at your account from our end. Also, we sent you an email regarding your Stripe account. That said, to ensure a smooth workflow, we will be continuing communication there, so please kindly respond to that email thread if you need further assistance.
Title: They WILL take your money, no explanation or way to contact them!

Content: Stay away from this company. My company was just started and I supplied all my paperwork and after on transaction they said I was a high risk business. They refunded my customers their money even though I supplied proof that they received and approved their service.  My business is simple and it not high risk. If you look at their Facebook page you will see the same compliants that are on this page. I have a feeling the 4 star reviews are fake.

After that, Stripe closed my account, saying my business was at risk. So, I asked the customer why he paid in multiple installments instead of all at once, and the customer answered me, 'My card had a limited one-time payment limit, so I paid in multiple installments.' I provided Stripe with the emails I exchanged with the customer, but Stripe still I responded that I had no choice but to close my account.

Title: Stripe stole 9,000 EUR.

Content: If I could give a negative rating, I would. This company is very crooked. I am in the process of starting my own company. I will be making T-shirts, stickers and cups. I have not started making product yet, I am in the starting phase. I am trying to find a payment platform to use so that I can collect payments from customers. On March 6, 2024, I came across Stripe.com, which claims to be a payment platform. I decided to test their services to see if it would fit my needs. I used virtual gift cards that were issued to myself to test the payments and make sure they would go through hassle free before using it with customers.. I provided PayPal banking information and began processing payments utilizing my gift card. Stripe paused my account and refuses to release the funds back to me because they are unable to verify my bank account (PayPal) they are now saying they will not release the funds at all (even via refund) and will be keeping them. They are stating that the cards used are unauthorized, yet they my own. I am at a loss. How can you just decide to keep the money??? It’s only $35, but I don’t care if it’s $1…. It’s not their money!

Title: I received a £10,000 payment via credit…

Content: If I could give 0 stars I would, tears are falling from eyes as I write this review, DO NOT USE STRIPE, AVOID AT ALL COST , I hope this warning goes out to people looking for a payment processor, so I got stripe to accept payment for my ecommerce site, I got a few orders sure stripe payed out after like a week my product went viral on social media, and I got a lot of orders my biggest made almost £1000 in a day stripe deactivated my account and say I can’t use stripe after review, and the money will be released in august, meaning customers will have to wait that long resulting in a higher chargebacks, I only ship orders after receiving payment because I’ve always suspected that stripe are incompetence in their business practices, I switched to PayPal this morning and when I got paid I received the money instantly and o was able to process order and ship same day, my issue is why didn’t they stop the account when I had 1 to 4 sales and obviously know what they are doing after growing then they stop you from doing business, this is my 2nd business this is happening, I went bankrupt in the first one because of stripe, SWITCH to PayPal if you don’t want to lose money, No I can see this is what they do I should have read reviews I’m so sad, I was contapulating committing suicide as I’ve invested so much time and effort, I’m in big debt and I thought this was Gods divine miracle for all the sales and profit for a devil called stripe to stop it, I pray for stripe downfall, I’ll make it my life mission to make sure everyone is aware and stay away, F U and your CEOs and your partners

Title: Closed account with booking.com - Out Thousands of Dollars

Content: After a few weeks of using my Stripe account, they decided to ban my account because of "fraudulent transaction" they never gave me more information about this. They also told me that they will refund all the balance to the customers within 5 days. But they never refunded my customers !!! Now after waiting over 120 days, I am asking them to receive the remaining balance of the account. They answer is clearly saying that they will never send me the money. So what is the conclusion of this ? You can not get your money, and your customers can not get their money back. So who is keeping the money ?? Stripe !! For what reason ??? It's not theirs !!! This system is a complete fraud and I don't understand that a big company like this can still be to operate under such commercial practices. I can understand that they want to manage their risk of loss regarding the eventual chargebacks that can happen a few weeks after the purchase. So ok, keep my money for 120 days if you want, but send it to me at the end of the period instead of having such behavior. In addition, all their replies are made using automatic emails that still says that they will refund the charges but they won't !!! Their email has no sense but it clearly says that "the remaining balance will not be made available to you" !!!! Stripe if you read this, send me my money !!! You already almost shut down my business so you can at least stop stealing people and send them their money !!! I have over 4000$ on my account and I will get them back no matter what !!! I will reach out to my lawyer if needed !!! I can not forget such a big amount !!! Please re review my request and send me my money so the bank account on file ! Thank you in advance, I hope that my problem will be sorted after this review. If it's the case, I will let you know in a 5 star reviews once the money has been received.

Content: I am waiting for a refund from a company that makes use of Stripe as a payment provider. Communication from Stripe was that I would receive the refund on the 2nd April. It’s now the 4th April, no refund. Suddenly Stripe has an issue with the company, however Stripe never indicated an issue and communicated a refund date which they are now backtracking on. They are not willing to divulge the issue. Stripe is borderline fraudulent and I will never buy from a company again that makes use of this provider.
Name: Kerry Cox
Reply: Hi Kerry, thank you for writing about this. Unfortunately, Stripe does not have the authority to create refunds on behalf of our users. Only the vendor can issue a refund. To check on this, I would recommend reaching out to the business directly, and they should be able to help you with that. If the merchant is unresponsive, we recommend you reach out to your bank to ask what your options are, like filing a dispute. The following document might offer you some insightful information about the dispute process: https://support.stripe.com/questions/disputing-a-purchase-made-through-stripe

With innumerable series of chat support and emails despite sending all the business documents, we have not heard back from them. All they respond is that their team is looking into it and they will respond in 24-48 hours. But to our horrifying reality there has been no resolution till date.

Title: Delirious to say the least

Content: We gave Stripe a go. We barely had any transactions as we barely used it. Meanwhile, our bank account has been hacked. Hundreds of £1 transactions kept appearing daily. We have asked for the account to be closed down as soon as our bank has investigated and returned the stolen funds to us. Little did we know that we “owe” the stolen money to Stripe as it has left negative balance. Two months later we are still going back and forth explaining this one simple thing.
Name: M. Guinan
Reply: Hi there, thanks for bringing this to our attention. Stripe does not condone nor support such activities. Please email us at heretohelp@stripe.com with more details, and we’ll investigate this from our side.

Title: Worst payment processor

Content: Onboarding via Woopayments is terrible, 20 times the same paper from home address => not accepted. Same paper with Worldpay, Mollie, Vivawallet and Gocardless without problem. Difference between them and stripe, they have almost only good reviews. stripe almost only bad reviews. So think twice before you transfer to them.

Reply: Hi Yuran, We're sorry to hear you're having issues integrating Stripe with Woopayments. We'd like to inform you that aside from Woopayments, Stripe also partners with other third parties, which you might want to check. To read more about the role of third parties and Stripe, please refer here: https://support.stripe.com/questions/help-with-third-party-integrations. Additionally, we'd like to help in any way we can—feel free to reach out to us directly at heretohelp@stripe.com, and we'll follow up to assist with any questions or concerns you may have.
Title: Onboarding is terrible

Content: Stay way from Stripe, they're thieves and there is no support. I've received an email saying that unauthorized charges have been made by my account (which is a lie) and that my account is disabled and will be closed, and that I can see the charges to be refunded on my dashboard (which is a lie too). So I checked my dashboard, there is 0 dispute, 0 chargeback, 0 ongoing refund, and for a year that I'm using Stripe, I've never got any chargeback/refund/dispute. So I asked them what transactions are they referring to, they replied that they cannot tell me and that they will keep my money. I keep sending email but they ignore my messages, impossible to contact them directly, impossible to get a response. This is unacceptable, it is also defamation, accusing me of fraud even tho there was no unauthorized charge. It is their right to close any account, I don't mind, but it is totally wrong to keep the money, and terrible to ignore messages of their customers, especially in a situation like this. The persons responsible for this kind of behavior in this company should go to jail.
Name: Jb
Reply: Hi, we're incredibly sorry the experience has been less than positive here. We would like to look into this for you. Also, it appears that you have sent us an email regarding the same concern. That said, to ensure a continuous and smooth workflow, we will be continuing communication there.
Title: Stripe closed my account and stole my money

Content: Absolutely Disgusted with Stripe. A customer paid a AUD$7000 invoice twice by mistake. When I refunded the second amount Stripe kept $400 in fees. Ironically this is 5.7% when my normal international rate is 3.5%.
Name: Nevan Pavlinovich
Reply: Hi Nevan, we're truly sorry the experience has been less than positive here. We do wish we could return our fees to our users, however we ourselves incur underlying costs from our banking and card partners when we process refunds. That means that returning fees from refunded charges to our users would be unsustainable for us. While we understand that's not what you want to hear, we believe we can best serve you and all of our users by being as transparent as we can about our refund policy and focusing our attention on making Stripe as useful as we can for your business.

Title: you guys closed an account which has…

Content: Stripe has been awful.  I opened an account with them several years ago and because I didn't have a problem I never had to deal with their customer service.  It wasn't until I started having problems that stripe started to be horrible.  Their customer service is a total joke.  They are uneducated about their product and cannot answer questions.  My first issue was that I wanted to offer affirm, klarna, or after-pay to my international customers.  They kept telling me I could do this.  I worked on this for a week until I figured out on my own by reading through a million of their online help manuals that all of their customer service representatives were wrong.  Second, I opened up a new business in a different state so I opened a second stripe account.  That is when things have gotten really messy.  Stripe has held my funds twice when they decide they need additional information and when I provide them that information they take a week or more to approve it and hold my money the entire time.  Their customer service representatives do not know what they are doing or saying at all.  They can't speak English very well, put you on long holds, in the back ground it is noisy with loud breathing into the receiver.  They cannot answer any questions and you can't trust the answers they give.  They truly do not know what they are doing at all.
Name: Monica
Reply: Hi Monica, we apologize for the less than ideal support experience you’ve had. If you send us an email at heretohelp@stripe.com, we’d be more than happy to assist you with this.

Title: Very Professionnal Support

Content: Horrible service, I’ve recently created an. account and made sales, then a fraudulent chargeback takes place from a risky profile, that created his account 2 minutes prior to purchasing, I wasn’t informed about the anti fraud feature at that time. Stripe immediately closed my account and threatened to refund everyone because my account is deemed ”too high risk”? how do you blame a new merchant of being ”too high risk” just for not having enough sales and not having everything verified for not knowing how it works? that defeats the entire point. not only that but they specifically mentioned that my other sales, that had 0 issues will NOT be made to me because of their ”tos”, they made a rule to rob you out of your money which is crazy, I asked for clarifications for my account closure, as a EU citizen they have to abide by p2b regulations, which stands for transparency between the seller and buyer, in which they completely ignored, ontop of that I warned the company to not issue any refund until further clarifications, which also got ignored and the fraudster got refunded. I’m pretty sure they’re robbing us. What bothers me is i’ve found out they’ve been constantly doing this and didn’t deal with any repercussions. However, i am optimistic that the EU won’t take this lightly, they’ve sued anything you can think of, which gave me the idea to inform my lawyer about taking this to the EU commission to see what can happen. If you have experienced similar issues, please reach  out to me at smexylonas @gmail.com to share your story, as I am compiling evidence for legal action

Title: Awesome Company Stripe

Content: Our flower business has been set on ‘pause’ because of being placed on the restricted list while there was just a misunderstanding with the Ukraine regions. Officially Luhansk / donetsk are just Ukraine but according stripe they aren’t anymore. Or at high risk. Even though we fixed all issues there’s nobody that respond on our emails and or there’s also not a proffesional business account manager that we can call with. Stripe seems just simply not care about their business owners and expect that you wait for weeks on an email from their side. Unbelievable dissapointed in Stripe. My first review was from 22 march but It’s now today 5 april and so 2 weeks later and still none response from stripe and they hold / freeze € 1460 euro from my clients in their pockets. They promise in the app to make the pay out but every time delay and delay. This shows the real face of stripe. That they steal from the hard working companies, that done all the needed updates so far but Stripe doesn’t care and don’t show that they are professional payment processors. It’s a shame that we have to find another payment processor to deal with our waiting customers.
