Reply: Hi there, we're sorry to hear that you've experienced this issue. We received your email and our team is still in the midst of reviewing your account. Rest assured that we'll follow up and reply to your email as soon as we have an update to share. Thank you for your patience and understanding.
Title: Stripe - ukraine - restricted list

Content: Absolutely shocked by their false payment / pay-out terms and inability to resolve this and to add to this, they dictate to you your ability to receive your payments. Making their customers wait 7 days for the money that belongs to them. This is false advertising at the highest level. You cannot communicate that your first payment takes 7 days and then there after your payments will take 3 days and not stick to that term and when contact about a payment not being made on those terms, telling your customer that there is nothing that can be done and the payment terms change only once your account is reviewed which is poor customer practice! Any business these days relies on customers paying their invoices timeously so that they can pay their suppliers, but not STRIPE - They keep your money and decide when to pay you out............... Thereby reducing a companies ability to operate efficiently.

Content: Do not use stripe. We started taking payments from them and they assumed the transactions were fraudulent without any evidence and have frozen our funds for over a month, with no complaint from the customer. If your a small business, beware, you can't call them to discuss anything, only email. If you want your payments to be held hostage indefinitely then go for it.

Title: Do not use stripe

Content: I looked into Stripe as a way to collect payment from US clients. (I am in Canada). I had a salesperson contact me to discuss options and fees. I was told that I could accept ACH (transfers) at the rate of 0.8% which was acceptable. I went through all of the work of setting up my account in Stripe, my products etc. and when it came time to select accepted payment types, that was not an option. I spent about an hour with support and they let me know that I cannot accept ACH with a Canadian Account. The salesperson was fully aware of my location and my desire to use ACH as a payment method. I processed my first payment because I had already invoiced a customer, and I paid 3.7% on a $1000 invoice. Ouch.
Name: Cody Becker
Reply: Hey Cody, we're sorry if you feel our fees are high. If it helps to know more about how we came to our default pricing, we regularly research the pricing of other online processors for card-not-present transactions, and our fees are competitive with some of the larger companies. If you're comparing our fees to a card-present service, we (and other card-not-present transaction providers) will always have higher fees due to the risk involved with processing cards online. We'd like to help in any way we can. Feel free to reach out to us directly at heretohelp@stripe.com, and we'll follow up to assist with any questions or concerns you may have.

Title: They stolled my money with fake…

Content: I used Stripe for my small business and they have this policy that if a customer purchases then requests for a refund, you can refund them BUT you lose the transaction fee. This is unlike any payment gateway I've used and is scummy. I lost $80 as a transaction fee because the customer accidently ordered the wrong item so I refunded it. The result was that the transaction fee was not refunded to me, but the customer received the entire refund (rightfully so) but EVERYTHING should be refunded and the merchant shouldn't be penalized for cancelling an order. I switched to Woopay through my wordpress website and it's MUCH better and doesn't have these stupid policies. On top of it, the customer support provided no help and directed me to policies that do not state anything in reference to what I'm referring to. Stay away from Stripe!!!
Name: Patrick DePaolo
Reply: Hi Patrick, we’re sorry to hear that. We do wish we could return our fees to our users; however, we ourselves incur underlying costs from our banking and card partners when we process refunds. That means that returning fees from refunded charges to our users would be unsustainable for us. https://support.stripe.com/questions/understanding-fees-for-refunded-payments If there’s anything we can help with, please don’t hesitate to email us at heretohelp@stripe.com.
Title: Bad Policies for Small Businesses, Stay Away

Content: Stripe, like countless other money businesses, is built on the backbone of the NSFW industry and is once again cracking down on allowing payments from people who produce NSFW content. The latest victim is Gumroad and countless artists are losing their incomes because stripe refuses to work with Gumroad who regularly provides custom nsfw content. Over 60% of the adult population accesses NSFW content at least monthly in the USA. This is penalizing people for normal behavior, for no reason, and it's undeserved. Stripe should be ashamed of making their money off of NSFW content creators early in their business and then cutting them off when it became mainstream.

Content: Well I have been using stripe to process payments for my business for a year or so. There is no consistency to the timeframe in which they process payments. It supposed to be something like 3-5 days which is slow as it is but it is often much longer. They often push payments out weeks on end. One time it took nearly a month. Stripes phone support there with the worst of the worst. You will sit on hold for hours and hours only to have to hang up to love on with your life. Finding a way to contact support via email is next to impossible. No live chat option from what I can see.  No call back option which is what would make the most sense. Just whatever you do use a different payment processor because when you have a problem and you will there will be no one to resolve it.

Title: I would give 0 stars.

Content: Stripe requested information about our Company for Verification purposes.  This exact information was provided but was subsequently deemed not acceptable, we tried emailing the customer service dept and just received back generic emails with no further detail or clarification as to what information exactly was needed. Our account was put on hold, we could not accept any credit card payments which has serious consequences.  No contact telephone number to call and speak anyone.  Eventually got a support person to call from California (we are based in Ireland), no help, could not tell me what exactly what information was needed, stated that it was AI that rejected our information and not a person. Asked for a manager to email me, this person who had no idea about Irish Comapny law and was quoting Canadian legal requirements.  Eventually got sorted after many hours of  time wasted and 5 days without being able to accept credit card payments. Totally unacceptable, so frustrating.
Name: Julie Anne White
Reply: Hi Julie Anne. we’re sorry to hear that. This isn’t the support experience we want you to have. Please don’t hesitate to email us at heretohelp@stripe.com if you have additional questions or concerns, and we’ll follow up to assist you as soon as possible. Thank you.

Title: Poor experience! Stay Away!

Content: Like everyone else on here, Stripe has dropped the ball.  Since 2/27/2024 I have had nothing but problems over a payout of $476 bucks.  Since August or so of last year, no issue.  They are holding my funds hostage for reasons I have corrected.  I get nowhere with their support, and have to wait 2-3 days for a response with no resolution!!  Today I asked for an address for their leagal department and a phone number for legal action.  So far, no response.  It seems about half of the negative responses on this site are the same or similar.  They are holding MY money hostage for the work I PERFORMED, not them. I would really like to know the amount of people that have this issue and file a joint legal action against this company.  Just think of all the money they are holding hostage and making interest on.  I am astounded at the lack of empathy, progress on my request, and support from a company that forwards MY money at a percentage cost to me.  At this point, I just want them to refund my customer, confirm this, and then I would delete my relationship with them gladly.

Name: Simon
Reply: Hi Simon, we’re sorry to hear about your experience. If you believe you’ve been fraudulently charged, we strongly recommend contacting the concerned business first to resolve the issue. However, if the business is unresponsive or the solution unsatisfactory, the next step is to file a dispute with your bank. When you file a dispute, your bank passes all relevant details to Stripe, and we use this data in our ongoing effort to combat fraud. You can learn more about disputing a purchase made through Stripe here: https://support.stripe.com/questions/disputing-a-purchase-made-through-stripe

Content: I set up Stripe payments and they refused to pay out the money that came in. The reason given was that my business is "restricted". It's clear to anyone who does their research properly and uses their brains that we do not fit into any of their listed restricted-business categories, so unfortunately Stripe's implementation of its policies defy common sense. If you think that someone who isn't especially sharp - or someone who is over-worked, inexperienced or targeted on being overly cautious - might mis-categorise your business, you probably should look elsewhere. Because after the back-and-forth with them I get the strong impression this is not a one-off mistake... To rub salt in the wounds, I then got an invoice from them even though they aren't going to pay out the money I had earned through its account!

Title: This platform offers efficient service…

Content: We have been using stripe for about 18 months, in that time we have had a string of chargebacks from people using stolen card details.  In comparison we have had ZERO chargebacks from paypal.  Additionally stripe has a blanket position that they are not a fraud detection company but then SELL TOOLS TO DETECT FRAUD (which don't work).  It is not difficult to flag cards that have been identified in chargebacks on the platform, but they don't even do that.  Basically if you use stripe for processing your payments, prepare to get hit with chargebacks that they have no interest in stopping.  I quote from a single email from stripe "support":
Name: Annoyed
Reply: Hi there, we're sorry to hear about that. With regard to this, we strongly recommend creating an effective dispute and fraud prevention strategy is the best way to ensure that your Stripe account is safe from these issues. Users may consider using Stripe Radar [0] to reduce incidents of fraud. Here are some of the best practices for fraud prevention [1]. Alternatively, you can check here [2] how Stripe Chargeback Protection defends your business from the unpredictability of disputes. Please don’t hesitate to email us at heretohelp@stripe.com if you have any further questions.
Title: Happy to stick their merchants with endless fraud chargebacks

Content: I had a simple question for Stripe: since I have a new account, will there be any delay in transferring money to my bank account  when the first purchase comes in. The answer from the customer service rep was "no." Yet, there is a delay of one week.
Name: Steven
Reply: Hi Steven, we’re sorry to hear that. This isn’t the support experience we want you to have. To add more context, the first payout for every new Stripe account is typically paid out 7 days after the first successful payment is received. This waiting period can be up to 14 days for businesses in certain industries. This delay allows Stripe to mitigate some risks inherent in providing credit services. You can read more about this here: https://support.stripe.com/questions/common-questions-about-payout-schedules. If you have any further questions, please don’t hesitate to contact us at heretohelp@stripe.com.

Title: Stripe is scam my money

Content: This company is scamming me.  They have been holding all of my funds for no reason at all.  They lied through their teeth and keep putting me off with all kinds of excuses.  They are holding a great deal of money that they are refusing to give me.  All I asked them to do was take one bank account off and put a different bank account on record.  They keep sending me to different people to escalate my situation.  First they tell me that they have all the documents they need, and that I will get my money the next morning.  A few hours later, I receive an email from Stripe telling me that they are withholding my money for a different reason or sometimes the same reason, even though they are holding the documents in their hands.  Today's call was no different from all their other calls.  Now they are telling me that they have to send an email to a different department, to a higher representative.  Meantime, they are using my money for their own purposes and deliberately withholding my money which amounts to a lot of money.  I am considering taking legal action because what they are doing is clearly illegal.  This is the worst company I have ever dealt with.  So far, they have been dragging their feet for trumped up excuses for withholding my money for the last four months. This is very unacceptable and I will be forced to take legal action.

Content: My son has been able to purchase illegal bodybuilding drugs from the website uksarms.co.uk and apexreceptor.com using Stripe to accept card payments and has suffered severe health issues!
Name: Jose
Reply: Hi Jose! Thanks for bringing this to our attention. Stripe does not condone or support such activities. We appreciate that you might want to know the outcome of our investigation; however, due to privacy reasons, we can only share the information about the outcome with the business. The privacy of businesses (and end-users like you) is of the utmost importance to us. Having said that, please know that we take fraud very seriously and that we have robust, ever-improving safeguards in place. If, after our inquiry, it is determined that we need to take appropriate action, we will. If it appears that we did nothing, it's because we discovered enough proof that the company is abiding by our service agreement. However, rest assured that we conduct in-depth investigations and treat every red flag carefully.

Shortly after that, they told me they wanted to verify my identity and take a selfie, which completed their next requirement. I find they have frozen receiving payments. Send them from everywhere. no answer. They tell me I'm using cards of people I don't know, and it's only one card I've ever used that belongs to me. They will now say in response that the reason is the commercial site, knowing that my site sells devices. computer and there is no high risk. My experience with Stripe is very bad. Content: Stripe Connect is the worst option you can make for your business. You have no analytics for aggregated accounts and can't see the revenue per product. It is hard to believe such a big and famous company has an awful product like this; it is bureaucratic and has the worst support possible. We lost more than USD 20,000 because Stripe couldn't process commissions, and the support took more than 40 days to solve the issue. Find another solution if you can before start integrating with this terrible tool.
Name: charles
Reply: Hi Charles, to check the aggregated accounts, you can use our account overview to view your connected accounts in multiple ways: https://dashboard.stripe.com/connect/accounts/overview. By default, the All accounts tab is selected. However, the other tabs organize accounts according to their status. Each tab provides a list of accounts based on a shared status, but you can use filters to narrow the results further. When you apply a new filter, the account list updates automatically.

Name: Kevin Stoll
Reply: Hi Kevin! We're very sorry that this has been your experience. We’d be more than happy to clarify this for you. 2.9% + 30¢ per successful charge is for domestic cards; this doesn't include charges for cards that are manually entered or if a customer used an international card, as well as currency conversion and others. For more details on pricing, you can check out our pricing page here: https://stripe.com/pricing. We would also like to take a closer look at your account to see the breakdown of charges. Please email us at heretohelp@stripe.com with more details, and we’ll investigate this from our side.

Content: I operate a company in UAE and want to share our recent re-verification experience with Stripe's support. Despite being long-time users, our recent attempt to re-verify has been incredibly frustrating. We submitted the same documents we used to open the account, updating them with new dates as requested for re-verification. However, Stripe was unable to verify them. The support team, despite making promises, has been unresponsive, and our attempts to clarify the situation have gone unanswered. Moreover, the dashboard doesn't accept new documents, as we've reached the limit for uploads. This lack of responsiveness and the inability to resolve the issue promptly is disheartening. We hope this feedback prompts improvement for all users.

Reply: Hi Ian, we're sorry to hear this. For a bit of context, Stripe is an online payment processing platform that allows businesses worldwide to accept payments over the internet. If you tried contacting them but they were unresponsive, the next best step would be to get in touch with your bank to find alternative solutions for the safe return of your funds.

If you're comparing our fees to a card-present service, we (and other card-not-present transaction providers) will always have higher fees due to the risk involved with processing cards online. Title: They will steal your money.

Content: My experience is like many of the reviews below. Stripe seemed easy and professional in setting up my business, but suddenly said they needed additional documentation to determine my (30+ year) business was verified—this request from Stripe was made after they accepted payments we sent to be processed, and they are holding that money without “paying out” for a month now. I have responded and provided a variety of accurate documentation as requested multiple times to no avail—either receiving no response, or additional requests for the same information, etc etc. My requests to speak with supervisors or higher level support are ignored. In the meantime, Stripe has my business payments and will not release them. In sum, I cannot recommend this company and strongly suggest looking elsewhere for your business needs.
Name: Sharon B
Reply: NA
Title: Not recommended!!!

Content: Some of our clients pay through Mangopay and some through Stripe in a lead based platform from where I get jobs. When client pays through Mangopay, money is available instantly to withdraw and when you withdraw it arrives in the bank account in up to couple of hours. Job done. When they pay through Stripe, it's pending 5 days, after which you are allowed to withdraw and when you finally withdraw it takes another few days to arrive in bank account. Money probably would arrive much faster by post than with this company.
Name: JustTheTruth
Reply: Hi  Lyato, we understand how important it is to receive faster payouts. However, payouts on a Stripe account follow a certain payout schedule: https://stripe.com/docs/payouts#payout-schedule and are paid out according to it. Unfortunately, we’re unable to speed these up from our end. If you have any further questions, please don’t hesitate to reach out to us at heretohelp@stripe.com.

Recently, Stripe has withheld a payment from my new account, which processed its first payment of $700, and another payout of $350 from a separate account. Despite maintaining a positive track record with Stripe, I continue to receive automated responses without resolution or explanation. I am patiently awaiting a response to release my payouts and gain insights into why my business is not receiving adequate support.

Content: This is what I wrote to the Stripe team:                         If you look at the notes on my account, you will notice that I made many calls and diligent efforts over multiple days and times, trying to resolve this issue. I was told (not necessarily in this order): I needed to provide an SS-4, the names on the accounts did not match, the ids did not match, that I needed the signatory documents from the bank, that my voided check was illegible, and that some documents were missing. Title: Stripe blocked account +25.000€

Content: I would give them -5 stars if it would allow me! they are the ones committing fraud. Out of the blue they close my account and retracted payments that were made to me from Customers called the Customers they verified to me that they did not receive their money back to them and yet I have yet to be paid for the job, they told me that I didn’t fit their criteria for using their service and canceled my account and kept the money that they retracted from my bank account after they held the money and verified the money and send it to my bank account. Then they turn around and retracted it, and said that I committed fraud , funny how I have yet to see a cop show up my door to serve me papers or to take me to jail. High-performance service and seller product at the customers house at the time of install and purchase they use their credit card for a tap, pay or swipe if it is a fraudulent charge then how come you haven’t retracted the money from my account and paid back the customer that paid with their card. Oh that’s right because there was no fraud and you’re just using this to keep money. I don’t know if they stockpiling money to earn interest on it I don’t know what they think they are doing. To me what they are doing is highly illegal but yet telling the customer that they are the ones that are committing fraud when they know damn good and well there was no fraud committed. I have an LLC through Bank of America that is legitimate but yet I’m not a real business is what they’re saying, I have an LLC with an SS Corp. file through the state of Texas with the tax ID number so if I’m gonna commit fraud, why would I do it it would lead right back to me. There’s been a huge lawsuit against this company and they lost. I guess that’s my I’m gonna have to do it because I don’t understand how they can do what they’re doing and DMV still because people are allowing it, people do not stand up for themselves anymore. It’s sad they did this to you call a lawyer do something about it don’t be silent!

Reply: Hi Robert, we’re sorry to hear that you've experienced this issue. Please write to us at heretohelp@stripe.com with ‘Trustpilot’ in the subject line. We’ll be more than happy to look into this for you.

Content: Customer service is about as horrible as can be.  Poorly trained, off-shore customer service reps who communicate using terminology that is not consistent with the terminology used on the website, and not consistent with standard English language practices.  They denied certain "facts" and when I sent them screenshots as requested, they said that they didn't believe me and needed to escalate this to an "expert".  Their software says I have thousands of dollars available, but they are claiming the is accurate.  I have almost 30 years of electronic banking experience technology experience, these guys are the most poorly trained, ill-equipped, and sleezy folks I've ever encountered.

Title: 3 months for a verification and support…

Content: Since July 21, 2022, while working with Stripe, they suddenly closed our account. They are not processing the remaining balance of €4792 in the account. They are not refunding the payments made by our customers. They are also telling us that the amount will not be deposited to us in any way. I have read some comments here saying that after a 120-day block, they promise to deposit the remaining amount, but they have completely seized our money inside. How dare you seize the money we earned through hard work? You neither refund the cardholders nor send us the money. Who gave you this right? In which law, in which book can such a rule be written? Isn't what you are doing stealing the money of hardworking people? Why do you copy-paste the same automated responses when we reach out to you via email, while you respond so politely to the comments here? Who are you trying to fool? Are all these hundreds of people who wrote negative comments here wrong? Aren't you ashamed of inviting some commenters here to make positive comments for you? You may not want to work with us. You can suspend our account. Our working principle may not be suitable for you. Isn't it illegal to neither refund the customers who made payments nor pay us? How will you defend this reality in court? Which rule that you wrote can legally justify your behavior?
Name: Diyar Lales Ozer
Reply: Hi Diyar, we're incredibly sorry the experience has been less than positive here. We'd like to take a second look at your account from our end. Please email us directly at heretohelp@stripe.com, and we'll follow up as soon as possible.
Title: Who gave you the authority to seize people's money?

Content: Currently waiting for a refund via the Stripe platform and it’s taken over a week with no sign of repayment.  I stopped using Stripe for my business for this very reason.  They charge small businesses a steep 3% for every transaction and then sit with your money for up to two weeks taking far too long to pay out.  No acceptable service for the fees they charge.  Save your money and just use your bank instead.  A far better service.
Name: Amanda
Reply: HI Amanda, thanks for reaching out and we're sorry to hear this. We regularly research the pricing of other online processors for card-not-present transactions, and our fees are competitive with some of the larger companies. You can explore Stripe's various pricing here [0]. Regarding the delay of your payouts, payouts on a Stripe account follow a certain payout schedule [1] and are paid out according to it. We'd like to help you with your refund and payouts—please feel free to reach us at heretohelp@stripe.com with your account details. We’ll take a look.

Title: bad experiance with customer service

Content: Stripe too large and no longer value even mid-tier customers. Even when you are an enterprise customer with a contract, processing millions the level of support shown is poor. Live systems impacted by due diligence requirements despite having been through the full due diligence process with our other accounts. Due to a system bug a new account we setup couldn't be linked to our main legal entity. Despite weeks of chasing their support and our account manager no resolution to the issue and payments on a live site have now been paused costing us thousands and embarrassment with our partner. No reply from Stripe support all day and no extension / fast track of approval even after suppling all the required information and documents. Apparently we now have to wait 3 days for someone to look at it. Never had such poor service in 25+ years of dealing with payment service providers at this level.

Content: I see that these are really concrete adapted technological solutions relevant for business development.Congratulations and courage.What certain countries lack to really develop like countries of West Africa.The difficulty we encounter is how to facilitate deposits from our distributors in West Africa through bank accounts to allow us to place deposits into their activity accounts. Consumers are accustomed to mobile payments in this part of the world. So how can MTS/AO Groupe SARL Mali either integrate mobile payments into its platform or allow the transfer of deposits distributors through mobile payments? The question remains?
Name: Ali Conombo
Reply: Hi Ali—we're happy to hear you're enjoying the service, and we really appreciate your feedback. Though we're not available in Africa yet, we're working hard to expand our global footprint and become universally available. In the meantime, you can sign up to receive regular updates here: (https://stripe.com/global). Moreover, you might want to check out Paystack. Paystack is a Stripe subsidiary company focused on accelerating online commerce across Africa: (https://paystack.com/stripe). If there's anything we can do to assist you going forward, please don't hesitate to get in touch with our support team or via email at heretohelp@stripe.com.

Title: IN CORRECT INFORMATION

Content: Stay away from Stripe! This company has a highly abusive and discriminatory policy. First, they marked our first (and only) card payment transaction as "unauthorized by customer". This was a test transaction (to test the tap-to-pay procedures), for $1, and using my own card (as a business owner). So, their flag was totally groundless and abusive. When I asked about the reasons why this transaction has been considered a fraud, they said "we're not able to provide details as to which charges are considered unauthorized, and have no leeway regarding this restriction". It was hilarious, since there was only ONE transaction ever processed on that Stripe account, and it was totally legit.
Name: Ed
Reply: Thank you for reaching out, Ed. It's important to be aware that testing transactions on your Stripe account using your own credit card is against Stripe's terms of service. This is because such actions can be mistaken for real purchases and refunds, which may lead to various issues, including the appearance of money laundering or other fraudulent activities.

Title: Avoid this company!!!

Content: Our company account got blocked without any prior notice sent to the email address configured for the account. All the previous verifications have been passed by us successfully around half a year back. I contacted the support team right away, but it's been 1.5 weeks already and we have only received an initial automated reply about our case being looked into. No explanations, no feedback or expected resolution time were shared. My emails are not answered, and Stripe even switched off chat and phone support on their website. Online payments were obviously very important to our business and now our operations are heavily affected by the absence of support on the matter. I am utterly disappointed and I guess we will have to look for other payment gateways instead.
Name: Marina Gurianova
Reply: Hi Marina, we apologize for the less-than-ideal support experience you’ve had. For context, Stripe is required by its regulators to collect certain information from account holders in order to prevent abuse of the financial system, and this requirement varies from country to country. Please email us at heretohelp@stripe.com with your account details, and we’ll take another look from our end.

Content: This month, we opened an account with Stripe and had our first customer, and Stripe banned our account. The support is non-existent, people in the call center say they will do something but they never do, and we always get the same response, that they don't know what's happening and can't tell us more, but they're sorry and we should accept things as they are. €1,400 is sitting in our account, we can't refund this money to our customer nor can we transfer it to our bank account. We've completed all the forms, documents, and ID verifications, but still, nothing works. We are a women's fashion company that sells dresses from our own production, which we did for seven years with another payment service, but we thought Stripe was a better option. In the end, it turned out they were just thieves who robbed small businesses.

Content: Been using them for years and never liked them but this is NOT OK!!! How is Stripe legally allowed to withdraw money and hold it on a dispute? But what if I had spent the money? what if they had overdrafted my bank? This can not be legal? They can not just take my money! Perhaps AFTER the dispute was looked at, but they took it before I had a chance to send in my documentation and now my funds are on hold for two months. This is unreasonable!
Name: NA
Reply: Hi there, sorry to hear about the issue and for the confusion here. For a bit of context, when a dispute is raised by the cardholder, Stripe is notified by the card issuer, and they also automatically deduct the disputed amount as well as a fee for processing the dispute. You can read more about the dispute process in our Docs here: https://stripe.com/docs/disputes/how-disputes-work and https://support.stripe.com/topics/disputes Please don’t hesitate to email us at heretohelp@stripe.com if you have any further questions.

Title: Stripe SCAMMER

Content: It needs to be made to clear to everyone that Stripe is simply a PSP (payment service provider) like Square, AmazonPay and Paypal. They aren't an actual merchant processor (i.e. Elavon, Moneris, Global Payments, Network etc...). They will onboard anybody or anything promptly, then their bot algorithms will randomly scour accounts once transactions are being made and you will be put under mandatory "review" for what they say is 2-3 days--- but in my case it has now been nearly 2 MONTHS of them withholding SIX FIGURES. Actual processors perform their diligence BEFORE granting you an account-- but once you are onboarded there are hardly ever any surprises unless you are doing something that is clearly against their terms or your transaction velocity has skyrocketed from your initial sign up.

Name: Joanne C
Reply: Hey, Joanne, we’re very sorry to hear about this. We also appreciate you reaching out to us here. We'd be glad to clarify this for you. For context, Stripe is a payments processor that works with businesses to help them accept payments through their websites, apps, and stores. The merchant might have been set to save a customer's card upon purchase. The best way to take action is by deleting the information via the customer portal if the merchant has activated this feature or by getting in touch with the business you purchased from and having them remove the card information from their account. To learn more, you can check out this guide: https://support.stripe.com/questions/i-would-like-to-delete-the-information-stripe-has-collected-from-me

Reply: Hi Raghul, thanks for reaching out and we're sorry to hear this. For context, the “Know Your Customer” (KYC) obligations for payments require Stripe to collect and maintain information on all Stripe account holders. These requirements come from our regulators and are intended to prevent abuse of the financial system [0]. If, at any time, we are unable to confirm that your business meets these checks or requirements, we may ask you to send us more information to fix the problem. Depending on the severity of the issue, your account may not be able to process payments or receive transfers/payouts until the issue is resolved.

Content: We are an e-commerce company. A customer, once received his order at the adress requested he contacted his bank to block the payment of 650 euro. Despite all the proof we submitted to Stripe and the customer's bank to explain that the customer made the order, that the customer took delivery, that the customer sent us an email conferming that it has been a mistake from his partner and he will contact the bank to approve the payment, the payment has been denied. There have been no support from Stripe, they did not go through the evidence, no investigation to understand who was right,  they did not communicate with the bank, done nothing. The worst is there is no appeal, the bank decision is final. Extremely disapointing, frustrating and it is scary how easy it is to be robbed.
Name: Emporio Italia
Reply: Hi there, we understand this is far from ideal. Stripe has limited scope in dispute matters when a customer goes through their bank. You can read about preventing disputes here: https://stripe.com/docs/disputes/prevention. Title: Absolutely horrible

Name: Bassem E
Reply: Hi Bassem, we appreciate your feedback. For a bit of context, Stripe is required by its regulators to collect certain information from account holders in order to prevent abuse of the financial system, and this requirement varies from country to country. When an account is created, the system will prompt the user to provide the required details for that country. “Know Your Customer” (KYC) obligations for payments require Stripe to collect and maintain information on all Stripe account holders. These requirements come from our regulators and are intended to prevent abuse of the financial system. You can read more information here: https://support.stripe.com/questions/know-your-customer-obligations. Feel free to send us an email at heretohelp@stripe.com if you need further assistance or have any questions so we can help you.

Title: On December 13th

Content: Jesus! Reading the reviews and experiences of others, this is another one of those moments I wish I had seen these reviews before giving this scam company my banking information.
Name: Scotty
Reply: Hi Scotty, thanks for reaching out and we're sorry to hear this. For context, Stripe provides financial infrastructure for the internet. People use our services to enable their purchases and businesses of all sizes use our technology and services to accept payments, send payouts, and manage their businesses online. Stripe wants to be clear about our use of the Personal Data that is entrusted to us [0] [1]. Therefore, Stripe encrypts sensitive data both in transit and at rest. Stripe’s infrastructure for storing, decrypting, and transmitting primary account numbers (PANs), such as credit card numbers, runs in a separate hosting infrastructure, and doesn’t share any credentials with the rest of our services [2]

Content: RUN AWAY FROM STRIPE!!!!                  I opened a stripe account to enable credit card payments for my home remodeling business.  I had a customer make 3 credit card payments for nearly $8k.   Stripe took the payments then charged me the fees of almost $250.  I was then told by Stripe that I could never transfer these funds to my bank because my website was unable to be verified.  My company has no website and never has.  I contacted customer support that took literally an hour to speak to someone in India.  She simply said without a website or social media presence I would never be able to receive my funds. I had them refund my customer but they still charged me fees and refuse to even answer an email about a refund.  Stay away from this overseas based garbage company.  Zero customer service presence. You are allowed to leave a message or send an email

Content: I tried to make a purchase on porkbun.com earlier today. Their payment processor is Stripe. Despite my card being saved with porkbun, payment failed to go through. So I re-entered my card info again as a new card, but again payment failed. It failed multiple times no matter what I did. In the end, frustrated, I opted to pay via Paypal (which I only use as a last resort, because it's troublesome). The Paypal payment went through smoothly and instantly, so I know it couldn't have been a problem with my card (same card was used). I've also had payment problems on other websites that use Stripe as their payment processor. Payment seems to fail more than succeed most of the time. I am based in Singapore so I'm not sure if my location has anything to do with how unreliable Stripe seems to be for me as a consumer who is being forced to use Stripe because some merchants use it as their payment system.
Name: Ammy
Reply: Hi Ammy, thanks for reaching out and we're sorry about your negative experience using our services. If you're having challenges paying your purchase on a business that uses Stripe as their payment processor, we suggest reaching out to the business for assistance. They have the best tools and proper visibility on their backend to know as to why your payment failed. Feel free to reach out to us directly at heretohelp@stripe.com for any Stripe related concerns and we'll follow up to assist with any questions or concerns you may have.
Title: Lousy payment processor that fails more than succeeds

Content: For 5 weeks we have been unable to refund customers who paid with SEPA direct debit. We have been in contact with Stripe support about this for 4 weeks, but they simply cannot solve this major problem for our account. Our company is suffering major damage because of the many customers who are waiting for their refund. Stripe support keeps saying that it is being resolved and is labeled urgent, but it still doesn't work. It's really a shame how this company can't make a simple function like issuing a refund work. We plan to take legal action due to the damage we are currently experiencing from customers canceling their memberships and leaving bad reviews because we cannot give them a refund.

Content: I got an email from Stripe on 29 September 2023 saying that they are closing my account due to the elevated dispute risk associated with my business although there have been ZERO disputes in my account so far since opening it. After the closure of my account, they have blocked the customer support call and chat options for me and only kept the email option available which they don't respond to. Now they are holding all my funds (€1,168.72) and refusing to release them
Name: Ahmed Amin
Reply: Hi Ahmed, we're sorry about your negative experience using our services. For context, Stripe is required by law to complete what's called a KYC (Know Your Customer) survey for every business that signs up with us, regardless of how many transactions they've processed. Unauthorized payments, analysis of the website, the product and service descriptions, and additional information from the bank account used for payouts are all included in the review, and myriad other details and bits of minutiae. We also establish a reserve to help ensure funds are on hand to cover future refunds or disputes if a business does not have enough funds in its Stripe balance. We'd like to help in any way we can—feel free to reach out to us directly at heretohelp@stripe.com, and we'll follow up to assist with any questions or concerns you may have.

Content: We provide SEO and marketing services to our clients. Sometimes the clients go through a change of heart or they know stripe's mindless policies, and they file a dispute, even when we have a clause in our agreement to give a refund. Weve never had a dispute issue before from our hundereds of customers. This happened to us over the holiday season when customer traffic is low and 2 disputes (we are fighting these disputes) were filed which placed our account in negative. Immediately stripe placed restrictions on the account and stopped payouts and without any warning bombarded us with identity documentation requirements, without even giving us time to explain the issue or talk to our customers.. they didnt ask for these explanations when we were earning a high volume in sales.. Now my account is on hold and we have nowhere to turn to as my business suffers.. this is the worst company ever. Avoid it like the plague.

Title: HORRIBLE CUSTOMER EXPERIENCE

Content: I opened a company in the UAE and started working with Stripe. Before that, I accepted payments either in cash or via bank transfer. However, as more clients requested card payments, I successfully went through all verification steps with Stripe and began accepting payments. After a month of using Stripe, I realized it's a company that deceives its customers and takes their money. I accepted payments from clients, one of whom was my aunt. Everything seemed fine, and Stripe was performing as expected. But one day, I received an order from a company to pay me $10,000 for services. I accepted the payment through Stripe, and a minute later, they blocked my account. When I inquired why, they claimed, "the cardholder or bank requested a refund for a recently made payment." I asked for proof and engaged in a lengthy battle with their support, refuting every claim they made against me and my company. After a long discussion, Stripe simply cut me off, citing my business as high-risk and stating they couldn't work with me. I asked about the money in my Stripe account at that time, expected on December 11. Two days after that email, half of the balance disappeared from my account. When I investigated, I found that Stripe autonomously returned the money to clients, deducting it from my account. Even my aunt was on the list of refunded clients. I'm in constant communication with all my clients due to the nature of my work, and none of them initiated or requested any refunds. You can't imagine how low these scammers at Stripe go; they take away people's hard-earned money. Moreover, they froze my account for 120 days, and there's still $7,000 remaining in it. I write to support every day, and I either receive no response or get generic replies. I wish I could share screenshots of my correspondence with these fraudulent individuals so you could see and understand that working with this company is impossible under any circumstances. They might tell you everything is fine and you can accept payments of any amount, but in reality, they deceive you and wait for you to deposit money there. Don't work with scammers and be extremely cautious when choosing such services.

Reply: Hey there, we're incredibly sorry the experience has been less than positive here and that's definitely not what we aim for. Stripe may put a reserve on an account if it is deemed high risk to mitigate against potential future disputes. Title: Bad experience due to reversed money for no reason and no response

Content: We want to share our recent experience with Stripe, and we urge all users to reconsider using their services. Without any valid reason, Stripe suspended our account and withheld €7933 of our hard-earned money, even though we had already delivered the orders to our customers. To add insult to injury, they refunded our customers which they  had already received their foods orders.
Name: Omar
Reply: Hi Omar. We understand how important this is and would like to look into it for you. Please write to us at heretohelp@stripe.com, and we’ll investigate this from our end.
Title: Stripe closed our account with 7933€

Content: We are beyond frustrated with Stripe's recent actions! They extended our payout without any heads up. Then, out of blue, they talk about refunding in 5 days. What happened to fairness? And getting them to respond is like talking to a wall. The lack of transparency and responsiveness, especially after committing to release funds is infuriating. Our impeccable record of 6000 orders with a 0.05% dispute rate deserves better treatment. Sent two emails in 48 hours that look for better communication and resolution, still no response. Seriously annoyed!
Name: Dice Legend
Reply: Hi there, we’re very sorry to hear that. There are a number of reasons why a Stripe account may become unsupportable. For instance, we’re unable to support businesses that are deemed high-risk or account with a high dispute rate. Please email us at heretohelp@stripe.com, and we’ll be happy to take another look.
Title: Extremely Frustrated with Stripe's Unfair Practices

Title: Very professional and helpful…

Content: It was nice to be able to talk to a person rather than a chat bot. First to offer a balnced view you need to understand that working with stripe is new to me, so I have limited knowledge and am learning as I go. I explained my situation and asked how I fix it. You will have the details on your system. The lady was very polite and informed me that she would need a few mins to find a solution. We were cut off by the system and I did get a response by email however the time line did not meet my immediate needs. It resulted in me finding a different solution outside the stripe eco system. Nobodys fault just the way it happened. If I could offer some suggestions - if you included so sort of needs analysis when a client is seeking help it could help you match them up with the right level of knowledge resulting in a quicker turnaround for stripe and a greater satisfaction level with a client. It could be something as basic as ticking a box to show the clients level of expertise with stripe. Alternatively you should be able to work a formula out that shows how long a client has been registered with stripe, the amount and type of transactions would equate to a level of knowledge and therefore match with the appropriate level of knowledge in a customer service person. This is not a criticism of my customer service lady its just looking at the process. Hope this helps Kind Regards Mark Shrubshall
Name: Mark S
Reply: Hi Mark, We're happy to hear your positive review of your interaction with one of our customer support representatives. We really appreciate your feedback, and we hope this is something we can implement soon. If there's anything we can do to assist you going forward, please don't hesitate to get in touch with our support team or via email at heretohelp@stripe.com.

Title: Stripe have gone awol after freezing my accounts to investigate fraud.

Content: I have received my first sale through Stripe. I was lucky enough to get every sale through Paypal but finally I got stuck with a Stripe transaction and now the obstructions to handing over money begins. (No problems with Paypal. People pay and I can log on and transfer the money there and then if I so desire.) Apparently the number I have given them is incorrect is what the dashboard says. I queried that and received a phone call within hours (starfor that), they sent me an email telling me what I needed to provide (star for that), and this is where it gets typical American arrogance. "I haven't provided them with my correct IRS number." The funny thing about that is I am clearly in Australia as per my address and my website and I am not an American citizen. Having an IRS number would be a bigger concern than the fact that I don't have one. Just once, it would be nice to find an American company that recognizes a world outside of America. Au stands for Australia, not Austin, Texas. I am now awaiting their next obstacle to me receiving my money. Note to Americans, we don't pay taxes to the IRS outside of America if we arent American citizens. So anyway, I have looked in my account and changed my ABN to my tax file number and it looks like it might work now so if all goes well I will log back in and upgrade this to five stars if my money transfers into my account as stated. Edit 16/12/2023 - my first two payments have come through with no problems. A delay of one week or less
Name: Karina Honeyman
Reply: Hi Karina, we're sorry to hear you are having issues receiving your payouts due to the account verification. We definitely want to look at it and help you here. Would you mind sending us an email at heretohelp@stripe.com with your email address?

Reply: HI Alex, we're sorry you feel that our fees are high. We regularly research the pricing of other online processors for card-not-present transactions, and our fees are competitive with some of the larger companies. If you're comparing our fees to a card-present service, we (and other card-not-present transaction providers) will always have higher fees due to the risk involved with processing cards online.

Title: Incorrect Business Category

Content: Terrible experience with Stripe! My account was unexpectedly blocked, and despite my attempts to reach out, they ignored me for several days. To make matters worse, they refunded a total of 10,000 euros to all my clients without any prior communication. This felt like a complete robbery, and I consider them the worst company ever. I would rate them -1000 stars if possible. I strongly advise against using Stripe to avoid falling victim to potential scams.
Name: Kaja Pihu
Reply: Hi Kaja, we're sorry to hear that. Businesses that are deemed high-risk are unsupportable on the Stripe platform. Please email us at heretohelp@stripe.com, and we will take a look.
Title: Terrible experience with Stripe

Content: Potentially fraudulent company. We started using stripe after clicking on one of their google ads. We got to over 4,000GBP being held in their platform and they have now refused to release it, with nothing but ambiguous reasoning, no clear explanation, now can't contact them on live chat, seems like there is no option, how convenient. Wish I had read through the reviews before using them, this will be a massive blow to our business and we're now left struggling to pay staff wages. Will have to pursue this legally.
Name: j feer
Reply: Hi there, we’re very sorry to hear that. There are a number of reasons why a Stripe account may become unsupportable. For instance, we’re unable to support businesses that are deemed high-risk or account with a high dispute rate. Please email us at heretohelp@stripe.com, and we’ll be happy to take another look.
Title: Potentially fraudulent company

Content: Horrible thieving company. I had 1 Customer dispute which I won, stripe still closed my account and placed all my funds in reserve for 6 months in case anyone else disputed. 6 months later no one disputed but they said I was high risk and added 1 more month. Now they have released the funds into my main balance but as my account is closed I can't access my money. Everytime I email I get a standard email back saying my funds will NEVER be available to me and that stripe will KEEP them.
Name: LiverpoolScouse
Reply: Hi there, we're sorry to hear this. Stripe may put a reserve on an account if it is deemed high risk to mitigate against potential future disputes. Please email us at heretohelp@stripe.com with your account details, and we will investigate from our side.

Content: My account got closed on Aug 3rd 2023 for no reason saying that I am high risk. I had around $20,000 in stripe balance which got stuck. After multiple emails I was told that my funds will be released after 120 days. Today marks the end of 120 days and I am still not able to get my money. This is so wrong I even tried to email them but all i get is some random automated email back. Stripe is a scam company

Title: NO STARS!

Content: After many years with Stripe I had a problem with a fraudulent transaction.  Sadly, the support staff at Stripe could not be less helpful.  They are not interested in resolving the problem - just constantly sending standard replies that are irrelevant.  I've explained so many times but they just send the same non-sensicle replies every time.  It's clear they just scan for a keyword or two and don't actually read.  What a shame, they used to be such a nice company to deal with but are now hopeless.

Title: Worst customer support ever

Content: Today we found out Stripe keeps all processing fees even if a refund is made. When someone makes an incorrect payment or a duplicate payment, we have to initiate a refund. Found out that whole process cost us the processing fee and Stripe says that it costs them money too. I don't believe it costs them 3.5% of the tranaction to process an electronic transaction. How does Zelle and Venmo make money when they don't charge processing fees?
Name: Lakewood Accounting
Reply: Hi there! We do wish we could return our fees to our users; however, we ourselves incur underlying costs from our banking and card partners when we process refunds. That means that returning fees from refunded charges to our users would be unsustainable for us. We understand that's not what you want to hear; we believe we can best serve you and all of our users by being as transparent as we can about our refund policy and focusing our attention on making Stripe as useful as we can for your business. We'd like to help in any way we can. Feel free to reach out to us directly at heretohelp@stripe.com, and we'll follow up to assist with any questions or concerns you may have.
Title: Processing fees are never refunded!

Content: If you are planning to start a small business, do not, I repeat do not use stripe.com! Their process can take forever leading to you waiting on thousands of dollars for more than a week. Our invoices went out on the 29th and nothing has been deposited. This can be devastating to a small business.
Name: Anthony Zak-SanFilippo
Reply: HI Anthony, we're sorry about your negative experience using our services. If this was your first payout you're expecting to receive, this generally takes 7-14 business days to arrive in your bank account. From that first payout forward, you'll receive payouts on a more regular schedule [0]. If you would like us to check what happened to your payout, you can email us at heretohelp@stripe.com
Title: Don't use it

Content: I didn't want to come here, but after having to deal with Stripe employees in Brazil playing around with verification and email support, I have no choice. It's been over a week since I've been trying to verify my platform on Stripe to start operating it. The platform deals with Crowdfunding, onde of services restricted by Stripe, and according to its terms, verification is necessary before starting to use it. Unfortunately, the employees who got assigned to the verification decided, for reasons unknown, to play around a bit during work hours. And for what I saw on Stripe profile here and on "Reclame Aqui" platform( A Brazilian version of Trust Pilot) I'm not the only in Brazil with this problem. For more than a week, I've been receiving emails requesting more data for verification without specifying what they need. Even when I send more data and ask what else they require, they just keep sending an automated email saying they need more data without answering my question about what additional information they want, and they've also blocked the option to add extra data in the account status tab. They even asked me for pictures of my product stock and storage. Even being a digital crowdfunding platform. Just playing with our face. And for what I saw in another reviews. This have been normal in Brazil Stripe. Stripe have a sérios problem with who they are hiring to work in Brazil.

Content: I recently encountered a serious issue involving Stripe, despite not being a direct client of theirs. Name: JohnL
Reply: Hi there. We understand that you've discovered an unrecognized charge on your bank account, which can be very worrisome. If you’re unsure which business has charged you, you can use our secure charge look-up tool to find more information about the business that charged you: https://support.stripe.com/charge-lookup/. For a bit of context, Stripe is an online payment processing platform that allows businesses worldwide to accept payments over the internet. If you are not able to find out or contact the business that charged you, we advise that you reach out to your bank to check on how you can get your funds back safely, like filing a dispute.

Title: They don’t want to solve a huge problem, I lose clients and money!

Content: In September of 2021 Stripe found fraud of nearly 87K had occurred in our account, they professionally dealt with and marked it resolved as is their job for the "Gold Standard" of credit card processing.  On October 9th of 2023 we received a fraud text to the admin of the account. On October 17th admin was locked out of our account and Stripe notified our business of fraud shortly there after.  We immediately began to dispute and rectify this with stripe.  One transaction for $15,321 dollars fraudulently charged in this account.  Our stripe account had been hacked.  From 11/7/23 through 11/14/23 our case had been escalated dozens of times through supervisor after supervisor, each representative disclosed they would not take responsibility for the fraud.  On 11/9 Beverly from Stripe informed us she had "re-enabled" the security protection on our account that protects changing bank accounts for incoming deposits to require the old account number be "typed" in prior to replacing with an new account number, as the system will not show the old number.  When asked how this was disabled they had no response, but said it should be active as "default" on all accounts. Our obviously was not.  We requested limits and spending controls as our average sales are less than $100 each and certainly not tens of thousands at a time.  We were immediately told a specialist would contact us. This did not happen.  On 11/10 we submitted evidence on the $15,321 inquiry so that they could see clearly this was fraud.   On 11/14/23 Marie called from Stripe and said they would not cover any losses, nor could she answer any of our existing questions regarding limit controls or the default banking security breach.  She would also escalate the case to have the current balance reviewed and explained. We cannot get them to explain the dollars in our account that exceed what we are owed, but do not match the charges they say occurred. Noone would help us process payout for the dollars we were due and leave disputed dollars in the account for Stripe to resolve.  We do not want more than we are owed, simply what our actual customers have spent with us.   Yesterday at 1am on 11/19, they reported the customers bank has chosen a chargeback and leaving this balance on a small business to deal with.  We are now dealing with the police and the Federal Trade Commission.  Stripe has continuously put us on the back burner and refused to address many of our primary concerns.  The least of which is how are we responsible for a breach through a control for changing account numbers that cannot be activated or toggled by the admin of the account? This is purely a Stripe backend function.  Stripe is now holding a small business essentially hostage.  This is abhorrent behavior by the "gold standard" of credit card processing and we demand a resolution.

Reply: Hey, Brooke. We're incredibly sorry the experience has been less than positive here. We'd like to take a second look at your account from our end. Please email us directly at heretohelp@stripe.com, and we'll follow up as soon as possible.

Name: Hello
Reply: Hi there, we're sorry to hear this. You can close your account from your Dashboard. Account deletion can only be done by the account owner. To do this, click on the "Settings" tab, and then click into the section titled "Account Details". Once there, you will see a button to close your account: https://dashboard.stripe.com/account. Here's a link that provides more insight into this process, and explains what happens to your account once it's closed: https://support.stripe.com/questions/close-a-stripe-account

Title: Stripe has been hacked in my name

Content: Stripe recently held a $2000 customer payment that was made on September 22nd, 2023. This was my first invoice paid on the account. They originally said it would be seven days to process, then it became two months, and now it is 120 days from the time the payment was processed. This is my money, my customer's money and Stripe had no right to enact such an absurd policy. After some research and speaking with some other merchants, I am finding that the list of issues with STRIPE is continuing to grow. I have reported Stripe to the Federal Trade Commission and plan to do what I can to protect businesses and consumers from Stripe's consumer and merchant abusive policies. It appears they have gotten too big and think they can do whatever they want to people. This is America and no bank or processing company has a right to hold money hostage that belongs to the merchants and the consumer. We must stop these institutions from exercising the control of financial resources which is in fact the definition of communism.

Reply: Hi Janice, we're incredibly sorry the experience has been less than positive here. We'd like to take a second look at your account from our end. Please email us directly at heretohelp@stripe.com, and we'll follow up as soon as possible.

Content: I've been a Stripe customer for over 10 years and I've seen the company grow, change, and evolve. I have always been a huge proponent of Stripe and what they do. Title: Great customer service.

Content: I just want warn everyone, like so many have before about Stripe. They will really and openly steal your money! So we have a legitimate bussniess where we sell products, we signed up with Stripe (BIG MISSATKE) Orders started coming in and we shipped all order with tracking numbers, key word here is tracking numbers. Which shows all order recived, signed and delivered to all customers. First few payout from stripe worked fine, then when it came to 3 big payout from Stripe, they never arrived. They kept saying we should talk to our bank. We talked to our bank who said no money arrived and they cant trace any funds. It should be the sender bank who can trace it. We informed this to stripe, who kept replying we will get back to you as soon as possible to all of our emails. For weeks, while we had no funds or payment. Then when they replied, same story.. they replied talk to your bank! Finally i had enough and asked my bank for statement letter which says no funds recived and that they cannot trace any funds. As soon as i send this letter to them and inform them if they not pay out i will report them. Then all of sudden they say that the payment was failed and returned and i should see this in my stripe account again and i can request payout again. So i did, i requested payout of the "Failed" payment again. And as soon as i did that, they send me email saying that they are closing my account because unauthorized payment and they will refund customer from my funds! I asked which order was unauthorized because we have delivered all order and we have proof. They did not answer us on this one. Only kept replying to all emails, after reviewing your accounts we decided to refund customer from your funds. I asked again and again which order is unauthorized as all order delivered with proof. They did not answer us. So now they have our funds and will not return to us as they will use the funds to refund some imaginary unauthorized order in which they cannot inform me about. So today i have contacted my lawyer and we have filed a complaint with European financial services. DO NOT USE STRIPE!!!

Title: their stupid A.I blocked our account for no valuable reason

Content: I processed many orders with many customers during my first 2 months using Stripe.
Name: Flavio
Reply: Hi Flavio, we're sorry about your negative experience using our services. For context, Stripe performs a review on every user's account. Stripe is required by law to complete what's called a KYC (Know Your Customer) survey for every business that signs up with us, regardless of how many transactions they've processed. Unauthorized payments, analysis of the website, the product and service descriptions, and additional information from the bank account used for payouts are all included in the review, and myriad other details and bits of minutiae. That being said, we'd like to help in any way we can—feel free to reach out to us directly at heretohelp@stripe.com, and we'll follow up to assist with any questions or concerns you may have.
Title: Lost 1000 € due to Stripe

Content: The hackers managed to get into my account even though I have 2 factor authentication. They managed to change the phone number, add new team members on and change the bank details. They stole thousands from my customers in my company’s name! The only thing Stripe managed to do is give me back access to my account. Stripe paid my customers there thousands of £s back and basically gave me the bill. Why they haven’t even attempted to contact the fraudulent bank is beyond me! I have sent them countless emails and received a generic response. It makes me think they do not understand my situation but oh they do! They just don’t care it’s too much effort for them to contact the fraudulent bank they would rather just send me the bill and say unauthorised transactions are my responsibility. How can that be when they are the middle man handling these transactions? If that’s the case then why are they trading? IF I WERE YOU I WOULD STAY FAR AWAY FROM STRIPE. Looking at the reviews it looks like this has happened to loads of people. THEY ARE MAKING MONEY OUT OF THIS! THE WHOLE COMPANY IS A FRAUD! This is now going through legals and is being reported to the police and FCA. In cases like this it should be reported to the FCA so they are aware of Stripes wrongdoing. PLEASE REPORT TO FCA IF THIS HAS HAPPENED TO YOU!

Content: We are a small business owning a funeral home and also sell urns interstate. We used stripe for payments - an interstate client ordered an urn, received the product, were happy with the product and then told their bank it was a fraudulent payment - they in essence received their product for free. We lost the claim with no explanation. KEEP AWAY FROM STRIPE. There is no guarantee that you will receive your money.

Content: We are a small business, over a week ago we reported to Stripe our account had been hacked, we have been frantically trying to get support and help from Stripe to help us gain access to our account.  We have been told on their chat support that someone is looking at it and will be in touch, NO ONE has been in touch except us trying to get this urgent issued resolved.  In the meantime a past customer rang us yesterday to say his credit card had been charged £200 twice and his bank told him it was requested from us.....OMG this is so stressful, I am now concerned that this stress will cause my husband to have a heart attack.  We have reported this fraud to the police but in the meantime we need Stripe to CALL us urgently , not message us via their chat but to actually call us and speak to us.  I DO NOT RECOMMEND using Stripe for your business, avoid at all cost.

Title: We are a small business

Content: It's almost one week now since Stripe after about 30k processed in 3/4 months with no chargeback, all of a sudden block my account and say that my business is not supported (I sell clothing online) blocking 9k in my account for 5 months and then trying to charge me 2k on my bank account without any reason at all. Luckily I was able to block their attempt otherwise this nightmare would cost me 11k in total. If you are reading this reviews to understand if Stripe fits well for your business or not, well, just read this and all the other reviews to understand better which kind of legalized mafia you want to deal with. They lock your funds with no reason and make your business fail just because they "think" you are an high risk for them, even if you do everything correctly, even if you take care of every single customer, even if your business is your life and use it to mantain your family. They don't care, they just wake up some day and randomly block your account, ask for some proof which you spend time to get and provide them and 30 sec after you upload proof they permanently restrict your account without even taking a look at what you've sent them. Hope this business will be shut down and who run this mafia will be punished for scamming millions of merchant!

I filed a charge back and Stripe went out of their way to respond back and lie saying I went to his website and got the goods I ordered.  It was a service transaction not a goods transaction so how is that even possible?  Attorney doesn't even have a website.  Needless to say they kept the money and helped this guy commit fraud.  I will never support a Stripe company from here on out.

Content: Stripe's service, which used to be outstanding, has become abysmal. One of the biggest business demands when dealing with a payment provider is attention to customer queries, timely presence, and transparency. All of these have been diluted in their foolish decision to eliminate telephone customer support, which used to be instantaneous, and was a flagship of the service. Just now they have pushed the poorly named customer service to chat and email channels, demanding enormous waiting times to solve inconveniences and basic requests on many occasions. I am totally disappointed to see how they have deteriorated a company that from our position as a digital service provider we have recommended to so many other institutions in our customer base.

Name: Humair
Reply: HI Humair. We’re sorry to hear this. For context, please know that dispute is a legal process initiated by the card network, which Stripe and merchants like you must abide by. Stripe's only role in the entire dispute process is to provide guidance in submitting your evidence (through your Stripe dashboard) and have it communicated to the cardholder's bank. In case you're interested, you can read more about how disputes work here [0]. Nevertheless, we’d like to take a closer look and see what went wrong here—please write to us at heretohelp@stripe.com. End of day it's for everyone's benefit to weed out scammers; plus, there was a real human being on the other side of our back and forth communications trying to verify normal business activity who appreciated kindness. I asked if there were alternative way to verify my identity, but they would not reply to my question. The only reply i got from Stripe was similar to the posts you see in this forum: generic, and robotic.
Name: Stripe_Suck
Reply: Hi there—sorry to hear you're having issues verifying your account. “Know Your Customer” (KYC) obligations for payments require Stripe to collect and maintain information on all Stripe account holders. These requirements come from our regulators and are intended to prevent abuse of the financial system. You can check out the tips we gather here: https://support.stripe.com/questions/troubleshooting-id-upload-for-identity-verification. If you're still encountering any difficulties, feel free to contact us via heretohelp@stripe.com
Title: WARNING

Content: Stripe also resell their product as WooPayment, in short be VERY CAREFUL, they have a total insecure payment method which allows scammers to go through. They fail to do basic CVC checks on payment which can later be disputed and you as a merchant have to fork the bills.

Content: The support is BS. I tried many times to verify the identity. Despite it being all legit. It always gets rejected. If it's an automated system, add some more power to it. This is all a way to give trouble. Nothing else. I have talked to 100s of representatives as of now, no conclusions. It's been almost around 2 weeks that this issue has cost me a lot of time and money.

Content: Nothing went right with this company...I made my first transactions with them and waited the 7 DAYS that they require before you're allowed to process your first payout. 7 DAYS (NOT business days, but calendar days) passed and I manually processed my first payout. The system updated and confirmed my payout funds would be deposited to my BOA business checking acct, on 9/14/23, but they weren't. You can't talk to a damn person on the phone and can only get support through email or chat...which is useless, because they just tell you more lies and feed you b.s. to get you off the chat and back in the waiting line for your funds. Wouldn't treat my worst enemy this horribly, but stay clear and find anyone else!
Name: Wayne Liewald
Reply: Hi Wayne, sorry to hear that your payout has been delayed. We certainly understand how frustrating this is. Please note that the first payout for every new Stripe account is typically paid out 7 days after the first successful payment is received. This waiting period can be up to 14 days for businesses in certain industries. This delay allows Stripe to mitigate some risks inherent in providing credit services. You can read more about this here: https://support.stripe.com/questions/common-questions-about-payout-schedules. If you have any further questions, please don’t hesitate to contact us at heretohelp@stripe.com.
Title: Stay clear and go with literally anyone but Stripe!

Content: For some reason, the receipt is sent to the junk holder. So I will have to manually send the receipt again. This will be a double effort.
Name: Suikoushya Co Ltd.
Reply: Hi there, we appreciate you reaching out to us regarding your concern. You can try to find the email there, mark it as “not junk” and save Stripe’s email address to your contacts to prevent it from happening in the future. You may also check your mail filters. Most email services provide filtering options to help you sort and manage your inbox. Check to see if a filter might have redirected the email elsewhere in your inbox. If you still encounter the same issues even after doing the troubleshooting, feel free to reach out to us directly at heretohelp@stripe.com, and we'll check for other options.

Name: James T
Reply: Hi James, we're incredibly sorry the experience has been less than positive here and that's definitely not what we aim for. Stripe is a payment processor that facilitates transactions between our users and their customers. Unfortunately, Stripe does not have the authority to intervene as this matter relates to the relationship between you and the business you transacted with. If you are unable to get in touch with the business, the next course of action would be to reach out to your bank for options.

Name: Jennifer Freed
Reply: Hi Jennifer, we’re sorry to hear that your payout has been delayed. We certainly understand how frustrating this is. Payouts on a Stripe account follow a certain payout schedule: https://stripe.com/docs/payouts#payout-schedule and are paid out according to it. It is also worth noting, that the first payout for every new Stripe account takes 7-14 days (7 business days) to deposit in your bank account. This delay allows Stripe to mitigate some risks inherent in providing credit services. You can read more about this here: https://support.stripe.com/questions/common-questions-about-payout-schedules. If you have any further questions, feel free to contact us at heretohelp@stripe.com.

Content: I have used all the other major credit card processing brands, paypal, square, etc. Stripe is by far the slowest, weakest in customer support, and take a very long time to preform a payout vs any of the other brands. Name: Cory Strang
Reply: Hi Cory, we appreciate your feedback! Payout availability can vary based on the industry and country you’re operating in. In most cases, when you start processing live payments from your customers with Stripe, you won’t receive your first payout until 7–14 days after receiving your first successful payment. Additionally, you will find common reasons and solutions for payouts that appear delayed or missing here: https://support.stripe.com/topics/payouts. If there's anything we can assist with, please feel free to reach out to us at heretohelp@stripe.com.
