Title: These guys are amazing

Content: I use stripe for my website sales. I had some orders for high value items which I sent to the client. Weeks later it became apparent this was a fraudster, they told their bank they had not received the items I sent. Stripe immediately took the money out of my Stripe account. I was given the option to counter the allegation, I have proof of delivery so I countered their claim. Stripe said I will find out in 6weeks if I get the money back or not. Stripe tried to take more money out of my business bank account too. They offered no resistance and took the money from my Stripe account without me having a chance to defend myself. As a Stripe user I am guilty until proven innocent. I had a client make a £520 order through my website whilst this was going on, I tried to refund them but because Stripe had allowed HSBC to perform a chargeback I now am -£2000 so the refund will not go through. Stripe offered no help at all and kept telling me this was the process. I sent Stripe proof of postage and proof the fraudster received their items. Stripe said HSBC may send my funds back or may not. Either way I have to wait 6-weeks. I am closing my account down and have already moved to another payment system company. If you get targeted by fraud, Stripe will do nothing to help you
Name: Lee
Reply: Hi Lee, we understand this is far from ideal. Stripe has limited scope in dispute matters when a customer goes through their bank. You can read about preventing disputes here: https://stripe.com/docs/disputes/prevention. When a dispute is raised by the cardholder, the card issuer notifies Stripe and automatically deducts the disputed amount as well as a fee for processing the dispute. We then notify you and pass along to you all information related to the dispute that we receive from the issuer via the Dashboard and API. If you choose to fight the dispute by submitting evidence, the issuer will review the evidence you presented and return a win or loss decision within 60-75 days of the evidence due date. This decision from the issuer is final and cannot be challenged by any party. That is to say, if you lose the dispute you cannot appeal this decision, but if you win, the cardholder also does not have the ability to challenge this. You can read more about the dispute process in our Docs here: https://stripe.com/docs/disputes/how-disputes-work. We're happy to help with any issues or questions. Please email us at heretohelp@stripe.com.

Content: I have been using stripe for 1 year from India. When I use direct stripe links for payments, I never face any problem. However, I have faced payment failures with pretty much every vendor who integrates with Stripe—starting from Podia, Zenlar, Appointlet, Freshlearn, WooCommerce, etc. And every time I reach out to Stripe, they pass the blame onto the vendor for having a faulty integration and forwarding some lame documentation. Unfortunately all major vendors support stripe when it comes to international payments. So I am not left with any other options but to use vendor partners who also have Paypal integrations.
Name: Moumita
Reply: Hi Moumita, we're incredibly sorry the experience has been less than positive here. Just a bit of context, many third-parties build on top of Stripe, each with their own custom code and unique integrations. However, these integrations are not built or maintained by Stripe, which is why Stripe has no visibility into their systems or data when there are issues. The best way to resolve the problem within a third party's integration would be to reach out to them directly so they can work it from their end.

Name: Eric
Reply: We understand how frustrating it can be when you can't make a payment. We'd love to look into this, but to do so, we would need to know the charge ID from the declined transaction, and only the business you tried purchasing from knows this. For a bit of context, Stripe is a payments processor that works with businesses to help them accept payments through their websites, apps, and in-stores. In line with this, we can't share any Stripe account information with anyone other than the business. So we would recommend reaching out to the company you were trying to make the purchase from and having them reach out to Stripe so we can look into this.

Title: Cost us £ thousands for our IT staff…

Content: I am a fairly new to Stripe. I created my account almost 2 weeks ago as I was looking for different payment processing options. My business is far from new. I got a request to verify my Identity after the first couple of transactions. I thought that was unusual but complied regardless. After that, my account was re-enabled for payouts and as I started to slowly shift more transactions onto stripe to fully commit to it, I get sent an email today with the Subject Line: "[Important] Closure of your Stripe account". It explained that my account was closed due to "unauthorized charges" even though I knew every single one of the customers that paid me. I've had my troubles with Stripe Radar blocking legitimate payments and sometimes the bank declining for no reason at all. The banks of my customers are also clueless as to why it declines. But anyway, there were no unauthorized charged on my account and stripe is holding my money for no reason at all. They also mentioned they would refund all my customers after 5 days. This is unacceptable!!!!

Reply: Hi James, we’re very sorry to hear that. There are a number of reasons why a Stripe account may become unsupportable. Content: Please whatever you do don’t use this company. I started a small business and as soon as I had set up my stripe account I was targeted by fraudsters testing cards on my website. I contacted stripe as soon as I noticed this and asked them multiple times to freeze the account to protect people’s cards and they didn’t do it. A large amount of money went through the account and I returned it all to the people who’s cards were targeted. Stripe has charged me €179 claiming that some of the transactions were successful and demanding a commission be paid to them even though I never received any payments. No wonder these two Irish brothers are billionaires your company is as bad as the fraudsters. Don’t use stipe!

I am very skeptical. Shouldn't we open the 3ds certification? Can I reactivate my account?

Content: Did you know if you process a payment and then credit back your customer you still pay the fee!  Get this.  I had a customer process a payment with a typo. So, any error making a payment on our website will result fees, even typos.

Name: Ian Alexander
Reply: Hi Ian, we're very sorry to hear you experience this issue. For context, Stripe is a payment processor that works with businesses to help them accept payments through their websites, apps, and in store. With this being said, you might have saved your information through consumer "Link" -- it is a Stripe product that allows you to save your payment details and shipping information for online purchases in one place. Using Link, your details will auto-populate on the checkout page of any business which supports Link, allowing you to pay in one click. You can delete your Link account in two ways:

The worst is that the instant payout function has never worked for me, and their support for the issues was time consuming and just kept saying 'we paid you' and links to a FAQ page.  It didn't resolve anything.  I'm moving to a different payment processor.

Content: This company takes payment for a company called emissioncharge.uk who are a company that scam people in the UK out of money they thought they have paid to the government for the ULEZ. How about you do your due diligence and look at the companies you associate with?
Name: Fiona
Reply: Hi Fiona, we’re sorry to hear about your experience. If you believe you’ve been fraudulently charged, we strongly recommend contacting the concerned business first to resolve the issue. However, if the business is unresponsive or the solution unsatisfactory, the next step is to file a dispute with your bank. When you file a dispute, your bank passes all relevant details to Stripe, and we use this data in our ongoing effort to combat fraud. You can learn more about disputing a purchase made through Stripe here: https://support.stripe.com/questions/disputing-a-purchase-made-through-stripe.

That means returning fees from refunded charges to our users would be unsustainable for us. You can read more about this here: https://support.stripe.com/questions/understanding-fees-for-refunded-payments

Content: I have a website and use Stripe as my payments platform, and scammers got into it ( in Los Angeles) they changed my email and bank details to there own, they also used my customers email addresses and created lots of dodgy invoices. One of these was succeeded by stripe. the others were blocked by the customers various credit cards. so I was scammed for £4200. The support I have received has been terrible. Basically the support team got me back into my account, I saw the fraudulent transaction and they talked me through how to do a refund. They said the money would come back out of the scammers bank account. (it didn't) so they have tried to take the money from me. they have kept £500 of my website sales (they have taken it off of the balance). they have authorised a full refund but I have never had it. For some reason they have processed it as a USD bank when I have a GBP bank. I have spent untold hours trying to get them to sort it but each time I either get, there's an ongoing case so I am going to shut this one down, or the investigations team will be in touch... and nothing!! round and round in circles!, honestly the support I have had has been so bad that I had to take a step back and breath!. I have spoken to my bank so they can't get the money from me. the scammers obviously took their money and ran.
Name: Mrs Speight
Reply: Hi Mrs Speight, we're sorry about your negative experience using our service and that's definitely not what we aim for. We'd like to take a second look at your account and support case to see what we can do to help. Please email us directly at heretohelp@stripe.com as soon as possible so we can get started. Thank you.

Content: For the third time, my business lost a dispute and Stripe did nothing to support me.  In this situation, I provided more than the necessary supporting evidence to prove that the customer chose not to access the services we offer.  I sent additional messages regarding the fact that more evidence was discovered after the initial dispute response.  It was clear that the customer chose not to access our offering.  Ultimately, since the dispute came through  J.P. Morgan Chase bank, the bank sided with their customer and my business lost.
Name: TahoeJenay
Reply: Hi Jenay, we're incredibly sorry the experience has been less than positive here and that's definitely not what we aim for. Stripe facilitates your participation in the process, but we do not originate disputes on behalf of cardholders, and we do not decide the outcome of your disputes. In payment card networks, these roles are played by the card issuers. We'd like to take a second look at your account to see what we can do to help. Please email us directly at heretohelp@stripe.com as soon as possible so we can get started.

Content: our account (acct_1N1SbkLuNqVYxxTH) was out of the blue disabled by Stripe without any genuine cause or reason, either this is a mistake by their algorithm or a definite mistake by a human. Our business is spread across 7 different countries and never had issues elsewhere, with other processors (card present and even B2C in various countries). We were due our summer launch on B2C in the United States and EU and now have this massive inventory sitting in our warehouses as it was exclusively for B2C. We had interviews scheduled with 2 publications and a couple of influencers on board for this launch as well and now out of the blue, Stripe disables our business account under arbitrary reasons. We respectfully request them to review and reevaluate again before we take this further up with media and legal. It's strange to us that a lot of other companies are sharing similar experiences on here.
Name: Bathsy
Reply: Hi Bathsy, we’re very sorry to hear that. There are a number of reasons why a Stripe account may become unsupportable. For instance, we’re unable to support businesses that are deemed high-risk or account with a high dispute rate. Please email us at heretohelp@stripe.com, and we’ll be happy to take another look.

Content: Stripe is a remarkable payment processing platform that has truly impressed me. With its intuitive user interface and easy-to-use API, managing payments for my business has become a breeze. I highly recommend Stripe for anyone in need of a reliable and user-friendly payment solution.

Content: Full of crap. They approved the account initially. I did some test payments to check if the payouts and everything would be smooth. I used my own cards. (Now I am told that it is against the ToS to test in Live Environment), but this isn't the reason they go ahead and close my account. After a month or so, I take a payment from a client for a service I already had provided. The next day, Feb 4th, I get an email that I need to provide additional information. Shortly after which I get another email that my account is closed. I complain about this and after several weeks, am told that the account was wrongfully closed. Only several minutes later, support tells me that no it is closed. In March I am told by their customer support that the account was closed on Feb 3rd and the amount held will be released and the payout will be available on Jun 4. After 120 days. On June 5, I ask them that why can't I payout even though that the dashboard says the funds are available to withdraw, they say that my account was closed on 18th feb and I have to wait until 20th June and then they'll see if I should be getting the funds or not. Today I get an email from support after a week of daily emails (asking for details and no response), that they are trying to help and I need to be patient and wait until June 20th. 120 days after a transaction and I still can't get the payout. They don't respond, no details when they do after dozens of emails from me.
Name: Tayyab Nadeem
Reply: Hey Tayyab—We're incredibly sorry the experience has been less than positive here and that's definitely not what we aim for. We'd like to take a second look at your account and support case to see what we can do to help. Please email us directly at heretohelp@stripe.com as soon as possible so we can get started—thank you.

Name: Diane j
Reply: Hi Diane, we’re sorry to hear about your experience. If you believe you’ve been fraudulently charged, we strongly recommend contacting the concerned business first to resolve the issue. However, if the business is unresponsive or the solution unsatisfactory, the next step is to file a dispute with your bank. When you file a dispute, your bank passes all relevant details to Stripe, and we use this data in our ongoing effort to combat fraud. You can learn more about disputing a purchase made through Stripe here: https://support.stripe.com/questions/disputing-a-purchase-made-through-stripe.

Content: I used this company for our short term rental business though a web based hosting company for short term property owners. After years of using Stripe I put in the request to lower our payout from 7 days to whatever was faster. Do you think this company/CSR would just look at my past and existing business and flip a switch..nope. They demanded I justify my business by telling them what I was going to do for them going forward? They wanted my personal banking statements?? They wanted financial statements??...just idiotic. So the response...we are building our own site, plugging in our own credit card processing service direct, and they were fired and the hosting company, their partner, is being replaced by our own site. As well they would not escalate and their customer service is just awful....check their online reviews the last 1.5 years...horrifying. DO NOT USE THIS COMPANY!
Name: Gerry Merz
Reply: Hi Gerry—we're very sorry you feel this way, and we apologize if you were left feeling frustrated. The last thing we want to do is frustrate our users, however we have a duty of care and regulations to comply with, so some steps that may seem redundant are very necessary for compliance reasons. We'll take this feedback on board, and we wish you the best going forward.

Content: These guys are total trash. The customer support has no idea how their own validation system works, much less how a business works or is registered in the countries it allegedly supports. I asked what kind of verification documents they needed, and the representative just said over and over “documents showing you’re legit” pretty much word-for word.  They were unable to explain anything whatsoever about what that is supposed to mean, what Stripe considers to be valid documents, or whether the “documents” they were asking about were even required or if they were just a vague suggestion of one way I could pass the verification.  On top of all that, the rep talked like a 15 year old kid or an Internet troll and refused to put me through to any other rep or any manager to speak to anyone who even knew how the verification system works.  Please do NOT put your money with a company like this which has no publicized standards for anything, and reps who know nothing about their own product.

Content: 5/9/23 update - After receiving the reply from Stripe, I emailed them for an account review. To my surprise, I got a reply back very quickly from an actual person who stuck with me the entire way through the process. They reviewed an explanation and some documents I provided and reversed the reserve within a couple days. I am very impressed with their response to this.  I was expecting them to reply back with the same robot type response I got from the other department. The only reason I did not give them a 5 star review is because of the time it took to deal with all of this. I hope they take this feedback to review businesses more carefully before choking their funds. Thanks again Stripe!

Content: Before accepting any payments, I asked a Stripe agent very clearly how long it would take me to receive payments : they said immediate payout plus 2 to 3 business days depending on the bank.  So I accepted my first payment, and instead of immediate payout, it showed a 7-day delay. So I had to wait 7 days, and missed the deadline for a business payment because of it.  I contacted customer service several times before to notify them of the problem and they did absolutely nothing (just tons of different messages from different reps all saying sorry, someone will reach out to you soon).  I ended up having to borrow money to make the payment. If I had been told in the beginning the payment would take 7 days, I would have organized things differently so as to avoid the problem in the first place.

First time using the account, customer pays their bill and it is now being held by Stripe as my account does not meet their terms and conditions. Funnily enough, they had no problem setting up my account and having the first payment go in.. They send you the same automated, copy and pasted response to either chats or emails. I have issued complaint after complaint and they still won't give me a straight answer. They have no option to call them and when you go to request a call back, it takes you around a never ending circle which ends in you getting bored of seeing the same screen and give up. I would not recommend this company to anyone. I have now sent a complaint via their complaint form and emailed the "here to help" email. Customer service is non existent.

Title: Stripe scams you - Stripe vous arnaque

Content: They got our business the same way as the others stated here. We had the Stripe RADAR turned on to saying to reduce chargebacks and disputes. However, on our first and only chargeback (Which the customer fraudlently did AFTER they received the ordered items) stripe is closing our account.  Its funny Stripe accused us of an unauthorized credit card transaction when actually STRIPE is our credit card processing. They are the ones that processed and accepted the payment and notified us to go ahead and ship the order. They then charged us a fee for accepting the payment.  I sent them all the evidence (Emails, Order, Tracking number of delivery, etc.)  proving their was no way it was unauthorized but they would not budge. Don't bother sending them proof they won't accept it anyway. Lastly, when they know you are right they simply close your account saying it was a high risk account for disputes. We are so glad they are not our primary credit card processing company for our business.

Content: I have a small business, and decided to try stripe for manual card payments over the phone. The process is over complicated, and the money, although it was only £30 something, took over two weeks to arrive. There is no justification whatsoever for a payment provider to take this long to pay the money forward in 2023. We were seriously thinking of using them for our main business, but after this trial will definitely not. Take note, if you want to wait for your money with no ability to transfer it instantly yourself, then use stripe, we wont be. Add to that a mystery 13p outstanding balance with no explanation so i cant close the account merely adds to my suspicion about this company.
Name: john smith
Reply: Hi John, we understand how important it is to receive faster payouts. However, payouts on a Stripe account follow a certain payout schedule: https://stripe.com/docs/payouts#payout-schedule and are paid out according to it. Unfortunately, we’re unable to speed these up from our end. Please note that instant payouts are available subject to eligibility and as such, new Stripe accounts aren’t immediately eligible. We’d recommend taking a look at our documentation here: https://stripe.com/docs/payouts/instant-payouts. If you have any further questions, please don’t hesitate to reach out to us at heretohelp@stripe.com.

Title: Thieving scumbags

Content: I've been a Stripe customer since 2015. On 4/10/23 I received an email that there was fraudulent activity on my account. I discovered my account had been hacked via fraudulent Connect accounts. The hacker set up a fake business under the name "Albert Dawkins at Netflix Inc.", and with zero other identifying information was able to charge credit cards AND pay them out instantly to debit cards, also with zero identifying information. When I reached out to Stripe via email and phone for support to get help with someone fraudulently using my account to steal from other people - instead of helping me dispute these charges, Stripe closed my account and started taking money out of my business bank account to refund the fraudulent transactions that they NEVER paid to me in the first place. They continued to attempt to remove money from my bank account even after I asked them for help. After 3 days of back and forth with them, they are telling me that I'm liable for over $70,000 of fraudulent transactions that they allowed to occur on my account, that didn't come from me or my business, and they are completely ignoring the fact that someone has exploited their platform to steal from other people via their customer's accounts, and they are trying to take money from me to pay back fraud they are allowing to happen. It's appalling. I've been a Stripe customer for 8 years with zero issues until now. I'm a small business that doesn't even have $70k of transactions in one quarter, and they are continuing to attempt to debit my bank account and will not help me - they just keep telling me that I am responsible to pay back the money that "Albert Dawkins of Netflix Inc." stole from from people and continue to attempt to withdraw money they gave to "Albert Dawkins" in the form of instant debit card payouts. If you are using Stripe to process payments for your business, beware. Apparently anyone can just use the Connect feature to hide fraudulent transactions in your account and Stripe will make you pay for it.
Name: Shannon Mattern
Reply: NA

Content: Absolute Garbage. They will hold your payment for 14 days and possibly more if you aren't in the US.  Guess what they are doing with all that money they are sitting on from these customers..... Must be a good amount of interest paid out to them on your money.  They wont tell you this until after you receive your first payment either.  So in my case, I have to work for free for two weeks before I get the money that was sent with a debit card.  So Stripe literally received the money immediately, but wont let the funds go for my protection. lol.  How are you protecting me by holding money from my customers? So sorry I transferred over to them, now I have to ask my customer that was first to move over to switch back to a legit company.  Oh yeah, by the way, on top of that they take a pretty good chunk of your money from you for their "Services" of holding on to thousands of people's money.  Spread the word, they need to get investigated.  Banks can't hold your money for 14 days in the USA.  How can they? *Update* Now I was just hot with another $6 fee that they don't tell you what it is unless you ask. It's marked in their system as if they are paying you, says nothing about what it is, only it's a negative. My favorite part... They don't want to wait 14 days to take that money out.... You know.. for my protection as they say. They won't take it out of the money you have coming, they take their money right away and sit on your money. I can't wait to join the class action suit against them. I hope every DA will go up against this company. Don't expect interest on your money either, while they hold it, they will take a nice chunk of your money and the interest from sitting on it for two weeks. Please contact your State attorney on this shady dual headquarter company from Ireland. They need to be honest. Venmo is free, honest and gets you money immediately. Plus, no fee for the log of what each payment is. There is a reason everybody uses Venmo and Zelle.
Name: Dave Johnson
Reply: Hi Dave! Your first payout is typically available 7-14 days after you add your bank account and take your first successful payment on Stripe. This delay allows Stripe to mitigate some of the risks inherent in providing credit services.

Content: Hello, our company Matchmakers Inc has been processing payments through stripe for years ( 6 Years ), they approved our account years ago. Recently we received an offer for a working capital loan, so we applied for it. Two days after we submitted the application we were notified that stripe no longer allows dating sites, however in their terms its state’s adult dating sites, we are a faith-based/Lgbtqiapd+ dating site. Anyways long story short, after years of using them, and with a dispute rate of less than 1%, they have informed us that they are closing our account. Not only have we spent thousands of dollars integrating stripe into our site/pwa, but more than 80% of our customers also pay through stripe. This is a huge blow to our company. We are a federally trademarked business with over 15 years of dating experience. That is extremely shady to offer us a loan and close our account once we apply. Shame on them.

Stripe just keeps looping around their replies about investigating without looking at the evidence, not listening or looking at the evidence. This has been happening all week. Content: It has been over 5 days since I requested refund from Stripe. I sent an email but no reply yet.
Name: Kenneth
Reply: Hi Kenneth. Stripe submits refunds to your customer's bank immediately. Depending on the bank's processing time, it can take anywhere from 5-10 business days to show up on your customer's bank account. If the refund has an ARN, you can share it with your customer to help them trace the refund at their bank. You can find the ARN on the payment detail under "Timeline".
Title: It has been over 5 days since I…

Content: I used stripe for 3 years, in these 3 years at least 5 times some clients that bought a coat from our store opened a dispute to take the money back because they claimed that the transaction was fraud. Stripe always decided on favour of the buyer and send them the money back even though they never return a product to me. So I lost my money and didn't get the product back. Stripe is a scam!!!
Name: Konstantinos Siampanopoulos
Reply: Hi there—we certainly understand your frustration when it comes to disputes but there seems to be some confusion over Stripes involvement. A dispute is created through the customers bank. Once Stripe is notified by the bank, we're required to hold the funds. We do help our users upload evidence which a customers bank can review, but we have no involvement with the final decision. That lies solely with the bank.
Title: STRIPE CANT PROTECT SELLERS ME FROM FRAUD

Content: Stripe decided to close my account for absolutely no reason. They said that there is "fraudulent payments" on my account. My chargeback rate is low, the business is in good shape, but they still decide to close the account. But this is not the worse part. They refunded over 3000€ to the customers for no reason. We had already shipped their orders so we lost the cost of goods sold + the marketing budget. There is still 9000€ on the account and they refuse to send it to me. THey say that the money will stay on the account. It has been placed on reserve for an undefined period of time. This is a total scam. Be careful with this company. They are stealing your money. So if someone from the stripe team is reading this review, contact me and send me my money as soon as possible, or at least give my a date of payout because what you are doing is illegal. If you can solve my problem quickly, I will have to contact my lawyer to fix this, it will take time and money, for the same result, so just make it easier and transfer the money now. Thank you

Content: I'm using the ACH/Bank payment feature for processing tenant rent payments and it just takes so long from the tenant initiating payment for things to be cleared up and the transaction notes are not clear. I'm often unclear if I need to do something, if I need to request for the client to do something, or if we are waiting on something from the client's bank. It makes for lots of extra checking and tenant questions while the payment is processing. For now, it's the cheapest and only option that integrates with our Novo bank but I hope for improvements or a new option from the bank in the future. I may switch banks in the future if that remains the best option.
Name: Chrystal H
Reply: Hi Chrystal—ACH Direct Debit is a reusable, delayed notification payment method. This means that it can take up to 4 business days to receive acknowledgement of their success or failure.

Content: I want to sternly warn you about this platform. It's not whether you will have issues, it's rather WHEN. Sooner or later they will block your account, ask you for information that is none of their business, and withhold 25% of your income when it seems that your business is "risky". When you ask them about the reason, that's all that they tell you. "It seems risky to us." Other than that you won't get any answers. It's better to talk to a wall, because you will get the same answers, or you just get robotic answers. Just for your knowledge, I'm selling digital products, nothing else and nothing risky.

Content: I made an initial error when entering an account number, which resulted in several payments being sent to the wrong account. This became very frustrating, and we have spent hours trying to resolve this issue, which is still not resolved! I would not recommend Stripe at all, total lack of willingness to resolve the issue which ended up costing us income.

Content: Stripe partners with several shady companies in Eastern Europe that are deeply involved with human trafficking of children. Stripe is fully aware of this but continues their partnership with this and several sketchy companies like it with no discretion or remorse for what the money is funding.

Content: I took a recommendation based on the fact that the services provided by Stripe were good value! From decades of experience the old adage of if it is cheap there is a reason should have forewarned me! My first transaction went through smoothly back in December. However while taking a much needed break in January I received a substantial order for £5,399.00 through Stripe out of the blue. On a quick investigation I realised that the order was fraudulent and my assistant immediately notified Stripe. Stripe however were unhelpful insisting that the transaction was legitimate and that they were transferring the funds to us. As a result of this we advised Stripe that we wished to cancel the transaction in light of their frivillous approach and they advised that the funds had been sent. I advised my assistant to send an immediate refund of the full transaction value which amounted to £5,399.00. On Saturday 4th February we received an urgent email from the Bank of Canada confirming that the transaction was indeed fraudulent and Stripe agreed with us to place matters on hold pending investigation. We had in the meantime advised Stripe on the Friday that we were refunding the full £5,399.00 and had advised our bank to transfer the funds however recalled this on the Monday. Over the weekend despite matters apparently on hold I received £5,242.23 in my account. I also received two invoices, one relating to the transaction in December and one relating to the fraudulent transaction, despite having advised Stripe of the fraudulent nature of the transaction. I also instructed Stripe that they were entitled to recover £5,242.23 having been the amount received from them in relation to the transaction. They simply ignored this. On Monday however without any further communication they removed £5,622.26 from my account. My bank is now in the process of recovering this. Stripe clearly have absolutely no fraud prevention systems in place. They are not interested in clients who notify them that a transaction is fraudulent and their only focus is on making their fees. In all my decades of dealing with financial institutions this is the worst experience I have ever had and am astonished that they are allowed to operate in the UK. A report is being forwarded to the Financial Conduct Authority. In the meantime Stripe have not responded to emails advising them of the amounts they were authorized to take and have simply ignored these.
Name: Frank McKenzie
Reply: We're sorry to hear that you had to deal with a dispute—unfortunately, the card issuer has the final say, and Stripe is not involved in the outcome of the dispute. We provide tips and recommendations that can help prevent disputes and fraud https://stripe.com/docs/disputes/prevention and how to respond to them: https://stripe.com/docs/disputes/responding
Title: BEWARE ... If it is cheap there is a reason!

Content: Stripe's chat representative provided excellent customer service to us. Much of what I'd Googled about Stripe stressed that this platform inhabits the high scale of tech, and that non-tech people would likely struggle to establish an account with them. In response to that, we hired a tech expert to help us get started. When Stripe's "welcome" message arrived, we were overwhelmed and uncertain how to start using the service. I took advantage of Stripe's "Chat" feature, and the Chat rep helped us understand and process our first sale with confidence. Stripe is hugely successful and we're happy to be onboard. To those who manage their "welcome to Stripe" material, though, we would suggest this: Provide a split screen "welcome" page with two simple titles: /__/ Click here if you're tech-savvy and /__/ Click here if you're tech-challenged so we can better help you get started with Stripe. Then have someone who is NOT tech-savvy write the instructions. This would be friendlier customer service, because not everyone who is bewildered by the current and complicated get-acquainted screen will be brave enough to even hit the "Chat" button.

Title: Horrible company that has the worst…

Content: I got a few unreasonnable disputes from customers saying "product unacceptable" 2days after placing their orders and the tracking proves they didn't even have product in hand yet / some hackers did card testing by buying things on my website which increased my dispute amount above 1% then Stripe proceeded to put 10% of all upcoming transactions in "reserve" for security purpose and being able to refund customers if needed all while telling me that if my account stays clear of disputes i will get my money in 2 months. So 2 months passed and to my surprise the money wasn't transferred and they told me i had to go for another 2 months with this "reserve" and guess what ? Today i find out that i have AGAIN to go for ANOTHER 2 months and the money in reserve keeps getting bigger and bigger which is a huge issue for me. They are obviously using that money to make profit while I cannot transfer it to my bank account, this is basically a ponzi scheme scam and everyone should be aware of it. They are basically saying "because you had a few disputes at one point in time this xxx dollars is now ours for an undetermined amount of time. DISGUSTING COMPANY

Content: STAY AWAY Total nightmare, stripe has stolen from me $14,800, all of my earnings that I have made from my start up business. They claimed that there was disputes on my account but in reality there was no complains from anyone, they just wanted the money for themselves. Their message said that my business was a high risk even though there was no complains and everything was going extremely smoothly, I offer a consultation service online so the risk was extremely low. They are fraud and they do not go by any of the rules they have set. They closed down my account and took the money. They accused me of unauthorized charges, since my service is 100% consensual and they got the proofs they need. So what they did, they disabled the contact buttons on my account, refused to reply to me and they kept saying that they are firm on their decision. After that, they ignored me and completely stopped replying. They also went a head and disabled my access to the account from the app. Their costumer service people are beyond horrible and were trained to steal money.  It seems like today stripe decided to steal everyone's money and walk away with it. They are refusing to pay it to me and I will make sure my case goes to the public. If the amount is not given back to me, I will make sure to work with everyone and sue them in court. I will post my case on all media outlets, so they will not fall in this trap, scammers and fraud. I had high trust for stripe but they lost it all. PLEASE DO NOT WORK WITH THEM.

Content: We have processed close to 140k with stripe in the past 12 months and we have now had 2 occurrences (Fraud & Dispute) which with the evidence provided there is no way we should have lost disputes.. but we did and Stripes attitude about retailers in disputes just goes to show there is a unlaying agreement between Stripe and the Banks so the house always wins. No chargeback protection in NZ and even so, no matter the evidence - you will lose.
Name: Cody Mitchell
Reply: Hey Cody, we're sorry to hear about your experience dealing with disputes on your account. In these cases, the card issuer unfortunately has the final say and Stripe is not involved in deciding the outcome of the dispute; our role is only intermediates in helping submit and send the evidence. In our documentation, we provide tips and recommendations to help prevent disputes and fraud https://stripe.com/docs/disputes/prevention and how to respond to them when they come in: https://stripe.com/docs/disputes/responding. We appreciate your understanding.
Title: DO NOT TOUCH STRIPE

Content: "I had to sign up to use Stripe for 2 platforms that does not accept PayPal as a means of payment.  On my 1st day of registering, I encountered a lot of signing up problems to become a user and had to chat with one of their support staff, Daniela, who is "clueless", and does not even understand what it feels like to render simple "customer service".  She has no solution whatsoever to all my inquiries and I figured it out by myself after wasting more than 4 hours of my time.  The registration process could not be completed on the 19th of December 2022, due to no fault of my own.  On the 20th of December, I continued with the registration process, however, I could not complete it as well.  I had chats with 2 other support staff, Emirl, Joe, that has no solution too, and kept giving me the same information that I already knew.  I decided to go for the option to "call me back", since Stripe did not provide any telephone number to reach the company.  In trying to create the "call me back option", I could see that UK was not included as one of the countries that could request for call back and I knew immediately that something was wrong.  So, I wrote in the inquiry section my frustration and included my UK telephone number, yet the only thing I could see was that it keeps refreshing how many minutes it will take for the support staff to call me on my mobile telephone which never happened anyway.
Name: Esther Kenny
Reply: We're incredibly sorry to hear about your support experience thus far. We've located your support requests throughout this past months and are investigating the issues now—we'll follow up with you directly via email as soon as we have updates. We appreciate your understanding.

Content: We had a bad experience with a fraud warning with stripe in the past where we lost our money as stripe paid us the amount for an order, we sent the goods. then 10 days later Stripe too the money back from us. Stripe is not reliable as a payment platform.
Name: Joanna
Reply: Hi Joanna. We're sorry to hear about the disputes on your account. When a payment is disputed by a card holder, their bank notifies us and credits the transaction for the card holder. In an email and through your dashboard, we then share information we have received from the bank so that you can present evidence supporting the legitimacy of the payment. In the event that these disputes are decided by the bank in your favor, both the disputed amount as well as the dispute fee will be returned to you.

Content: Up to now, CardCookie has provided excellent customer service.  Then, today, I got an email stating, "Since we couldn't verify some of your payment information, we need to verify your identity before sending you the gift cards."  (All this after I saw a pending CardCookie charge on my MasterCard.) So, after going through the Stripe verification process (where I took photos of my face and driver's license), I got an email stating, "...after carefully reviewing the documentation you provided, we have decided that it is not sufficient to verify your account."  So, I sent several emails asking if I could be re-verified, since my hair was still wet from taking a shower, and I was wearing contacts--vs. glasses as in my driver's license photo.  It's been over 45 minutes and I've received no reply.  All this after successfully getting CardCookie gift cards for years.  Very frustrating!!!  My iPhone doesn't care if I'm wearing glasses or not.  Why should Stripe be different--or why didn't they tell me I should look like I do in my driver's license photo?!!?!

Title: Stripe steals money

Content: If you want customer service then you don't want Stripe - where customer service doesn't exist. Multiple promises of a "returned call within 24 hours" that never were returned. No direct phone number to contact. No ability to be transferred to a supervisor when/if they do call you back, no fraud assistance - instead you, the business owner, are held accountable for fraud. And, if someone does commit fraud they will take their money right out of your deposit account you have set up with them - even if that's not the account the fraudulent charges went into. Business owners beware!!! Doing business with Strip and doing business with companies that require you to use Stripe's services is a risk small business owners can't afford to take.

Content: STRIPE is the worst company I've dealt with in years.I own a professional photography studio. Its a 2nd generation family business thats been in operation since 1972. The only reason we opened a STRIPE acct. is because we have a website gallery through PIXIESET that allows us to sell photographs online, & we had to open an acct with STRIPE in order to use PIXIESET. We've received several emails from STRIPE saying they could not verify what type of business we are & what products we sell. STRIPE does NOT return phone calls. No one answers the phone.... you get their VM. Immediately following the call, I got a "CANNED" email from STRIPE saying they would return my call in 3 minutes, & they listed my phone # that they'd be calling on. 10 minutes later, after never receiving a call from STRIPE, I once again received another "CANNED" email saying thet they were "unable to get ahold of me".... which was utter BS. I had my phone with me the whole time waiting for their call that never came. My phone never rang, nor was there a voice message from them. Their customer service is all via email & they still have not resoved the issue where they've been holding over 1400.00 from our client transactions beacause they couldnt verify our web address , which i explained from the beginning  that we are currently have a new website designed & that our site was currently down. I sent them all the documention to prove who we are, both from Register.com & GoodGallery web design. I also gave them our business Facebook page & Instagram page information as well. I recently received an email AGAIN asking for our FB & IG information.... which I had already given to them!!!

Title: Worst payment processor ever

Content: I made a stripe account, filled out our business information, and tested their API (in test mode, mind you) for about 4 hours before receiving a notification that suspicious activity had been detected on my account, and they would need additional information. I uploaded the requested documents verifying our company's EIN, and shortly after, was notified that our account had been permanently suspended with a generic "we can no longer support your business" message. After reaching out and asking *why* our business has been suspended, I was told they would review their decision, and they came back a few hours later with exactly the same form message. Nothing about why, nothing about how we might mitigate risk, just a generic form letter. At no point did I get to talk to a human being to explain our business model or ask questions. This degree of automation in handling something as critical to business infrastructure as payment processing is borderline unethical. Probably the single worst customer experience I have ever had from any company.
Name: Jordan Edmunds
Reply: Hi Jordan. While we would be limited in what information we can share when a decision like this is made, we'd be happy to take another look at this for you. Can you please email us at heretohelp@stripe.com with your stripe email address?

Content: I am a new customer of Stripe.  I did all the setups according to their instructions and put live a pricing table that integrated with my website.  The main feature I was looking for was recurring payments, as I sell subscription services.  I did 2 payments to myself to test if I would receive the payout funds in my bank account in a timely manner.  Well, Stripe says that these first payments take 7 business days for security reasons.  In any case, we are 18 business days into this and the payout has NOT arrived in my bank account.  The worst part has been the support, which cannot give me any clear timeframes or answers.  I have had to send Stripe copies of my bank account and even a signed letter from my bank stating that I did NOT receive the funds.  Also, I have had to halt my e-commerce sales because I cannot trust Stripe to make the payouts.  I did spend a good amount of money integrating my website with Stripe.  As a payment provider, Stripe has the responsibility to give the customer adequate support when the payout does NOT arrive at your bank.  I could NOT be more disappointed with such terrible service and disregard for the customer's funds. Still waiting and losing money.
Name: Rodrigo Melendez
Reply: Hi Rodrigo—we're terribly sorry the experience has been less than positive here. We'd love to investigate this issue further. Can you please email us at heretohelp@stripe.com from your Stripe email address and include a link to this review? Thanks.

Title: Reliability

Content: We have been using stripe for a number of years to accept payments on our online store. On 20th November there was an email request from stripe for one of the directors to verify their information and a link to the dashboard. When in the dashboard there was a request for the other director to send verification also which they did, although they didn't receive an email from stripe to request it. On december 4th a customer contacted us to say they couldn't pay by debit card. We noticed that there were no stripe payments for several days (the most important time of the year for our small, independent business) and contacted stripe support immediately. They said that it may take a few more days to verify the documentation that was forwarded and this is why customers couldn't pay. We sent those documents before the deadline, but notwithstanding that stripe stated in the email that should it not be sent by the deadline that 'charges or payouts to your bank account may be paused', not that they would suddenly stop accepting payments without telling us. It is more than disappointing, it has affected our business detrimentally as we had a number of abandoned online orders as a result.
Name: Jackie AttheCraftyfox
Reply: Hey Jackie, we're incredibly sorry to hear about the issues you've been experiencing with verification here. We'd like to investigate this to assist—please email heretohelp@stripe.com and we'll follow back up with you as soon as we can.

Title: The worst payment company

Content: Do you want an overpriced, lying and hard to use payment provider? Let me introduce to you, Stripe. Where do I begin? Well, on the 29/11/22 I opened a stripe account, I opened an account for business use (I will come back to this later). I decided to make an invoice of £5, to myself to try out the platform. So, I paid the £5 invoice by myself to myself via Stripe. A few days later I get an email from Stripe saying that "We recently identified payments on your Stripe account for **Account name** that don’t appear to have been authorised by the customer, meaning that the owner of the card or bank account didn’t consent to these payments.". Not only did they say that it was an "unauthorised" payment, but they said that they will begin refunding payments and no longer taking ANY payments on my account. The ironic thing was that I made the payment to myself, so there couldn't have been an unauthorised payment. Pretty much stripe was lying. So as confused as I was, I decided to contact their support (which turned out to be a nightmare). I send an email to support saying how there was no unauthorised payment as I made the payment to myself and how I can't refund* my "customer" (myself), *I tried to get refund back so that I can at least get my money back. I just get robotic answers back where they just copy and paste previously automated messages.  I also tell customer support how I would like to change my business account to an individual account so that my account actions would be removed and that I could resume payments. That never happened. So pretty much stripe took my money and never gave it to me as I am deemed as "high-risk" to them which is utter bs.
Name: Sam
Reply: Hey, we're incredibly sorry the experience has been less than positive here. We'd like to take a second look at your account from our end. Please email us directly at heretohelp@stripe.com with "Trustpilot Review" in the subject line, and we'll follow up as soon as possible.
Title: Do you want an overpriced, lying and hard to use payment provider?

Title: Recently after contacting however communicationyou I have…

Content: If I could give this company fewer than one star, I would do so. Our account was hacked. A person who donated to our business had his account charged $20K which a hacker then transferred to a debit card they managed to add to our account. Stripe advised us to refund the donor and represented that we would not be held liable as we had tried to contact someone that we could not get into the account, but didn't hear back from them for EIGHT DAYS. During that time, the hack occurred. After we reversed the charge, STRIPE DEDUCTED THE $20K FROM OUR ACCOUNT ANYWAY! Unbelievably, an account rep advised us to charge the donor's card for the amount so we could recoup it. Advice to commit criminal financial fraud?  Further, this donor hadn't given to our business since Oct 2021, so Stripe is keeping our customers' personal information in their system without their knowledge. All in all, this situation has been extremely traumatizing as we are a new, small business and Stripe has been extremely dismissive, condescending, and refuses to take any responsibility for its failure to help us when we repeatedly requested it. Had they done so, none of the charges would have had a chance to go through. However, there was no way to contact them directly, and no one responded to repeated requests to call.
Name: KML
Reply: Hi there. We are sorry for this situation. This isn't the experience we want you to have with our support. Please email us at heretohelp@stripe.com with the link for this review, and we will help you with that.
Title: Customer service led to loss of $20K!

Content: The software is solid and easy to set up. We ran over $100K of conference registrations through this system with few hiccups. The one thing I would change is that, when setting up the system, Stripe should confirm that the bank account is set up for both charges AND refunds -- and not proceed with setup if this is not valid. (Our client gave us a bank account number that could only take money in, and not refund it.) When the inevitable conference registration refund needed to happen, Stripe was not able to debit the bank account and consequently shut down all payouts because of this. I didn't see that coming and would have preferred to know that a bit earlier, on the setup side of things. We did get it sorted out though and overall, I would recommend Stripe.

Content: I had a guest dispute charges they clearly approved. Card was present. The dispute process only permitted one piece of supporting evidence per category, which meant I either had to put my evidence in other categories (likely to get my challenge tossed out in favor of the guest) or leave it out (likely to get my challenge tossed out in favor of the guest). I could not adequately support my sifde of the dispute given how your sytem is set up. I suspect I will lose this. Plus having to wait three months to get a response/decision. WHAT takes three months? Though customer service reached out and attempted to be helpful, their hands were tied, clearly, but overall I wasn't impressed.
Name: Marie
Reply: Hey Marie, we're sorry to hear about your frustration with the dispute process. The full lifecycle of a dispute, from initiation to the final decision from the issuer, can unfortunately take as long as 2-3 months to complete. If you run into any trouble with the overall disputes process, we suggest viewing: https://stripe.com/docs/disputes/how-disputes-work.

Content: Terrible. We got an approved account. After a few days of operations - they requested an ID verification of the UBO - not an issue - this was done. Right after the verification was completed - we have got an email that our account is blocked because our absolutely transparent business (sales of digital materials - courses) and claimed that it is not eligible and high risk. We have provided the documents proving that we have everything handles. We send clients emails informing them about the purchase they made, we have customer support which handles any inbound concerns or questions. We have all of the supporting documentation, yet Stripe went ahead with the decision to refund every client who has bought the online course. When the client gets a refund - he/she normally losese an access to the purchased materials as stated in our T&C. Stripe is making a brand damage to our company that has started in August. I will do the same to them by writing this beautiful review of their misleading practices. First of all I checked whether my business is not restricted and proceeded with account opening - everythung was smooth at first until they all of a sudden decided to flag the business as high risk since payments were not made through 3DS channel - which is not even our fault. I won't recommend this company to any single soul if they are just starting a business - they can let you down pretty quick without giving you a single idea what is their concern. Please stay away of this company as they seems to only work with large brands and companies with 100% proven operatons. This is not for those who want to start slow and steady and to be sure your account won't get blocked in the middle of the day.
Name: Dzhuliya Dobrekova
Reply: Hi there —we're awfully sorry to hear your experience has been less than positive. We'd love to look into this situation further for you. Can you please email us at heretohelp@stripe.com and we can go from there?

Content: I had someone dispute a purchase and even though I provided all the evidence possible to prove the person made the purchase, I still got hit with a fee and lost the money for the product sold.
Name: Brian
Reply: Hi Brian —we appreciate disputes are never positive. That being said, it is not Stripe that created or owns the process. A dispute is something that is created through your customer's bank and is something we are obligated to follow. The dispute fee and final decision are also through the customer's bank and we have no say on the outcome. We have made an agreement that allows all Stripe users to submit evidence to a dispute and we will make sure that evidence is available to the bank for review. But the outcome is not something we can influence. For more, please see here: https://stripe.com/docs/disputes/how-disputes-work.
Title: I had someone dispute a purchase and…

Content: It was so infuriating to me. Although I am a new small to medium sized business, I am in regular business. All my documents are legal and compliant, but when I got paid by the customer for my first order, stripe blocked my account on the grounds that the order was unauthorised. I immediately submitted the order details and the fraud analysis on the platform, including the response from the platform's customer service, which stated that the order was perfectly fine. However, stripe's customer service only kept telling me that my account would be blocked and that I had no idea when the funds would be returned to the customer. Despite my numerous emails to them, they have stopped responding to me and their customer support is completely useless.

Content: we have worked with stripe for years. then when covid came in we stopped for a while. They have been receiving our clients' payments threw fresh books to only ask us to verify a website. after all the coding for subscription payments they come back and say we cannot have an account with them. so, they have about 900.00 om hold for services that were rendered and. every time i ask for a refund they keep spinning me. It's not even listed in our account as them having the money they have been collecting money for 8 months. Before you do business with them read the reviews and check with other companies. these people don't even answer the phone just  bot messages mostly Update Review. I guess your company use bots to answer reviews as well. When I go to the BBB for resolutions I'll be sure to post the very email that was sent to me this morning from your company showing that your not telling the truth. I will also show the transactions that was sent to your company. Freshbooks would be an accessory  with you. Surley they don't practice the same decit that stripe is doing if they're smart the the would drop you as fast as they can. Your company is hurting small business by holding their funds. No need to respond back save it for the Better Business Bureau. The more reviews the more aware people will be you guys appear to have no shame. It will catch up to you. The bottom line I want my money back for services rendered. I'm gonna personally ask freshbooks to remove your services cause they don't do business like the way your doing it stripe.   it appears that who reads this review for strip you don't have no shame. Eventually it will catch up to the whole corporate structure of Strip.  One Star Rating is to generous  for stripe.

Content: The percentage of chargebacks when using Stripe is insane. Probably close to 1% at this point, where-as elsewhere it might be .01%. On top of that Strip will NEVER protect you from fraudulent buyers and the banks that allow those buyers to run rampant. For every chargeback, they ask you for proof of delivering the item sold, upon giving them all the information, the banks will always come back in the card holder's favor and take all your money along with an additional $15 "fee" for the chargeback. Stripe just allows this to happen through their platform. It is a joke. Stay away for your mental health and the health of your wallet.
Name: JClay
Reply: We're sorry to hear about your experience with disputes. In these cases, the card issuer has the final say and Stripe is not involved in deciding the outcome of the dispute; we only play a role by conveying the evidence. In our documentation, we provide tips and recommendations that can help prevent disputes and fraud https://stripe.com/docs/disputes/prevention and how to respond to them when they come in: https://stripe.com/docs/disputes/responding. We appreciate your understanding.

Content: Have used these clowns for a few months on my website and have found they are even worse than PayPal. Long story short, US customer ( who was a pain in the rear from day one!) alleged non delivery and then claimed through her bank. A US company backing a US customer...theres a surprise! I cancelled direct debit with my bank so Stripe can't access the money they refunded and there's no way I'm refunding three figures. Now use a more professional company. You should too.

The first time around, the call was rescheduled without asking me first. Then I wasn't called at the new time. We rescheduled for 2 days later. When we got on the call, she basically tells me she's not the right person to answer my questions and she'll send over resources. What?! I don't understand why we were trying to have a call when she wasn't the right person to answer my questions [and I put what I needed help with in my initial inquiry]. I just wasted over a week trying to figure this out because Stripe couldn't read the comments I put on my inquiry and point me in the right direction.

Content: Stripe Connect is great for POS use in the United States.  But it is expensive and almost impossible to use if you have business partners in other countries. I spent thousands of dollars and hundreds of hours over 1 full year trying to resolve a question about setting up a cross-border account only to finally discover on MY OWN that we simply needed to use a new email address.  Then when I wrote to Stripe teaching them this tiny pearl, I didn't even get an acknowledgement or apology or a thank you for figuring out information they should have been able to provide 12 months previously.

Content: Stripe stopped my deposits without emailing me to verify my domain.  Once I noticed the deposits were not in my account I contacted them and successfully verified my domain.  The deposits have not resumed and I call them daily yet they keep giving me the same run around, that someone needs to manually review the account.  The rep I spoke with already confirmed that the domain was verified.  I asked to speak to a manager and they would not let me.  I understand as a business they need to verify merchants for the safety of the industry, but I have verified myself and they are still holding my deposits.  I have done nothing wrong and maintained a stand up account.  All of my clients orders are fulfilled yet they are not releasing deposits.  If I am doing stand up business with my clients Stripe should do the same with me as a merchant.  The most frustrating part is they keep telling me 24 hours.  It has been almost two weeks since they have held my deposits.  I need some help please!  Our lawyer has read through the terms and suggested we reach out again, as it’s not clear how or what policies we broke. Again, I have done nothing wrong yet I am being penalized with no explanation.  Please release my deposits Stripe.
Name: Mercedes Kelly
Reply: Hi Mercedes, we appreciate your frustration and understand this issue is being reviewed as we speak. We're working on getting a solution out to you and will follow up via email as soon as we have more.
Title: Holding Deposits Without Warning

Content: Stripe is a terrible company with zero accountability. If you’re a business considering Stripe as a payment solution, I urge you to think twice. A customer accidentally reported her credit card payment through Stripe as fraudulent because she lost her credit after using it to make the payment. Stripe charged me a hefty administrative fee (~$25) for a small transaction of $39 on top of refunding the total charge to the customer. Even when provided with written proof from the customer and proof of receipt of the product, Stripe insists that they cannot do anything to rectify the situation and my business has to bear the loss for this loophole that they are responsible for. The situation would be a lot worse if the transaction amount were bigger. This experience cost me valuable time and effort trying to iron out the issue with Stripe, to no avail.
Name: Gail
Reply: Hi Gail. We appreciate disputes are never positive. That being said, a dispute is not something Stripe controls. A dispute fee is charged by the customer's bank and the outcome is also something only they decide. We understand your frustration here particularly with it being a mistake but only the customer and their bank can rectify that.

Title: I've used it before

Content: We started with Stripe because Yardbook, the software platform we use to manage the scheduling, estimating and invoicing for our handyman service, integrates perfectly with Stripe so that our customers can pay their invoices online and the payments are automatically posted into Yardbook.  Using Stripe has been easy and seemless.  I confess, we rarely need to log into Stripe except, on occasion, to check when payouts are scheduled to transmit.  That's a compliment, it means that everything just runs smoothly behind the scenes.  Invoices go out, customers pay, and money lands in our bank account.  What more can you ask of a payment processing service?  I would recommend Stripe for their seamless service and reliability.  And their fees are quite competitive, as well.  Thanks Stripe, we're glad your partnership with Yardbook helped us find you!

Content: We love Stripe we have been with them for many years the only issue we have is that it seems they make their currency exchange accounting very vague. For instance our gross income vs our net income always had a large difference (which started to become strange to us over time). After doing research to understand the discrepancies we realized we are being charged based on currency exchanges but it’s basically an invisible number and there is not much flexibility with different currencies to reduce this cost. All of this is understandable but they do not disclose this to you so you have to reverse engineer the numbers to really see how much you’re loosing to currency exchange. We think that’s kind of sketchy this amount really should be itemized as currency charges for the month so that we have a clear understanding of what it is costing us. The other issue is that they slow down your payouts which slows down your cash flow. I guess this is for their own security but as a small business having to wait for funds to clear or pay extra for your funds is a little annoying to deal with. We compensated for this but it would be nice to be able to build a relationship with Stripe overtime that would speed up your payouts without additional cost. Other than those two sticking points Stripe has been great to us.
Name: customer
Reply: Hey there, thanks for writing in with this valuable feedback. We understand the frustrations with how difficult currency accounting can be, we'd like to offer escalated support to assist you directly. Please email us at heretohelp@stripe.com and we'll follow up to get this sorted!

Content: The pricing isn't very competitive, especially when you take into account that Stripe does not refund fees on transactions that are refunded to your customer. This really skews the effective rate that you're paying unless you never process refunds. In my experience, Stripe was not very transparent on this matter and it's also not typical within the payment processing industry so it's easy to miss. Their software and APIs are great if you're using them but what you're paying overall for those features is pretty crazy. Overall, it's a good product but the premium that they charge wasn't commensurate with the value for us.

Title: The Support was insanely helpful

Content: We integrated this system through zoho. They allowed us to invoice for a year then created havoc in our cleaning business when they locked the account out. We did not use it integrally as we had zoho. After waiting to get logged in we were told that because we did not have a website they could not verify us. I then proceeded to get unlocked by emailing (there is not one phone number). They unlocked my account. I thought I was back in business. We weren't they needed to verify and asked us to provide documentation regarding our ID, business articles and information about what we did. I provided articles, passport, and a whole business write up regarding what we did. We are a simple cleaning company that was allowed to use this service and pay the company good money to do so. In a matter of weeks they shut down the system, and our business processes of collecting invoices. They now hold 3400 dollars of our money and want a valid website to verify. I guess passport and articles don't matter. We don't need a website at the moment. Stripe doesn't care. They only close the online chats out and close our tickets when we don't answer. They don't even call when there is this type of issue. I don't see it going to far as a company. As of current I am still demanding they close out our account and give our invoice dollars back as we have employees to pay. This really sucked. 2 employees quit as they thought stripes inadequate company processes were our own. Due to this we lost 2 contracts totalling roughly 30k per year. I am out money and time because of this convenience they tout. They are not the best company and we will look for another that maybe handles customer service and issues better, and that doesn't keep our money for over 2 months now.
Name: Prime Porter Inc.
Reply: Hi there—we're sorry to hear you've had a bad experience, this is not our intention nor is it the typical way this plays out. If you'd like to have us look into your account for you, please email us at heretohelp@stripe.com.

Content: WORST customer service ever.  We use multiple platforms and this one is terrible.  We are looking to move all of our work on this platform elsewhere.  Here is just an example:  We had someone that paid for an appointment and then didn't show up.  We have a clear policy on our website, on the receipt she received etc. that no shows will lose their fee unless they give 24 hours notice.  She files for her money back and not only do they give it to her but they charge us $15.!  They told us there was nothing they can do about it as it was the credit card company.  Funny because on our other platforms if this happens  we provide the receipt info and website info and the claim would be denied.  No wonder they have a one star rating on so many review sites.  NOTE:  Date of experience may be off as this happened a few months ago and I didn't keep the exact date of when I dealt with them.

I would not recommend this company to anyone with a small business because they will hold your money for months draw interest on it and then close your account. I am waiting for them to refund my customer the money which has been over two weeks and still has not been refunded. This is put a huge burden on my business having to explain to my customer why their payment is being refunded (hopefully), over a month after they made a payment. In our documentation, we provide tips and recommendations that can help prevent disputes and fraud https://stripe.com/docs/disputes/prevention and how to respond to them when they come in: https://stripe.com/docs/disputes/responding. We appreciate your understanding.

The access to business credit has really helped us in these unprecedented times.

Content: It's mostly good, but they do no security validation by default so we had one guy use about 30 stolen credit cards all with the same ID and they let them all pass. That should have been an easy fail. Then after they let them all pass they banned our account for what one person did. So they blamed us for their own poor security. They now have a new product which allows you to turn up the needed authentication, but most credit card processors have that by default. To me it's very weird to be a credit card processor and take no responsibility for validating credit card transactions by default.

I m surprised when I m asking the customer support that I want to give a refund for one of my customer he replay with this email "attached" even it s not logical to denied me from getting refund to my customer now I start thinking Stripe using our money to made more money. when i told the customer service to show me the phrase in the agreement show that I can not give a refund to my customer he don' t get back to me.

Content: Stripe sent me a grand total of ONE email requiring me to update certain personal information.  I did not see that important email apart from the volume of garbage email that I see coming from Stripe.  Stripe then withheld $$32,357.33 of my income over the next 10 months.  I discovered this by accident.  When confronted, Stripe referred me to their voluminous contract. These Stripe people are not stupid.  They knew they could legally withhold my money pending an update of my account information. I saw this as a complete scam.  My attorney said that this is how they make money.  I don't trust this company as far as I can throw their building.  Do business with them at your own risk.  Do not say you have not been warned.

Title: Truly gives the term corporation/service a bad name.

Content: Stripe is so much better than paypal. This is a generalized review. The percentage rate is much cheaper. They don't play games with my money. They don't hold your payments. If someone files a chargeback they take the funds out of your bank acct until the issue is resolved. They are just a pretty straight forward company. They even have invoices and subscriptions you can set up for your clients. This is very useful if you need to set up a payment plan and the invoice automatically debits the funds according to the dates you set for payments. Stripe is very unproblematic and I like them for this very reason. They do all of my accounting for me which makes it easy come tax time. You can see how much money you have made. The sales volume from month to month. They make it very simple for their customers. I tell everybody about stripe.

Content: They rock. They have the best systems, APIs and support. We've been using them for about 5 years now. Reading some other reviews on here makes me think that people don't read before they sign up. Stripe clearly states their fees, payout schedules & whatever else complaint I'm reading about them. Nobody seems to say how amazing their uptime is, low latency, fraud protection (if you know how to utilize the system). Stripe offers everything to its devs and customers, you just need to know how to use their systems. Yes, it works out of the box but if you want to be protected against fraud for example, then you need rules setup. Anyways, everything is hosted via stripe for us, website, in-store, mobile app, driver app, EVERYTHING. Worth every single penny.
Name: Ioannis
Reply: Thank you for the kind words, we do our best to support our users the best we can, so it makes our day to hear such a glowing review.
Title: Hands down - they rock.

Content: As a small business I originally signed up to the usual card payment suppliers. After 2 years of high costs I reviewed and found STRIPE offered much more reasonable rates. After a time I could change to receiving the payouts from 5 days to 3 days. Its much more convenient for customers to pay direct from invoice. With STRIPE downloaded to my accounts package it just makes life a bit easier, shows up straight away and you can see from the outset the charges taken. No more end of month invoices. No more not seeing if payment has not been cleared. For me, definately the wisest choice I've made.

Reply: Hi there! We're very sorry that we couldn't help you with this. We do wish we could return our fees to our users, but we ourselves incur underlying costs from our banking and card partners when we process payments. That means that returning fees from refunded charges to our users would be unsustainable for us. While I understand that's not what you want to hear, we believe we can best serve you and all of our users by being as transparent as we can about our refund policy and focusing our attention on making Stripe as useful as we can for your business.

Content: Beware. They are supporting scammers!!!!! Bought a service online and it was never delivered. Beware if you're purchasing something and the merchant using Stripe. I'm adding this information after getting a reply from Stripe shown below: I've already opened a dispute through my bank and they told me Stripe refuse to do a refund. So your response to me below confirms that you guys support scammers.

Sorry we can't be of more help here—disputing the charge with your bank is best step forward in this case.
