Content: It works ok, but Stripe as a company has everything in favour of them and everything not in favour of the merchant.  They take 5 days to deliver the funds, but should perchance there be a refund this 5 days is magically reduced to no days and the refund is taken straight back to them immediately with no wait.  There radar system should be part of the system but they charge even more for it, which is annoying because it is only a small amount but makes reconciling very difficult as everything is always 10c to 50c out because of their additional fees.  It is expensive for what you get, and very hard to reconcile because of all the different fees.

Content: I am pleased with your service except for one issue. Your transaction fees should not be based on a straight percentage of the transaction amount. It doesn’t cost you any more to process $1000 as it does to process $10. I know your organization must make a profit, but I recommend that you cap your transaction fee when the amount being transacted is above a certain amount. We lost over $300 from one of our donations due to your transaction fee. A $30 fee would have been acceptable but $300 is too much.

My biggest clientele are interior designers, yet for Stripe, I'm running an Only Fans page. I uploaded my driving license, passport, valid connected bank accounts, everything but the kitchen sink. They are a massive bunch of red-tape with no understanding of cross country global transactions. The fact that my humanitarian aid organization helping babies and children in war zone ukraine has had their funding cut off due to Stripe seems to carry no weight in persuading them to fix their software limitations. Do yourself a favor and actually use a company who knows what they are doing, maybe Paypal or Authorize.net? Someone who might know that you run an initiative in a different country than you live in. Ever heard of the internet, people?

Content: The front end of your system is excellent - customers like the system for ordering tickets - it is easy and user friendly.  The back end needs a lot of help.  We are a concert presenter and have as many as five concerts on sale at a time.  When we get a deposit to our bank account, it gives very minimal information about how many tickets were sold to each event and the cost less the merchant fee - it also gives us no information about contributions included in the sale.  We use another system to give us the detail, but it does not give us the information by deposit - so, we have had to tediously go between the two systems to get the information we need to post to each concert and contributions.  We have technical assistance trying to bridge the gap with reports between the two systems, however it is slow in coming.  There must be a way in your system to get the information we need for each deposit, but we have not found it as yet.  There is no specific date to fill in on the Date of Experience  it has been ongoing since we changed the system to Stripe.
Name: Jason and Judy
Reply: Hey Jason and Judy, thanks for writing in and flagging this to us. We'd like to investigate this further with you to assist with ticket reporting—please email our team directly at heretohelp@stripe.com and we'll look into this for you right away.

Content: A customer purchased an item from us on Bonanza, they then dispute it with their credit card because they claimed it was fraud. I contacted the buyer through Bonanza and they acknowledged they made the purchase, asked us to send them a new invoice. That's not how it works with stripe. We can't invoice them again, plus Bonanza is keeping their free and stripe is charging a dispute fee. All this on a transaction that the customer admits to making. Still waiting for decision from customer's Bank/ stripe. Our funds are on hold. Ridiculous that the dispute would not be cancelled and our funds released immediately. Why does it take 3 months to investigate when the customer admits there's no fraud

Content: If you have no other options, Stripe gets the job done. But it's no fun paying the highest fees in the industry AND waiting 3 days for money to arrive. Visibility into into past transactions is poor. Transaction history shows the amount of the invoice paid, but not what service or product was purchased. So if you have 2 that are the same price, you have no way of knowing which one got paid. It's also difficult to see how the automation is running, once its set up. So if a customer's is declined, you don't know when the next charge attempt will happen, and therefore can't warn the customer or anticipate when you'll get paid.

Content: Avoid using Stripe at any cost. They all of a sudden put a hold on my account holding of over £10k for 120 days for any disputes or refunds. Since I was unable to refund the customer they opened a chargeback for the full value of the order, not just the item that was returned. So I contacted Stripe and about this and the reply was that the account was put on hold for 120 days. I keep emailing them for an explanation and today I received an email telling me that the hold they have will be extended for another 120 days! This is totally unacceptable and the customer service they have given me is beyond horrible. DON'T EVER USE STRIPE they will never give you your money.

Title: STRIPE IS A SCAM!!

Content: AVOID STRIPE AT ALL COSTS OR RISK LOSING ALL YOUR MONEY! Stripe has terms of service that say they can keep your money without cause or warning, I did not know this until it was too late, don't let this happen to you!  I lost $30K, don't make the same mistake I did.  This little hidden statement in their terms means they can withhold all of your money and freeze your account WITHOUT justification, and I had no idea they could do this. So if their automated AI picks up something that it thinks matches this ruleset it auto freeze and there is nothing you can do to unfreeze because they do not have real humans at the helm.    They used this loophole to steal $30,000 of my money. Please DO NOT FALL VICTIM TO THEM AS DID.   Understand that they are 100% automated software platform with little human oversight, do your homework before you invest your business into them as they have 100% power of all your cash flow.   The only humans that work for them are overseas people who do not speak English very well or understand anything, which means be prepared for nothing but canned copy and pasted answers and no real actaul research or help.  Instead, they are trained to copy and paste the exact same answer. So they steal your money by freezing your account and then don't answer you or help; instead, they just copy and paste the exact text out of their desk system, in fact it every well could be a AI bot dong all of their CS and you would have no idea.  HERE IS MY STORY...  I will be happy to go on podcasts, TV Show, Radio Show, or any program to spread the word about them, so others do not fall victim as I have.   HERE IS MY -STORY...  I have been in business for 20 years; I use Freshbooks.com to process around 2 million a year in credit card charges a year.   We added a stripe to our software to automate our billing, We started to migrate our customers over and did 3 customers, but the charges appeared as our legal name. on the bank statement, not the DBA.   This confused one of the customers because they did not know our legal name so they issued a  chargeback and they got their oney back. I noticed it, called the customer, and explained that that's our legal name. They apologized and offered to replay their invoice of $27,000.   When they did but then stripe never deposited the money. When I asked it, they kept telling me my account was frozen and under view, and i had to w 2 days. Well, 3 days passed no answer, after 15 emails and 2 months, they kept saying my account was in review.   I sent them a signed contract from the customer, emails from the customer saying the mistake they made, links to phone calls of MP3 files of me talking to the customer about the issue and the customer apologizing,  DBA and articles of incorporation. But because this was 30% of all my customers since I only moved three over, they flagged my account, said it was "high risk," and refused to release my funds. I asked if they could cancel my account and return all the money to the customers because they would issue me a check. Instead, they just kept saying they "merged my tickets for better communication" because their customer service people did not understand or even begin to care about the problem.   Every email would go to a different person, and every person would merge into another account no one would ever ever get back to me. Then after emailing every day I get a templated email saying they are going to shut down my account because it is high risk and I will get my funds in Jan 18th of 2023 (6 months later), with an explanation or reason. No one will call me, or email me, or talk t me. They drove me to the point of me typing in all caps, cursing at them over email and losing my cool. They do not care. They just ignored me and kept my $30,000. I have no idea if they will really even return my money in Jan.  At this point I am now forced to try and seek legal action against them.   I beg you, DO NOT DO BUSINESS WITH THEM...  they will not help you. If I had continued to move all my business to them, they would have 100% destroyed my business of 20 years, and I would have lost everything and my 15 employees would all be fired because I would not have any cash flow.    There is a customer via phone.. all they. have an answering service in a 3rd party call center that is located overseas. I think it's out of the Philippines, but all they do is just answer the phone and take notes. They do not solve any problem nor do they speak to you, they hide behind their support email and steal your money. PLEASE DO NOT DO BUSINESS WITH THEM!! To. Learn more, call my company at 414-326-4100, ask for Jason tell them it's regarding the striping issue and my staff will transfer you to me, and I will be happy to tell my story to any news service that will listen.
Name: Jason B
Reply: Hi Jason—We're sorry to hear you've had a bad experience, that's definitely not how we want our users to feel. We can assure you that we do not try to avoid having our users receive help from real humans, and try to offer the best in class customer support anyway we can. If you'd like to reach out to discuss further, please email heretohelp@stripe.com.

It's completely absurd, and when I flagged it to support we received 5 useless email exchanges only for them to insist that it's somehow a legitimate charge. Title: Jane was very helpful in getting me the…

Content: Absolutely awful way to accept payments. I decided to allow Stripe payments on my Facebook Marketplace listings because what could go wrong, right? Wrong. I spent ages going through the identity process and sign up for this service and sold my first item which was paid via Stripe's 'secure' payments, the postage was handled by Facebook and I thought 'hey, this doesn't seem so bad and is actually like PayPal'.... Nope, some weeks later, I get a charge back notification from Stripe because the card holder claims that that the transaction wasn't authorised by them. Having got hold of Stripe to clear this up; after all, I had messages from the 'buyer' stating the intent, Stripe washed their hands of the situation, claiming to be simply the in-between agent. I stood to lose £100 because someone here didn't check the legitimacy of the buyer from either Facebook or Stripe's side of things. I ended up having to cut Stripe's permission to access my bank account as they were going to take the money regardless, so please, please do not use these useless cretins to deal with your payments, it all seems to be surrounded by scams.
Name: MICFIlms Entertainment
Reply: We're sorry to hear that you had to deal with a dispute—unfortunately, the card issuer has the final say and Stripe is not involved in the outcome of the dispute. We provide tips and recommendations that can help prevent disputes and fraud https://stripe.com/docs/disputes/prevention and how to respond to them: https://stripe.com/docs/disputes/responding

Content: I'm the Board Chair for a IRS registered 501c3 non-profit and we had to setup an account through Stripe because our donation site was directly integrated with them. After a month of getting Stripe setup and back/forth with their customer support to receive special non-profit pricing... our account became restricted and then disabled due to "charge disputes" and being "high risk".  There was one charge on the account. It was literally me testing the donation site via my own personal credit card to make sure everything worked smoothly between the donation site/Stripe/our bank account.  I refunded the charge to myself and was immediately flagged by Stripe. Meanwhile our donation site was down, unable to accept in-kind donations, right after we had published it.

Title: Responded in a timely manner

Content: Expected my first payout on Friday September 2nd. It didn't arrive. Payment was for quite a large sum of money. Spoke with Stripe representative who didn't have a clue what was going on and told me in 24 hours the matter would be resolved. The matter was that Stripe were trying to pay out to my 16 digit USD account number. Because I'm currently located in Poland - Stripe Poland were DELETING 2 of those digits (they call it 'stripping out 2 digits') which the receiving bank - Transferwise needed to receive the payout successfully. So it's now in a constant circle of payout leaves Stripe and tries to go to the receiving bank (receiving bank can't receive it as the account number details - 16 digits - don't match up). Then after 5 days money comes back and because Stripe can't update the account number successfully - the money keeps getting sent to the wrong account number. Unbelievable but true. Now I have to proceed with legal action against - Stripe Ireland or Stripe Poland or maybe just Stripe?  Would not recommend these people as far as you could throw them. I've spoken to SIX representatives so far who really do not seem to know what they're doing.
Name: Paul Mc Keown

Content: Stripe is the best payment system that others should follow. I have only been working with Stripe for a few months, but during this time I have already managed to convince myself of the high professionalism of their support. At any time of the day or night, you can contact the support service via online chat and they will help you at the highest level - you will not be endlessly redirected to another technical support agent, as is usually the case with other stupid support services. For me, Stripe has become an example of who to look up to. Separately, I would like to note the speed of the validation process for your business - you just fill out all the necessary forms and you're done, you can start accepting payments. In addition, if in the process you are asked to undergo additional verification or provide some additional documents, then you will be sure that they will be considered immediately after you provide them, and not like it is with others - where you are answered by a stupid support agent once a week and your documents are checked for weeks or months. I have never seen such a high level of professionalism. Thank you Stripe Team.

Reply: We're so thrilled to hear about your experience! Thank you for the review, we're always happy to help in any way that we can.

Also, for some reason customers can make payments without putting in their name, address and phone number. This makes it impossible to match up the payment to the customer. Which in turn does not resinate with the customer very well when we could not apply their payment to the account. Customer Service with Stripe is basically non-exsistent unless you understand computer language. Since our business is closing because of the worker shortage, if I were to start over, I would NOT come back to Stripe for credit card processing.

Content: Stripe is a lifesaver in terms of ease of use for our digital products and services. We integrate it with Kajabi, and with a direct native integration, collecting credit card payments couldn't be easier! The one frustration I have is if we need to refund something for any reason, there are absolutely no exceptions that I've found where Stripe is also willing to refund their fees. Normally, this is fine. But we've had 2 instances where this was really detrimental. We have a high-ticket service with multiple payment options. A client accidentally paid in full, and needed to be refunded and placed on a payment plan. Without having the fees refunded, we'd incur double the fees for the same clients' payments, and Stripe would NOT refund the fees for the original purchase. For this reason, we had to use a different payment gateway altogether.
Name: Pualena Digital Design
Reply: Thank you Pualena, for your review. Unfortunately, a large portion of the underlying cost of payment processing is driven by fees assessed by banks and payment networks (like Visa and Mastercard).

Content: What Stripe is doing is absolutely criminal. They are withholding funds (52k) "under review" for 120 days, even after all the requested information has been provided to them. There is no dispute on the charges, nor is it a stolen card. Therefore, they have no reason to be withholding these funds. They have already taken out their processing fee, but we do not have access to our funds. Now they are threatening to close our account for being "high risk" (10k & over) and refund the money back to our client, minus their processing fee! We basically are paying Stripe $1500 to lose our biggest client. They are destroying small businesses left and right. Do not use this company! The customer service is a joke, and no one will help or communicate. They have disabled the chat function on their site. This is the worst experience with a company that I have ever seen.

Content: One day, I randomly received an e-mail stating that my website couldn't be found and that I needed to provide documentation that I am a legitimate business.  My URL has been in Stripe for a few years now and hasn't changed, so the most obvious answer here is that Stripe's servers (some of which are located in Ireland, as I learned from an extensive research process) underwent a change/update and now they couldn't load my website.  I explained in my first of many e-mail responses that I had a class of 50 students from all across the United States and world who were all access documents from my website as a part of the class I was teaching, so it's clear that my website works.  Delilah at Stripe Support, in particular, was insistent that I provide the following to prove that my business is legitimate:

It has been nothing but difficulties and headaches.  I've had to "prove" that I'm an actual organization multiple times and they withhold payments and balances until verification. Yet, while withholding my funds, they've collected their fees.  This slowed my ability to purchase uniforms-my kids had to run in their own top/bottoms for almost 3 weeks-pay for travel, and register for competitions.   Stripe finally released the funds only to withhold them again as I was preparing for the team to travel to Jr. Olympics.  Stripe is still currently withholding money from my organization (minus their fees) until I "verify" that the money is going to a business account despite uploading our bank documents multiple times and having already processed numerous transactions to the same account that I had to verify to open the account.  I've been running youth basketball and track for over a decade and never had as many problems as I've had this year. I WILL NEVER UTILIZE THIS PLATFORM  AGAIN.   You're better served using Zelle, PayPal, Square or even CashApp...never again!!!
Name: Kenneth B
Reply: Hey Kenneth, we're incredibly sorry to hear about your experience with your account verification, payouts, and lack of support. We'd like to escalate this to get this sorted for you—please email us directly at heretohelp@stripe.com with the title "Trustpilot Review" and we'll follow up as soon as we can.
Title: Stripe is terrible

Content: Hi, It was related to payment that was disputed by the client. It wasn't fear because he paid for the VIP ad for 1 month and after his period expired he disputed the payment. And we lost the dispute even though he had the VIP status for 1 month. The is the electronic service and it is hard to prove. I sent the emails to you but without success.
Name: Pencho P
Reply: Hey Pencho, we're sorry to hear about your experience with this dispute. We facilitate your participation in the dispute process by helping you select the best possible evidence for the dispute reason in the dashboard, and transmitting your evidence to the card network, but we do not make any decision about your dispute. For more details, we suggest visiting: https://support.stripe.com/questions/lost-dispute-faq.
Title: Disputed Payment

Content: I’ve been using Stripe for over a year and provide my clients with high level products & services as a licensed mental health professional & expert in my field. Out of nowhere they claimed I’m a banned business according to their terms and in the middle of my launch they state they are closing my account in 4 days. They have no way for me to talk to someone to prove I’m a legitimate service or to understand why they are doing this to me. I’m extremely disappointed as I have given them a lot of business. This is completely unacceptable.
Name: J.M.
Reply: Hi there — we certainly appreciate your situation is far from ideal. Please email us at heretohelp@stripe.com with a link to this review and we'd be more than happy to investigate this further for you.
Title: Closing my account with no warning or valid reason!

Content: Stripe has been processing payments for our business for about 6 years or so now.  We have come to know this is a very trustworthy , reliable company and security has never been a question for us or our clients and that is important . We were offered a stripe capital loan (I believe is what it was called)  and after we thought about it a little bit it just makes more sense than a bank or other type of financing route .  We started filling out some very basic questions and within no time at all we had funds available . It's seriously the most simple , straightforward process with very clear outline as to how it's going to work for repayment , the total cost of the loan etc . Right up front and no hidden goofy fees , no lengthy thousand question forms to fill out that require jumping through hoops and repaying is so easy it's just a percentage off the payments you receive and quite honestly it's barely noticable and that is it . Really! Just as good as a person could ask for in terms of business loans or other options I know of and really helpful if business is slow , or maybe you need to get some more equipment like we did  or repair things etc  . We're a lawn and landscape service and the overhead is unreal , the cost to keep equipment in good shape and trucks  it just never ends and we have found ourselves in need of a little help many times . We just finished paying off our 2md capital loan with stripe and I hope they will reach out to us again with another offer because we will certainly go for it a 3rd time with them . It's truly been a great experience and the customer service at Stripe is such a pleasure to work with and they are on top of things , quick!  I can't say enough about the relationship we have with stripe and how much they have been a huge part of the continued success of our business and it's comforting to know that you can count on them with confidence when it comes to payment processing , financing or any other service you may utilize with them  . Thank you Stripe!

Reply: Hey there — we understand how frustrating disputes can be. However, these are initiated by the customer's bank. The card network proceeds to debit Stripe for the payment, which in turn requires Stripe to debit your Stripe account balance. You can find more information about the dispute process here: https://stripe.com/docs/disputes/how-disputes-work#receiving-a-dispute.

Content: As a payment processor, Stripe has high availability and provides a good dashboard for viewing transactions and statements. The BIG downside to Stripe is that credit card fees are not refunded in the event a customer refund is issued. Other processors DO refund these fees and that's a big thumbs down for Stripe.
Name: Aaron
Reply: Hi Aaron, we appreciate the importance of fees refunded in the event of a refund. However, A large portion of the underlying cost of payment processing is driven by fees assessed by banks and payment networks (like Visa and Mastercard). These networks set rules about which fees apply for refunded payments, and in many cases banks and card networks keep the entire upfront cost of a refunded transaction. For some regions and payment types, refunded payments also incur additional fees.
Title: Good, but doesn't refund processing fees

Content: You were a 5 star until, I have no protection from thief .......There is no legitimate reason for this dispute. The customer purchased furniture online from my website on Sunday, May 29,  2022. I emailed the customer to ask if I could call him so we could review the order.  We went over the order and he verified everything was correct. I called the manufacturer to place the order on Monday, May 30th 2022. The sales representative said 75% of the order is in stock and 25% is on backorder until the end of July. I called the customer back to let him know and he said that would be no problem so I proceeded with placing his full order. The furniture was fully paid for and the customer was aware that 75% was scheduled to be delivered to our store on June 9, 2022. We received the delivery from the manufacturer on June 9th. We always inspect the furniture before we sign off, if something is damaged we simply reject but we did not see damage to any of the pieces.
Name: Ricky R
Reply: Hey Ricky—we definitely understand the frustration here. Stripe may have limited scope in certain dispute matters if a customer goes through their bank. You can read about preventing disputes here: https://stripe.com/docs/disputes/prevention. Here are some additional resources about Disputes and how Stripe handles these: https://support.stripe.com/topics/disputes. We're happy to help with any issues or questions. Email us at heretohelp@stripe.com.

Content: Stripe hold payments for months, currently waiting on 2 months worth of payments. They previously asked to verify our website despite being a client for years. Yet they continue to hold payments, this is what happens when a monopoly is established. We use Xero for book keeping, Xero own Stripe. My recommendation use someone else’s payment gateway. These guys don’t care enough to even contact you before holding payments. Their call centre process is a joke, overseas (Philippines) and they don’t seem to understand the most basic communication. Go careless and others are much more efficient. Give Stripe the wide berth if considering a payment gateway, ohh and they don’t answer emails, nor do they have a phone number so you can contact them.

Content: I received my review email from Stripe, I believe it’s natural as a small business owner to get anxiety about the review. Our small business as many others faced hardship when Covid hit our Country. We lost many accounts along with closing our online business, ONLY utilizing local sales as our primary source of income. The Stripe review team did not require but highly favored our business going back online, revamping our website and social presence. While in the beginning I admit I was concerned because of the additional work it may involve in the time frame I had with my own scheduling. To my surprise, we instantly had new business request coming in, once we started our social pages again, we immediately began getting work estimate request as well. Our previous clients we’re waiting to see us again. I wrote the kind team at Stripe thanking them for reviewing our business and urging us to get our online presence back up and running. If it was not for the review and high recommendation, we will still be stuck in the same local circle, which that is wonderful, but the push gave us more revenue instantly and new clients. I rate Stripe as the BEST for any business, small or large, they have solutions for every business. Just go to the website and look around at all the new tools available, call the customer service team, talk with them about your business needs, trust the process, because they will not lead you wrong. Best regards everyone, I hope my review encourages others.
Name: Ron W
Reply: Hey Ron—thank you for sharing how Stripe has improved your business, as well as for this detailed and excellent review! We sincerely appreciate it, and please let us know if there is anything else we can assist with!

Title: The ease of use is fantastic

Content: I've been a Stripe user for almost a decade, imo the experience is going downhill.  The simple and "just works" API is getting more and more complicated and complex with changes that don't really need to be changes, feature bloat, etc.  The killer was the decision to not refund user issued refunds - especially during covid.  That crushed many small businesses and destroyed any goodwill and loyalty I had to Stripe.  I've sent millions of dollars in transaction volume through you guys via clients, recommends, and my own apps.  So, I'm a little salty about the decline of what was one of the very best tech products ever created.  But, I guess this is just the path that tech co's get as the founders get further from the product and you have to meet your milestones.

Title: Great experience but the customer…

Content: Having suffered from a recent card testing attack, I had the opportunity to engage Stripe support.  I learned a lot in the experience.  I detected the incident before Stripe and engaged them and received in response boilerplate instructions on mitigating such incidents.  I contacted Stripe after shutting down the exploited WooCommerce product expecting assistance with shutting down the two successfully tested credit cards.  I discovered this responsibility was all on me through the refund process with a fraud tag.  I also thought I was secure after shutting down one product and quickly implementing email verification, however the attack returned with vengeance resulting in 50 successful testings and prompting a complete shutdown of site commerce.  Refunds resulted in a negative balance as Stripe gets to keep its fees even on fraudulent transactions.  Switching to my staging site I was able to securely implement email verification, transfer to live, and put the attacks to bed for now (3 weeks).  To be fair, Stripe was very responsive, and their information was helpful, however I was disappointed with the absence  of indemnification which I assumed was part of our agreement.  Fortunately the cost of the lesson was minimal.
Name: Mark D
Reply: Hey Mark, we're incredibly sorry to hear about your experience with using our services and our support in general. If you still need any help with this or any other issues, please feel free to email us at heretohelp@stripe.com with "Trustpilot Review" in the subject line, and we'll follow up with you directly to assist.
Title: Card testing lesson

Content: I thought stripe was a good way to pay when using facebook marketplace, but i soon realised why all the bad reviews were coming in on this website. The person who bought my item was obviously a fraud artist, with their facebook profile being suspicious, the name on the profile and delivery name didnt match up, and their account was deleted after a few months. I did not realise this until my purchase was complete, however. I got an email from stripe saying that a fraud case had been started, they were going to take the money back and include a fee until it was resolved. The customer had used many different cards, neither of which worked. How this is my issue and not the customers, i’m not sure. I rang customer service and they told me all the proof I needed to submit, which I did, and was told I was likely to win. Cut to a few months later, I receive an email stating that the bank has rejected my case and that I will not be getting my money back. This is an absolute scam and I will NOT be using this service again. I am a student struggling to make money, trying to sell something for £37, which I then lose and also get charged £15 on top for absolutely no reason. I wasn’t the one to commit fraud so how can I even be charged for this! An absolute outrage.
Name: Katie
Reply: Hi Katie — we're sorry to hear your experience has been less than positive. That being said, there seems to be some confusion here. As mentioned in your review, the bank rejected the claim. Stripe does not offer users a dispute process, the users bank owns that. When a dispute is created with a bank, Stripe is obligated to reverse the payment. While we do all we can to help Stripe users, including submitting evidence to the dispute, the final decision rests solely with the bank and we have no recourse there. We'd suggest contacting Facebook who faciliated the initial sale for assistance. Thank.
Title: Fraudsters will use this site and scam you of your money, beware!

Content: I cannot overstate how frustrating it is that Stripe keep their fees on refunded payments.
Name: Niall S
Reply: Thank you for the feedback, Niall. Unfortunately, a large portion of the underlying cost of payment processing is driven by fees assessed by banks and payment networks (like Visa and Mastercard). These networks set rules about which fees apply for refunded payments, and in many cases banks and card networks keep the entire upfront cost of a refunded transaction.

Content: We recently experienced 3 counts of online fraud which has cost our business over $25,000 in cash and products combined. After looking in the back end of Stripe with a fine tooth comb it has come to our attention that the CVC check was removed in Dec 2021 by yourselves in an attempt to make businesses more money. If this check was kept there and we were given the choice via an important email communication to accept the change or not, rather than a small notification in the back end, we would've saved ourselves a lot of grief and hassle and money. These things in future should be communicated directly to business owners as they are a big deal. The banks take no responsibility for this and we believed we were using a very safe platform.

Title: Stripe is the BEST!

Content: Stripe state your first transaction will take 7 -14 days to clear but fail to mention that all subsequent transactions will take 7 days until you “qualify” for faster payments. Customer support was scripted, unhelpful and could not seem to provide tangible information or where to read regarding their vague and skewed rules. Stripe charge a high fee per transaction so to hold on to a businesses cash for 7 days as standard is unacceptable. Once my pending payments have cleared I will cancel. I would not recommend at all,  avoid if you can.
Name: Shantel Russell
Reply: Hi Shantel! Your payout speed depends on your country and the industry you're in. You can check the standard payout timings here: https://stripe.com/docs/payouts#payout-speed. Depending on your location, you can check your eligibility for accelerated payouts by logging into the Dashboard.
Title: Stripe hold on to all transactions for 7 days as standard

Content: Too many stupid rules, they keep finding reasons to delay payouts and their fees aren't so low to justify that. You wait the time for a payout and then you have to wait the same amount of time again because of some stupid made up rule they have. Their fees aren't so low to justify all their nonsense rules. I will be using Revolut Business' payment links.

They have not told me which of the restricted business controls I am meant to have breached and there is no comeback or discussion. Title: The holding back of Reserved Funds…

Content: I find the fees very expensive and the time delays on receiving funds is very long. I had a gust stay with me recently for a week. His payment went through stripe, I received his money after he had left.
Name: Don C
Reply: Hi Don — we appreciate your feedback! We do try to be transparent and competitive with our fees. That said, the processing fee is actually split between Stripe and the card networks with a large portion actually going to them. You can however, pass the fee onto your customer. For more on how to do that, please see here: https://support.stripe.com/questions/passing-the-stripe-fee-on-to-customers. In relation to processing times, payout speeds vary depending on the Country, but eligible users can avail of Instant and Accelerated payout options. For more on that, please see here: https://stripe.com/docs/payouts.  Thanks.
Title: I find the fees very expensive and the…

Content: The number of failed (lost) Payments and blocked payments is high.
Name: Peter B
Reply: Hi Peter — failed payments could be down to a number of possibilities. From bank declines, to high risk cards. Your Stripe dashboard should provide more information on each failed payment. That said, we're more than happy to take a closer look at that for you. Feel free to email us at heretohelp@stripe.com with a link to this review. Thanks.
Title: The number of failed (lost) Payments…

Content: I cannot recommend steering clear of this company enough. I was messed around by them for a number of months and if I read one more disingenuous, long-winded stock email thanking me for “reaching out” I am going to scream. Thanks to them I am down £50 for an item sold via facebook marketplace. There was a simple typo in my email address when setting up my account that they were unable to rectify, so - after many emails back and forth assuring me that they were going to fix the problem - they refunded the buyer MY money. I found the whole process incredibly stressful. It may not seem like much money but we are a single income family so I was selling personal items to be able to afford a special gift for my twins 1st birthday. I am genuinely disgusted by this company.
Name: Clara Midgley

Content: Stripe will ask you for evidence when people claim for their money back after using and benefiting from your services. Regardless of how accurate your supporting documents are, Stripe will let the cardholder institution have the last word, and close the case immediately without giving you an opportunity to appeal. Additionally, if you ever get in touch with someone from customer service from any of the parties involved, they’ll ask you to contact the opposite party; as a result, nobody can be held accountable when this occurs and the service you provided won’t be compensated despite supporting evidence and/or signed agreement you and your client had. Extremely disappointed in Stripe that already gets a couple of 10K of my business, and won’t fight for a couple of hundreds.
Name: Heydy Saavedra. Online school
Reply: Hey there — we understand that this isn't ideal. However, when it comes to disputes, Stripe can only act as a facilitator. We provide all the information that is requested by the customer's bank, but have no say in the outcome or the process. Again, we appreciate that this isn't ideal, but our scope is limited in the decision of a dispute.
Title: Stripe won’t fight for your money, but will gladly take it

Content: I set up a fundraiser on Fundly. To show support for my own cause and build credibility with donors, I donated $1,000 to my own fundraiser. Suddenly, Stripe disables my payment account and I can no longer accept donations. They gave me no warning and no explanation. After dozens of emails and over a week, they responded that "my business" (I am an individual) has an elevated risk of dispute charges. They refunded all of my donors' payments, except for my own $1,000 donation for some reason. Again, after dozens of emails, they gave me no explanation other than above. They originally told me they would hold my money for 5-7 days. That came and went and after more emails, they responded they are holding my money now for 120 days. It is absolute insanity and wreaks of theft, fraud, and extortion. They already ruined my reputation with my friends and family regarding my cause, and now they're holding $1,000 of my own hard-earned money. DO NOT USE FUNDLY and DO NOT TRUST STRIPE. Someone needs to shut them down.

Reply: Hi Brandon, we're incredibly sorry the experience has been less than positive here. We'd like to take a second look at your account from our end. Please email us directly at heretohelp@stripe.com with the subject "Trustpilot review", and we'll follow up as soon as possible.

Content: Stripe works well for our business. The payments are easy to process for our customers and arrive in our bank in a few days. I do wish the fees were not deducted before the money is deposited in our bank account. It makes reconciling the account very time consuming to deduct every fee from the payments in Quickbooks Online. Quickbooks Payments deducts the fee as a separate item from the payment being deposited in our account. The job scheduling app we have uses Stripe so it works. Just another step in the bookkeeping process to make it work.

Title: The Stripe Team is very trustworthy

Content: So far not positive, we created a Stripe account roughly 4+ weeks ago and started accepting payments via Stripe. We set up our bank account that we use with our PayPal account and setup weekly payouts for Stripe. First payout date passed and we receive no payment, chatted with Stripe and was informed it may take one payout cycle for things to start working. Second weekly payout was missed, contacted Stripe and was informed bank account provided was incorrect, they need another one which we just happen to have more than one account for our business so we provided that to them. Missed third payout and Stripe wanted proof of ownership of the bank account which we provided. Missed fourth payout Stripe wants annual volume projections, copies of current payment process statements for 6-12 month, detailed explanation of how we process order, compete list of third party companies we use.... Stripe has been removed from our website and they still hold 4 weeks of payment processed. They should not have started processing payments if they required ALL of this additional information prior to payouts. NOT RECOMMENDED.
Name: Paul M
Reply: Hey Paul, we're very sorry to hear about this experience with your account and your payouts. We'd like to take a closer look at this to assist—please email us directly at heretohelp@stripe.com and we'll follow up as soon as we can.

Content: I think stripe is cool but honestly the software is not clear and concise at all. You constantly have to call and get help with your customer service department. They outsource these calls to different countries so you’ll be lucky if you get someone on the phone that actually is able to help you properly. I love everyone no matter what color they are so please don’t take this the wrong way when I say this. I have terrible ADHD and it’s really hard for me to understand the accents of some of these people that they outsource these phone calls to. The people sound like they’re just rolling out of bed and that they really don’t even want to be bothered. Honestly I never fully understand what they’re even explaining to me. It’s a combination of stripes software not being clear and concise or user-friendly and a combination of the fact that they outsource these calls to people in different countries.  I never feel like I fully know what’s going on with my Stripe account. This is really sad. If I could find another company that does payments with more clear and concise software I will absolutely leave Stripe in a heartbeat . Since I’ve had stripe for years they’ve done nothing to try to make the software better. It’s exhausting to even be a part of stripe.
Name: Sada Marshall
Reply: Hey there, we're incredibly sorry the experience has been less than positive here. We'd like to take a second look at your account from our end. Please email us directly at heretohelp@stripe.com with this review link, and we'll follow up as soon as possible.

Content: horrible chargeback experience. First off they take 70+ days "to allow time for the bank to respond" ( AMEX takes 21 days MAX to respond so that is a lie). Then they said I lost when I provided all info to show customer made purchase, it was shipped and delivered. We even had a documented dialogue about it afterwards. $2500 lost, NEVER AGAIN!
Name: Alejandro Paret
Reply: Hey there—we understand that this isn't ideal. However, when it comes to disputes, Stripe can only act as a facilitator. We provide all the information that is requested by the customer's bank, but have no say in the outcome or the process. Again, we appreciate that this isn't ideal, but our scope is limited in the decision of a dispute.
Title: horrible chargeback experience

Content: We've been using Stripe for over two years and haven't had any issues. It's been easy to contact them, which is extremely important to us, and we always learn from having them show us how to find the information we're seeking. We use Stripe because our reservation software company recommended them and we have no reason to change.  We can easily recommend them to others.

Content: I run a small business. My customer mistakenly placed an order for $6000 over night. The correct value of the order was $900. I refunded the customer the full value of the order, acknowledging that it was an innocent mistake. I then contacted Stripe to request a refund of the fees that I had paid on the $6000 ($150) payment transaction on the basis that it was an innocent mistake and I could not ethically or reasonably charge the customer (also a small business) such high processing fees. The response, "our Stripe polices does not cover the funds as it was not an error from our end."

Name: Ann Marie
Reply: Hey there, we're sorry to hear that you had to deal with a dispute. Unfortunately, the card issuer has the final say and Stripe is not involved in deciding the outcome of the dispute; we only play a role by conveying the evidence. In our documentation, we provide tips and recommendations that can help prevent disputes and fraud https://stripe.com/docs/disputes/prevention and how to respond to them when they come in: https://stripe.com/docs/disputes/responding. We hope this helps.
Title: When Pts dispute a charge

Content: Our organization was looking to bring our various online payment systems under a single umbrella and attempted to use Stripe to do this. While the set up and integration with our current sales system was simple, we found it very difficult to produce useable, easy-to-read reports that would show for each sale the original sale price, the fees deducted, and the final revenue number. After a couple of weeks of frustration in trying to make the reporting work, we reverted back to our original system.

Their overreach went so far as stating I would have to remove items from my website in order to maintain my Account with them - When those items are not bound or restricted by any sort of law or legislation (Items such as Muzzle brakes). They went so far as to say I needed to remove advertising on my own website!

Content: Editing my review because I did not know I was writing a review the first time. I thought I was providing feedback for a single issue.
Name: Dobber
Reply: Hey there, thanks for writing in about this. If you issue a full refund on a charge before a dispute happens, it is no longer possible for the cardholder to dispute it—so you are protected from any future dispute or dispute fee. Once a cardholder initiates a dispute, however, it is no longer possible to avoid the fee. We're sorry about the inconvenience this may have caused.
Title: Top Notch

Content: As a seller you will lose every dispute with stripe.  You can supply evidence that the package was delivered and the customer was happy with their purchase.  Stripe will side against you every single time.  Their system is completely broken.  Awful choice for any seller.
Name: Ty
Reply: Hey Ty, we're sorry to hear that you had to deal with a dispute. Unfortunately, the card issuer has the final say and Stripe is not involved in deciding the outcome of the dispute; we only play a role by conveying the evidence. In our documentation, we provide tips and recommendations that can help prevent disputes and fraud https://stripe.com/docs/disputes/prevention and how to respond to them when they come in: https://stripe.com/docs/disputes/responding. We hope this helps.
Title: Dispute resolution is AWFUL

Content: We are having lots of problems with the account.  We tried to cancel our old version and start over so that we could change the set up to allow folks to manage their own accounts. Also - the failure to be notified about transactions has also upset several members because their donation/membership has not been acknowledged by the Museum. We were told that folks who used the webpage to do those things would get a confirmation from Stripe and that isn't happening.  Right now - until we get things fixed - we are not happy with Stripe. Content: WARNING Do not use Stripe!! We sold an Xbox to a buyer who paid through stripe. Item was sent the same day tracked and after day 4 the buyer was still not in to receive it. They then messaged me to ask if the item could be directed to his sister which I refused to do so he lodged a fraud claim against me. Stripe blocked my access despite me proving who I was and when I challenged the buyer he said he wasn’t a fraud. The next day hey presto item received. I proved the item went tracked, all conversations and proof of delivery but the buyers bank found in his favour so I’m now out of pocket to the tune of £200 and without the item. I’m now in a position where I’m having to get a solicitor and the financial ombudsman involved as well as the police. Stripe at no point stepped in to look logically at the case and think yeah item received so how could it be fraudulent. Buyers are not vetted either only the seller is requested to prove who they are. Use at your own risk!!
Name: Clare Rowett
Reply: Hi—we're sorry to hear about the lack of attention you received from us during this frustrating situation. Please email us directly at heretohelp@stripe.com and we'll follow up as soon as we can to get this sorted for you and prevent this from happening in the future.
Title: WARNING Do not use Stripe!

Content: DREADFUL DO NOT USE FOR ANYTHING. Being offered this company via Facebook as a alternative to PayPal (because you can’t use PayPal or anyone else) for Facebook Marketplace. They offer no clarity on who is paying you, so you have to use the details you receive from Facebook chat…. Basically “a buyer” was able to access someone else’s account ON STRIPE and used there account to purchase an item from me!! Now STRIPE are telling me that’s it’s my responsibility and I have to pay the monies back, PLUS additional fees because of there Lapses in addressing fraud and fraudsters accessing accounts! As I was a new user of STRIPE they advised they would sit on my funds for almost 10 working days to ensure the transaction was agreed. Then they paid the funds into my account….Bang on the 11th day the transaction was fraudulent according to STRIPE and they wanted all this evidence from me and they wanted to charge for the fact the transaction was fraudulent. SO MY ADVICE IS DON’T USE THEM FULLSTOP. I have the feeling the good reviews on here are probably people who work for META. Even the UK Fraud Action line advises not to use them and my Bank. If only I knew about this before trusting Facebook META… just one big fraudulent company.

Content: I have had 1 order on Stripe through a company they partner with, Buy Me A Coffee for over $100. Stripe claims it is not authorized. I know the person who made the order on this platform to show support of my work. She has sent them ten emails, as have I, showing it is authorised by her and her bank. They keep sending form messages and killed my account WHILE ALSO refusing to immediately refund her. Again my one and only order. No fraud or chance of fraud. Every time we message support they have no clue what is going on and send more form messages and claim the order through Buy Me A Coffee has been flagged by them, no effort to listen to the client. Since they have told me the lone order was why they are killing my account it is completely insane and unethical. Of course no phone number to call. Worst service, worst support. Terrible is an understatement.

Content: They take the transaction fee on refunds, which is essentially stealing from merchants. NO OTHER PAYMENT METHOD DO THIS! STRIPE IS A SCAMMER PLATFORMS
Name: Jamal Singh
Reply: Hi Jamal — we do make this clear on our pricing page: https://stripe.com/pricing#faqs and are transparent when it comes to fees. The transaction fee is split between Stripe, banks and card networks, so it's not something we can refund as the entire fee is not issued to Stripe. For more, please see here: https://support.stripe.com/questions/understanding-fees-for-refunded-payments. That being said, we do have documentation available to help Stripe users pass that fee onto the customer during the final charge: https://support.stripe.com/questions/passing-the-stripe-fee-on-to-customers. Thanks.

Title: Before signing up with Stripe

Content: I used to feel more secure with Stripe, but lately I've been feeling very uneasy using their service. Seems there are always issues with the site or the app. I started using them because they now have Instant Payout (payments can be sent to your bank instantly for an additional 1%) but then a few months ago, they suddenly stopped allowing you to switch payment cards to send payments to your account - sneaky and shady too, they didn't give anyone any warning first, so one weekend, I had to wait 5-6 days to get my "instant" payout!! That's because they don't allow more than 1 payment card at a time and when you switch cards, it takes a few days to be activated and since I split my payments into 2 different banks, I used to always swap the card and send the rest all at the same time... So I ended up having to contact them and they eventually fixed my account so I didn't have to wait like that, but it was a real shock how they made such a sudden change with no warning. And ever since then I've felt like I lost confidence in their service, you never know when they might change something that's extremely important, on a dime with no warning...

I'm not really sure what to do with that information but it's also near impossible to talk to anyone at stripe so go figure.

Name: Sunday O
Reply: Hi there! We're sorry to hear about the dispute on your account. When a payment is disputed by a card holder, their bank notifies us and credits the transaction for the card holder. In an email and through your dashboard, we then share information we have received from the bank so that you can present evidence supporting the legitimacy of the payment. That said, we only convey the evidence to the card holder's bank and have no power over the final decision. These decisions are made by the banks.

Title: stripe is affordable and easy to use

Content: Customer Service & Fraud detection was Unsatisfactory. In Oct 2021, there was an error that a customer made and they added too many zeros to the amount they were trying to process in our online payment system. We refunded them the full amount  as it has not reached our bank yet and we thought it was not fully processed. Stripe kept the fee even though the amount processed never reached our bank account. But it was deemed as a successful transaction. We were left to incur the whole fee amount. We asked to speak to a manager multiple times and we were put through numerous levels of customer service. The API failed to detect a large amount that should never have been put through so fraud detection also fell short. One week later, a marketing email was sent to us letting us know that there is now a fraud protection plan if we decide to sign up. This large transaction should never have gone through in the first place if API was working properly.
Name: GHWD
Reply: We're very sorry to hear about the experience you had with the accidental payment.

We are thankful we signed up years ago, it truly has helped.

Content: Very unhappy with Stripe and its policies.  If a charge is put through in error- there is no grace period (even 5 minutes) to correct the error without being charged.  By accident, an associate put through a few invoices at 86% sales tax as opposed to 6%.  The error was realized instantaneously and reversed.  We were charged over $200 for this one instance.  However after speaking and emailing with Stripe representatives we were basically told- too bad that's how it is.  if I had the choice to use any other company on our platform I would switch.
Name: Jodie F
Reply: Hi Jodie! We completely understand where you're coming from, and hope that we can implement a grace period to accidental charges moving forward.

Title: Very frustrating to try to resolve an…

Content: I have never even heard of stripe until 2 months ago. A customer made a mistake and for some reason though I have a account with stripe and made the payment before asking me. And stripe accepted the payment. How can a company accept a payment to a account that doesn't even exist?. After I informed my customer that I don't use stripe they tried getting a refund but had a difficult time. Next I received a email from stripe saying they have my money and I just need to open an account with them to receive my money. Otherwise my customer would have to wait over a week to get a refund. I did not want my customer to get stuck dealing with stripe to get their money back, I decided what the heck I will just open an account with them. I thought it was like PayPal or cashapp. So I attempted to open a account with them. Opening an account with them to receive my money was a ridiculous process, first they wouldn't release my funds unless I had a business website which I don't because I am a contractor and don't need one. I don't sell products online I remodel homes and my clientele comes from word of mouth. Second reason they said they couldn't give me my funds was because I don't have a tax id number which by law if I my business is a sole proprietorship I can use my ssn instead. They wouldn't accept that. So I called their customer service and said I want the money refunded to customer and I don't want to open an account with them anymore because they are making it impossible for me. I thought that was done and over with until couple days they pulled a high fee from my bank account for a transaction that I didn't even receive my money from. How can company accept payment when the receiving party doesn't even have a account with them? That's ridiculous. Anyways I called stripe to get a refund for that "transaction" where I didn't even receive money because of stripes impossible rules. They denied me. Anyways I forgot this whole thing and yesterday I find out my bank card has been hacked and unauthorized transactions were made. I call my bank and start investigating and my bank tells me that the service merchant behind these fraudulent transaction was STRIPE. So either my info somehow got leaked from them or they are doing something shady. Anyways I just wanted to get paid for a job I did and stripe made my life very difficult when I tried working with them to open a account but they make it almost impossible to open a account unless you meet their ridiculous demands. Protect your money and don't do business with them. Cash app, Venmo, even PayPal is way way easier and better to deal with.
Name: Vito
Reply: Hi Vito, we would only charge a fee for a transaction if a payment was processed. As for your bank details, we can assure you, we take the upmost precaution of keeping them safe and do not in any circumstances share that information. We're more than happy to review the fee issue further. Please email us at heretohelp@stripe.com with the subject line "Trustpilot review" and we can go from there. Thanks.
Title: Don't do business with this company.

Title: Experience is 5 stars

Content: Stripe paused payouts to my bank account 2 weeks ago because my website was not accurately listed with them.  It was, I only have 1 website, and it's listed accurately. Since I've pointed that out to them and they keep telling me the review is complete, and they affirm that I've done everything on my end and I should hear back within 24 to 48 hours.  Well, every day I reach back out and they can not seem to give me an answer as to why the pause has not been lifted.  I am a US-based corp. with an EIN and not in a restricted business with a verified phone and have done everything they've asked.  If they would provide real answers to me with real reasons why the pause is still active we could help resolve this challenge, instead, zero progress has been made in 2 weeks and payouts to my bank are still paused for absolutely no reason.  Each of the 6 customer support reps I've spoken with is not able to provide a solution or any options for any support.  Reject my account, lift the pause or give me direction on how I can help.  Just leaving a client in limbo for 2 weeks is unacceptable.  For this reason, I give 1 star.  Don't use this company, they'll tell you they care but then do absolutely nothing to support that statement.
Name: Edward M
Reply: Hi Edward—we're sorry to hear that you've had an experience like this with us. If you'd like, please email us directly at heretohelp@stripe.com with this Trustpilot review link. We'll follow up to take a second look at your account.

Title: Easy for our customers to use

Content: We have used Stripe for over a year to manage payments for Art Deco HouseUK, a high end self catering property. The tool is good for sending out invoices and receiving payments with helpful tools for creating invoices. The problem we have however, if you want to create pages for payments, use QR codes for people to pay directly for items and so on, you need to have developer skills. We do not, so reluctantly for such payments we use a competitor's platform when we would rather have used Stripe. So for example, we have an honesty bar, guests scan a QR code to open a page and then use free text to put in what they bought and the price they are paying which they got from the price tag on the bottle. There is no way we could ever facilitate this in Stripe. But, if all you want it a reliable tool to send out invoices, collect payments etc, STRIPE if great, although not exactly intuitive, unless you have developer and finance skills.
Name: Art Deco HouseUK (Laurence)

Content: We are a major U.S residential water filtration product retailer and we just upgraded our website and integrated the Stripe API. After running for approximately a month with thousands of dollars of balance waiting for the scheduled payout date. And here we go, I received the identity verification requested by Stripe. Within the given time frame, I logged in and tried the verification link but leads to a page that says there is nothing for you to verify at this moment.
Name: Maxson Liu
Reply: Hey there! We are sorry that this was your experience with us.
Title: Avoid this BS company, although they fixed it

Content: After reading the horror stories about this company here I was smart and tested them on the first payment with my own card for 1000 quid. Of course, seconds later I was asked to verify my identity. I did it, from my phone, selfie included. Again seconds later, probably because I am of Chinese descendants, the account was totally suspended and I was asked to enter my card for yet another verification. I did it. I got some copy/paste answers by email, my access to the live help was cut off and now nothing, I can't even refund my own money back. It is unbelievable that a company as big as Stripe discriminates based on the skin color in 2022. SHAME!
Name: Chi-Yin Poon
Reply: Hey there! We are sorry that this was your experience with us, and we take discrimination reports very seriously.
Title: HORROR

Content: Really disappointed by the service. All was good until I got attacked by a card tester, then I had to wait for two days until Stripe gave me a clear answer about fees being unrefundable to me. So I got to pay the fees for the attacker. I chat with three different people, everyone of them said they "escalated" the issue and that I had to wait for the email support to contact me. Still waiting, meanwhile the attack was still going and fees adding up. Until now someone on the chat simply told me that those fees are unrefundable by Stripe. Cool. Would've been nice to tell that to me right away when I first asked for it so I could close the attacked page.
Name: Mathias Paicheler
Reply: Hey Mathias, we're incredibly sorry the experience has been less than positive here. We'd like to take a second look at your account from our end. Please email us directly at heretohelp@stripe.com with this Trustpilot review link, and we'll follow up as soon as possible.
Title: Really disappointed by the service

Content: Dogsh*t company that holds onto your money for a significant amount of time, and really won't give any valid reason for this, doesn't stick to its' terms and had also set my first few payments up in EURO's(I'm in the UK)

Content: Stripe is awful. I sold an ipad on facebook marketplace, by the time it was delivered to the persons house, the 'cardholder' reported the transaction as fraudulent and unrecognised and the money was sent back to the 'customer', so now I have no ipad, and no money that I am owed.
Name: Charlotte
Reply: Hi Charlotte - we appreciate that's far from an ideal situation. That being said, if the cardholder raises a dispute, that dispute is processed through the bank. We have no input into the decision the bank makes but do assist Stripe users in uploading as much evidence as possible for the bank to review. For more on disputes, please see here: https://stripe.com/docs/disputes/how-disputes-work.
Title: Stripe is awful

Content: This has been the worst experience I’ve ever encountered. Horrible customer service. They still owe me funds that they refuse to send to me. This has been a nightmare.

Title: This has been the worst experience I’ve…

Content: Never ever go for this scam process. They are simple doing scam in name of review profile.

Reply: NA
Title: Never ever go for this scam process

Content: I used to like Stripe a lot, payments were easy, quick transfers to my account, and now they freeze your money for reserves to supposedly protect buyers. Nobody has to protect my clients because I'm honest. However, if I do commit fraud, the courts, not Stripe, are in charge of resolving any disputes. freezing my money for two months and not paying interest for it is unfair. I do not recommend!
Name: Victoria Winter
Reply: Hi Victoria — while we certainly appreciate your frustration here, reserves placed due to disputes are to ensure that funds are available to cover future refunds or disputes if a business does not have enough funds in its Stripe balance. This type of reserve is routine and does not impact your ability to continue accepting payments with Stripe. That said, we're more than happy to review the specifics of your situation. Please email us at heretohelp@stripe.com with the subject line "Trustpilot review" and we can go from there. Thanks.
Title: I do not recommend!

Content: To all the people who have had their money blocked on stripe, I am initiating a collective legal action against stripe, we are now over 120 people in the group.

Content: They insisted my radio station on MIXCLOUD was pornography and denied me payment processing on tips. I appealed and kept getting a circle of responses, first I had to create an express account (why?!) and then email them there, when I explained it was for a mixcloud, they said theyd get back to me. Rinse and repeat THREE TIMES. Worst user support I have EVER experienced. Don't ask me to email you again. I have emailed you like 20 times trying to fix this and I get sent jumping through hoops.

Reply: Hi there! We'd like to review your account again to see if we can resolve the issue. Please feel free to send us an email at heretohelp@stripe.com, with your details, and we'll be happy to investigate.

Content: Used stripe for a number of years and were ok.
Name: Greig McArthur
Reply: Hi Greig! Although Stripe transmits the evidence you provide against the dispute on your behalf, the dispute process, including the outcome, is managed entirely by the bank. The bank’s decision is final and cannot be appealed or challenged. While we'd like to help you out with this, there's nothing else we can do at this point.

Content: Don’t use this company they held $415,000 for a month and a half. I wasn’t able to pay my vendors on time and so I lost my discounts and it cost me an extra $50,000. I am a garden center and have less then 1% chargebacks so it is ridiculous for them to be holding my money. The whole point of credit card processing is to get your money quickly and that is definitely not what stripe does. They are still holding $56,000 in reserve. Business's rely on cash flow and that will not happen if you use stripe you are better off having your customers send you checks by carrier pigeons it would get to you faster.

We have ZERO disputes, no customer requesting a refund, no high risk payments... and they still hold our money for so long. Why not pay us then close our account instead? We started using Stripe because we thought it would be a good solution, but now this is hurting our business immensely.

Content: Several stolen cards were charged to our account. I made many attempts to sort this, including asking Stripe to refund ALL cards charged within a certain period. Most importantly, I asked Stripe STOP ANY FURTHER processing of cards. We pulled all online sales. This was completely ignored and up till today (after weeks and weeks) stolen cards are still being charged to our account. We are talking of about 60-80 cards within a 48 hour period. I've had angry strangers call me from out of the blues asking who we were and why we charged their cards.

If this is not related to a dispute, we'd be more than happy to review your situation further. Please email us at heretohelp@stripe.com with the subject line "Trustpilot review". Thanks.
Title: third-class service that only helps…

Content: The worst customer service I have ever dealt with! As a business, I always make it a point ensure that my customers are satisfied. Instead, Stripe uses a customer service provider which simply does not have the tools to service its customers. They tell you that they can make no exceptions to any policy (even if it is a very valid reason) and cannot connect you with a manager because their system will simply not allow them to transfer your call. When they told me that a Supervisor or “support manager” would reach out to call me, I got an email in which they said “hey sorry I tried to call you twice but you missed the call!” They never actually called me! And I have proof to back that claim up. I waited by the phone for 24+ hours for the call. This is so unprofessional of them. I am simply trying to resolve an instance of fraud, in which I am being cheated out of the 3% stripe fee! And there is no good support for this matter.

Reply: Hi there! Thank you so much for reaching out and sharing about your experience. We'd like to take a look at what might have happened in your case and help you out. Could you please send us a email at heretohelp@stripe.com with your account details so we can help you resolve the issue?

Content: I recently had to integrate Stripe Checkouts for my business, and to say that I have been impressed with both the product and the support is a major understatement.  To me, it's not the product you build, but the product that you support that makes it amazing.  Stripe's documentation is lights out fantastic, and when you need support it is literally right there in Discord.  I had 3 quick questions in my Checkout integration experience and each and every time I hopped onto Discord it was answered within a minute.  It was also answered the first time.  The people working there really knew their stuff and you got the sense that everyone was there to help you start a business.  I'm sold. <3

Title: Stripe.com is just the worst

Content: I've been using Stripe for years and never had any problems with them or the transactions they've processed from my website.  My website vendor flagged an order for potential fraud and indicated Stripe had sent the alert. The Stripe representative went through every detail of the transaction and confirmed it was fine, but they had not sent the alert. It was a large amount and product was being shipped internationally. Later in speaking to my website vendor, their shopping cart had actually triggered the alert because zip codes of the credit card and shipping address did not match. We were shipping it to a freight forwarder in our country. It was all good. We trust Stripe. They gave us clear answers and efficient support.
Name: Linda Brown
Reply: Thank you, Linda! We really appreciate you taking the time to share your experience with us. :)
Title: I've been using Stripe for years and…

Content: Not happy with service...very misleading time frame.  Says 'next day' and you get emails for the next three days saying funds are coming before they actually arrive in your account.  It's not the bank...it's stripe. Not pleased at all.
Name: Coral Gwyn-Williams
Reply: Hi Coral—happy to clarify! While payout schedule refers to the cadence your funds are paid out on (for example, day of the week), payout speed refers to the amount of time it takes for your funds to become available. The payout speed varies per country and is typically expressed as T+X days.

Title: Been using stripe for years

Content: Be careful with them! A client placed an order on our e-shop and paid in full for it. In the same date we have received an email from their support team asking for more information about our business (we use their platform for a couple of years), in the same date we have send them all info and details about our business and our products as they have requested. Since that none replied to us and to our email and none returned our calls with solid answer We are Starting a litigation with our attorney against them. Be careful and in my opinion use a different payment gateway.
Name: Carlo Weingrill
Reply: Hi Carlo—we regret to hear about this experience. Please send us at email at heretohelp@stripe.com with a link to your review and we'll look into your account as soon as we can.
Title: Be careful with them

Content: So I'm not a business or anything like that I sold an item on Facebook Marketplace and then a couple of days later, the customer was claiming that they didn't recognise the purchase which is ridiculous because they literally bought it from me so they were basically just trying to get a free iPhone from me and Stripe immediately refunded them the money and are nowing charging me a £15 dispute fee and the amount that iPhone sold for!! Absolutely ridiculous.  They should have to pay the dispute fee as I sold the item legitimately! It's not my fault the person who bought my iPhone is a terrible person and wants items that purchased originally for free. I contacted the support about it and they were absolutely useless with this. Basically just told me what I already read up on their website.  I will not be using Stripe again as it's terrible that they immediately side with the buyer even though they're lying! I have disputed it with the buyer's bank but it'll take 3 months for the bank to respond. I will stick to eBay from now on.
Name: Twisted Viper
Reply: Hey there—we understand that this isn't ideal. However, when it comes to disputes, Stripe can only act as a facilitator. We provide all the information that is requested by the customer's bank, but have no say in the outcome or the process. Again, we appreciate that this isn't ideal, but our scope is limited in the decision of a dispute.
Title: Stripe is terrible!

Content: Never use Stripe!!! It will create whole lots of business problems than answers. We are a boutique market research firm. We do not sell any product whatsoever; our customers only pay after receiving our services. Stripe claimed we are a high-risk merchant and refused to provide services for us while falsely claiming one of our payments was unauthorized by the customer. How do we know? Said transaction was done by the wife of one of our consultants. We repeatedly asked to close the account permanently and refund the money. However, the customer support team came up with different excuses and still held the money after ten days and refused to refund and close the account. Our legal team plans to report Stripe's financial misconduct to UK financial services and French Authorities in the next couple of days. Do Not use Stripe; it was once a great company, but it is sad how badly they are performing now.
Name: LR
Reply: Hi LR—we're sorry to hear this. We'd like to take another look at the transaction and your account, if you can write to us at heretohelp@stripe.com with a link to your review. Thank you.

Content: We started using stripe and accepted our first payment on March 21, 2022. We were so excited at the convenience this would bring our small business only to now feel hostage to the company. We have still not received a  single payout with very little explanation as to why and poor communication.  We understood that the first payout could take up to 14 days but we are now over 2 months. We have a different support person calling and emailing us with the same response “we apologize for any inconvenience. Your case is being reviewed by a specialist and we will be in touch with you.”  No follow-up, no explanation and no action and never does a “specialist” call us (despite several request) to explain anything. Our livelihood is tied up in this company and we have no way to access our funds. I’m so disappointed.
